story:
Planetary Consciousness

If people could only see the whole planet laid out in front of them, the extent of pollution, the weather patterns, seismic activities, ozone layer depletion, global climate change, polar ice cap melt, species extinction and even economic and political trends and movements, all  in one glance, it would go very far to making people act to fix these problems. What we need is self-awareness on a planetary scale. A planetary bio-feedback device. The Earth Monitor.

The Earth Monitor is an advanced electronic planetary monitoring system that is interfaced with a computer system that can be fed current and past data and the results used to extrapolate a future scenario and displayed on a 360 degree LED globe monitor. The display would combine real-time video of Earth along with stills and graphical data from sources such as DSCOVR, Google Earth and other sources.The hardware is the globe, which can be of any size (I see 12 inches to 10 plus feet) and available to everyone, with streaming data from a central server. The software is the data-integrating, future-scenario extrapolating Artificial Intelligence that is more than a search engine. It would take verbal commands and use old and near real-time data to project the current state of our environment as well as to project future scenarios for weather, economic trends, pollution, population, and other aspects of life on Earth. A voice input such as Siri is also important in giving it personality which is essential to relating to Earth as a living being.

It is important that the monitor has a 360 degree display as opposed to a mercator map on a flat screen. A flat mercator map is like a lizard on the dissecting table; it shows a 3D object in two dimensions and deadens any feeling of relating to the Earth as something living.

Everything that happens physically on the planet that could change the environment is input into the computer. For instance, let’s say you want to know how how much carbon the U.S. is putting into the atmosphere and how it's affecting the average temperature around the world. I could command, “Show me the effect of carbon emission in the US and related temperature changes on Earth in the past ten years .” Instead of graphs on the wall, the Earth Monitor would show color coded temperature variances in the world with the ability to show data from the past and displayed in fast motion. It will work with other aspects of life as everything that happens in the world influences each other.

I believe the hardware, i.e., the globe monitor, is feasible with the current technology that we have now. There are already available on the market numerous electronic globes of varying sizes but none that I know of that processes streaming data from world-wide sensors and instruments to create a near real-time display of planetary conditions. But I know we have the technology. What we need to develop to make the Earth Monitor work is advanced software; an algorithm that can take in all the data that impacts the Earth and use it to extrapolate how it affects life on this planet (the Tensor Flex AI is one option). Then to display it as a near real-time video on a 360-degree display electronic globe so that we can see it whole. Using this info, we can tweak what we do on the planet for optimum affect. Like a planetary bio-feedback device, we can use this technology to make our planet more healthy, peaceful, prosperous and fulfilling. This would literally be a crystal ball that could predict and make very bright the future of our planet. Because once we get a handle on how our planetary environment works in detail, we can do things that can improve it, such as to prevent pollution, catastrophic hurricanes, tornadoes, earthquakes and other disasters. Even providing rain and sunshine where needed. Just as we improve our personal health by doing things that are good for us, we can institute planetary health by doing the right things on a global basis for the optimum well-being of Earth.

I see the Earth Monitor as belonging to the Earth and everything that makes up the Earth. Like the Internet, it’s for everyone. Owned by everyone. It is a natural process of planetary evolution that will grow and grow, powered by input and contributions from everyone. The more near real-time information about this planet we can gather with our sensors, instruments, observations and the better we get at integrating and coordinating this data into a whole, the more awesome the potential of this endeavor. This is just the beginning. I can see a small Earth Monitor in every home and classroom. A big one in every college, at every stock market, United Nations, corporate boardrooms, environmental agencies, science labs, trade companies, and more.

Philosophically and spiritually, it would make a sea-change in the way we perceive our planet. It would bring us all together, knowing that we are all united in a global bond that is biologic. We would have a bigger concept of who we are and what part we play on the Earth. We would know that we are One, not just spiritually, but in actual material reality, as we are constantly exchanging the atoms of our bodies with each other and the environment.

Ultimately, this is a work for many generations. Just as the Egyptians made pyramids that required the work of thousands of people over many generations, so will the Earth Monitor require the work of thousands, even millions and billions of people over many centuries to take it to its ultimate potential. This is something that will involve not only every one of us right now, but also everyone who will be born and will live on Earth. We will need people from all walks of life to contribute. People who can help make the hardware and the software, and after that, we need global data. The Earth Monitor has to be supported by a global institute or agency that can help gather, integrate and input the information. Computer hardware and software developers are needed. Environmental researchers, geologists, meteorologists, oceanographers, economic trend analysts, seismologists, biologists, physicists, bankers, politicians, artists, public relations people and much more!

As each new generation grows up seeing the Earth as a living entity, we will see the love of our planet grow exponentially. We will no longer think of the Earth as a machine, but as the living, loving planetary body of which we are a part of.

When we imagine a loved one in our minds, we think of them and we feel love towards them. Think of that love. Feel it. That is the love that makes us do things. It is what motivates us. Now, can you imagine the Earth in your mind and feel the same kind of love? How strong is the love of the Earth compared to your love of others, such as your spouse, parents, or kids? For most people, their love of other humans is much greater than the love of the planet. That is why when given the choice to feed their loved ones or to “feed” the planet, they will choose to feed other humans. That is why the only way we are going to motivate the peoples of the Earth to act for the Earth is to get them to love the Earth as a living thing. And to love the Earth, we must be aware of it as our bigger self. The Earth Monitor is the instrument for planetary self-awareness that can enable this to happen.

Once the monitor becomes ubiquitous and commonplace like our smart phones, our children will grow up seeing the Earth as a living being, and nurture it and take care of it, giving it all the love that is necessary for peace, health and well-being. We use machines to the breaking point. Then we either repair it or replace it. A living being that we love is different. It is not easy to replace it or fix it. So we take care of it and nurture it all the time, we don't wait until it starts to break down. As a human being, we are constantly maintaining our physical body because we are aware of it and love it. We must do the same for our Earth. It is not enough to just fix things of the Earth that are broken, We must proactively strive to improve Earth on an ongoing basis. We must engender in our future generations a profound love of the Earth, so that they act to protect and enhance life on the planet, so that we are never threatened again. The Earth Monitor can be the catalyst that will get us on the path to a great future.

               The initial funding will be to create a working prototype of the Earth Monitor. This will be the hardware consisting of the globe and the computer. The software that will operate the monitor will depend on how we configure the hardware as well as how we will generate and incorporate data from around the world.
story_txt: Planetary ConsciousnessIf people could only see the whole planet laid out in front of them, the extent of pollution, the weather patterns, seismic activities, ozone layer depletion, global climate change, polar ice cap melt, species extinction and even economic and political trends and movements, all  in one glance, it would go very far to making people act to fix these problems. What we need is self-awareness on a planetary scale. A planetary bio-feedback device. The Earth Monitor.The Earth Monitor is an advanced electronic planetary monitoring system that is interfaced with a computer system that can be fed current and past data and the results used to extrapolate a future scenario and displayed on a 360 degree LED globe monitor. The display would combine real-time video of Earth along with stills and graphical data from sources such as DSCOVR, Google Earth and other sources.The hardware is the globe, which can be of any size (I see 12 inches to 10 plus feet) and available to everyone, with streaming data from a central server. The software is the data-integrating, future-scenario extrapolating Artificial Intelligence that is more than a search engine. It would take verbal commands and use old and near real-time data to project the current state of our environment as well as to project future scenarios for weather, economic trends, pollution, population, and other aspects of life on Earth. A voice input such as Siri is also important in giving it personality which is essential to relating to Earth as a living being.It is important that the monitor has a 360 degree display as opposed to a mercator map on a flat screen. A flat mercator map is like a lizard on the dissecting table; it shows a 3D object in two dimensions and deadens any feeling of relating to the Earth as something living.Everything that happens physically on the planet that could change the environment is input into the computer. For instance, let’s say you want to know how how much carbon the U.S. is putting into the atmosphere and how it's affecting the average temperature around the world. I could command, “Show me the effect of carbon emission in the US and related temperature changes on Earth in the past ten years .” Instead of graphs on the wall, the Earth Monitor would show color coded temperature variances in the world with the ability to show data from the past and displayed in fast motion. It will work with other aspects of life as everything that happens in the world influences each other.I believe the hardware, i.e., the globe monitor, is feasible with the current technology that we have now. There are already available on the market numerous electronic globes of varying sizes but none that I know of that processes streaming data from world-wide sensors and instruments to create a near real-time display of planetary conditions. But I know we have the technology. What we need to develop to make the Earth Monitor work is advanced software; an algorithm that can take in all the data that impacts the Earth and use it to extrapolate how it affects life on this planet (the Tensor Flex AI is one option). Then to display it as a near real-time video on a 360-degree display electronic globe so that we can see it whole. Using this info, we can tweak what we do on the planet for optimum affect. Like a planetary bio-feedback device, we can use this technology to make our planet more healthy, peaceful, prosperous and fulfilling. This would literally be a crystal ball that could predict and make very bright the future of our planet. Because once we get a handle on how our planetary environment works in detail, we can do things that can improve it, such as to prevent pollution, catastrophic hurricanes, tornadoes, earthquakes and other disasters. Even providing rain and sunshine where needed. Just as we improve our personal health by doing things that are good for us, we can institute planetary health by doing the right things on a global basis for the optimum well-being of Earth.I see the Earth Monitor as belonging to the Earth and everything that makes up the Earth. Like the Internet, it’s for everyone. Owned by everyone. It is a natural process of planetary evolution that will grow and grow, powered by input and contributions from everyone. The more near real-time information about this planet we can gather with our sensors, instruments, observations and the better we get at integrating and coordinating this data into a whole, the more awesome the potential of this endeavor. This is just the beginning. I can see a small Earth Monitor in every home and classroom. A big one in every college, at every stock market, United Nations, corporate boardrooms, environmental agencies, science labs, trade companies, and more.Philosophically and spiritually, it would make a sea-change in the way we perceive our planet. It would bring us all together, knowing that we are all united in a global bond that is biologic. We would have a bigger concept of who we are and what part we play on the Earth. We would know that we are One, not just spiritually, but in actual material reality, as we are constantly exchanging the atoms of our bodies with each other and the environment.Ultimately, this is a work for many generations. Just as the Egyptians made pyramids that required the work of thousands of people over many generations, so will the Earth Monitor require the work of thousands, even millions and billions of people over many centuries to take it to its ultimate potential. This is something that will involve not only every one of us right now, but also everyone who will be born and will live on Earth. We will need people from all walks of life to contribute. People who can help make the hardware and the software, and after that, we need global data. The Earth Monitor has to be supported by a global institute or agency that can help gather, integrate and input the information. Computer hardware and software developers are needed. Environmental researchers, geologists, meteorologists, oceanographers, economic trend analysts, seismologists, biologists, physicists, bankers, politicians, artists, public relations people and much more!As each new generation grows up seeing the Earth as a living entity, we will see the love of our planet grow exponentially. We will no longer think of the Earth as a machine, but as the living, loving planetary body of which we are a part of.When we imagine a loved one in our minds, we think of them and we feel love towards them. Think of that love. Feel it. That is the love that makes us do things. It is what motivates us. Now, can you imagine the Earth in your mind and feel the same kind of love? How strong is the love of the Earth compared to your love of others, such as your spouse, parents, or kids? For most people, their love of other humans is much greater than the love of the planet. That is why when given the choice to feed their loved ones or to “feed” the planet, they will choose to feed other humans. That is why the only way we are going to motivate the peoples of the Earth to act for the Earth is to get them to love the Earth as a living thing. And to love the Earth, we must be aware of it as our bigger self. The Earth Monitor is the instrument for planetary self-awareness that can enable this to happen.Once the monitor becomes ubiquitous and commonplace like our smart phones, our children will grow up seeing the Earth as a living being, and nurture it and take care of it, giving it all the love that is necessary for peace, health and well-being. We use machines to the breaking point. Then we either repair it or replace it. A living being that we love is different. It is not easy to replace it or fix it. So we take care of it and nurture it all the time, we don't wait until it starts to break down. As a human being, we are constantly maintaining our physical body because we are aware of it and love it. We must do the same for our Earth. It is not enough to just fix things of the Earth that are broken, We must proactively strive to improve Earth on an ongoing basis. We must engender in our future generations a profound love of the Earth, so that they act to protect and enhance life on the planet, so that we are never threatened again. The Earth Monitor can be the catalyst that will get us on the path to a great future.               The initial funding will be to create a working prototype of the Earth Monitor. This will be the hardware consisting of the globe and the computer. The software that will operate the monitor will depend on how we configure the hardware as well as how we will generate and incorporate data from around the world.

story:
About zeAC

zeAC is a simple climate control system and consists of the Air-Con Cylinder that produces cooling when you add water, and potted plants that consume CO2 and release fresh oxygen in your home.

Simply refill tank with water every morning. The evaporation of water from the micro porous surfaces of the cylinder material cools the room. Additionally, the material dehumidifies the room by absorbing vapour from air or humidifies a dry room by releasing vapour into the air.

More cooling happens with the absorption of heat into the cold cylinder body. Plants, nourished by the constant draw of vapour and nutrients, digest CO2 and other gases, while supplying fresh oxygen. You end up with a micro-climate of stable humidity and cool comfort, all day.

Early Prototype

In live testing zeAC consistently cools down the room temperature to about 26°C while over 40°C outside in Lagos, and 77°F in 105°F heat in Maryland USA afternoon outside temperature. No sweating or thermal discomfort was recorded in the room.

See a demonstration of a cooled room here

 

For any home and office

As an alternative to regular AC units, zeAC’s small size and good looks makes it easy to integrate the unit anywhere you want. Use the zeAC mounted in a flower pot and it will not only brighten your room but also cool it! Who said feng shui was difficult?

One unit is suitable for a room of about 100 - 150 square feet, so you can approximate how many units your house or office requires.

What makes zeAC special?

1. Zero Electric: This means no bills for cooling. The Air-Con Cylinder does all the cooling with Water.

2. Simple. Just add water (cooling), or no water (heating)

3. Multi-climate: The zeAC works in both dry and humid climates. Give it 80% humidity and it will still keep cooling and dehumidifying your home.

4. Fresh Natural Air: Plants and the Air-Con Cylinder ensure supply of constant fresh air by absorbing C02 and other dangerous gases and releasing fresh oxygen into the air in your room all day.

5. Active Dehumidifier and Humidifier: It manages to maintain constant comfortable humidity all day.

6. Solid State: Silent and no moving parts. Just add water and remain cool all day.

7. Portable: Place anywhere in your home. There are no walls to break and no pipes to lay.

8. Scalable: Add as many as you need for your effective cooling comfort all over your home.

9. Multifunction: Add the Basic Power or Sense package to add illumination and device charging or power to your home with the solar powered options. Effectively go off grid.

10. Beautiful: You can never go wrong with having lots of Air-Con Cylinders and beautiful plants that keep the air fresh in your home.

But how does zeAC work?

Using basic thermodynamic principles zeAC is able to cool or heat a room via latent vaporization or condensation heat. The unit functions in two different ways depending on seasons and ambient temperature.

The zeAC draws vapour from the room to the cylinder at any temperature.

Hot Day Behaviour:

For dry air warmer than the Air-Con Cylinder, water in the Air-Con Cylinder evaporates at a faster rate, absorbing latent heat from the room, effectively cooling up the room and also humidifying it in the process.

For humid air warmer than the Air-Con Cylinder, water in the cylinder evaporates at a slower rate, absorbing latent heat from the room, effectively cooling up the room and also dehumidifying it in the process.

Works best with walls and windows that are shaded from the direct exposure to intense sunlight. If your walls are exposed to direct sunlight, you will need more per square feet for cooler sensation.

Hot Day ​Indoor and Outdoor Temperature

Fig below: outdoor (Red). Indoor closer to Air-Con Cylinder (blue). 

 

Hot Day Indoor and Outdoor Humidity

Fig below: outdoor (Red). Indoor closer to Air-Con Cylinder (blue). Indoor farther away in room (green)

See a demonstration of a cooled room here

Cold Day Behaviour:

For dry air colder than the Air-Con Cylinder, saturated vapour in air condenses on a dry cylinder at a slower rate, radiating the latent heat of condensation from the cylinder into the room, effectively warming up the room and also humidifying it in the process.

For a humid air colder than the Air-Con Cylinder, saturated vapour in air condenses on a dry cylinder at a faster rate, radiating the latent heat of condensation from the cylinder into the room, effectively warming up the room and also dehumidifying it in the process.

Because of the micro porous surface of the Air-Con Cylinder the condensed vapour is trapped in the mass, effectively dehumidifying the room.

A heating element MAY periodically add small amounts of heat to keep the Air-Con Cylinder at a higher temperature (36°C for example), resulting in 24°C or higher temperature and low humidity in winter climate tests at -1 °C.

Powerful, Natural Air Purification - Recommended Plants

These plants are recommended because, compared other plants, they absorb more CO2 and other gases that are not good for you, and supply more oxygen to refresh the air in your room. 

Mother-in-Law’s Tongue (Sansevieria trifasciata); Peace Lily (Spathiphyllum), Money Plant (Epipremnum aureum), Bamboo Palm (Chrysalidocarpus lutescens); 

Others: Orchid, Peeple Tree, Rama Tulsi, Tulsi ( Green), Chrismas Cactus or Schlumbergeras, Gerbera (Orange), Aloe Vera, Sansevieria Trifasciata Zeylanica, Snake Plant, Neem Tree, Areca Palm.

zeAC, the most energy efficient and economical climate control system is a product of my very diverse background. I started first as a painter and conceptual artist, moved to become a university lecturer, and later founded a software technology company. I also  founded the Centre for Technology Innovation in Lagos, Nigeria. In many ways, my view of the world has been shaped by my exposure to these different disciplines and life across four continents - Africa, Europe, Asia, America.

Energy has been a problem on my mind for many years. It affected me on a personal level while living mostly without electrical power in the concrete jungle that is Lagos, Nigeria. The country generates a paltry total of under 4000 MW of electricity. While my 2.5Kv petrol generator could support almost all my appliances, it was not powerful enough for air conditioners. If you have been in the sweltering heat of March and April in Lagos, you will recognise how inconsequential power can be if you can’t handle space cooling with it.

Analysing my energy load showed clearly that I was using almost 90% of the energy I supply to my home for cooling loads. Up to 70% of the electrical energy in hot and humid climates goes to cooling loads. This analysis led to a logical conclusion - solving cooling also resolves the energy quagmire.

To do this, we must decouple the cooling and heating loads from grid electricity. With this decoupling, 4000 MW will go a long way in a place like Nigeria. There must be a better way to keep cool than the vapour compression refrigeration technology offers, a device that requires as much as 4000 watts to start in air conditioning applications.

At this realisation, I started looking for alternatives and recalled the behaviour of the earthen pot from my childhood. I remembered fetching cold water from my grandmother's earthen water pot. I began to explore how this water stayed colder than the ambient temperature and then understood the physics of evaporative cooling behind it. I saw parallels between the behaviour of the pot and the Earth's system for cooling itself. From here we started engineering materials to mimic nature and provide support for hot and humid climates.

To achieve this, I turned to material science, focusing on locally available materials. I teamed up with my co-founder Caius, and we started exploring materials and fabrication techniques that could yield optimal evaporative media, and work effectively in hot and humid climates. The result of this enquiry is the Air-Con Cylinder.

Air Conditioners consume the most share of the energy the world generates. By supporting the Air-Con Cylinder, you contribute to an important solution to Global Warming on Earth.

Dedication

I dedicate the Air-Con Cylinder (named by my daughter Uzoma) and the zeAC System, to Mother Earth first, and to my loving wife Pui-Ying, and my daughters Uzoma and Akunna. Without their humanity, I would not have done it.

What We Need & What You Get

1. We are looking for $200,000 to setup initial manufacturing of the zero electric version. This will buy an industrial kiln for larger scale production of our first 1000 units. This will cover cost of purchase and shipping of other machinery. We will add a manufacturing expert to the team to help with the manufacturing setup.

2. Then we need $50,000 to design and complete the prototyping of the electronics and sensing aspects of the assembly. These include, connectivity and control of lights from a mobile app, monitoring micro climate data for various clusters of cooling units in a given location, motion detection for energy optimisation of lights, and power supply battery bank for lights, and any electronics in the optionally powered version. With this we should be prepared for the completed product and be production and distribution ready in 4 months to 6 months.

Every supporter will get a zero electric version.

The Impact

The earth strains as a result of our energy problem. To put it simply, if we don't resolve the cooling problem, the energy quagmire would persist, and worse, so would global warming. We must minimise electricity consumption of air-conditioning. Our zeAC not only solves the problem, but solves it elegantly. It fills your home with plants that clean the air and feed you fresh oxygen, while keeping you nice and comfortable all year round - without noise or moving parts, and no financial cost for energy.

 

All the Energy here comes from around you - Air, Water and the Heat in your home.

Risks & Challenges

Working with my team members Rosu and Caius, I have cleared the toughest part. It took 11 months of developing and testing the material to achieve the results we have today. The next phase is designing and testing of the electronics and sensing systems by our inhouse team of electronics and software engineers, Maduka, Paul and Isaiah. The initial manufacturing of electronics component and packaging will be outsourced, while materials fabrication and assembly will be done internally.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word to make a better Earth. #zeroelectricAC

Acknowledgements

1. My grandmother's earthen pot for drinking water storage, and Ancient Egyptian evaporative cooling technology.

2.Thibault Faverie for one of the most important works prior in ceramic evaporative cooling technology: http://thibault-faverie.com/Cold-Pot. His work kept giving me confidence that the worst outcome could not be so bad. Faverie's work provided the impetus to push further in another direction.

3. Yunnus Cerci, "A new ideal evaporative freezing cycle." International Journal of Heat and Mass Transfer 46 (2003) 2967–2974. When I saw Cerci's model for evaporative freezing, what else could be impossible in this area?

4. Mohammed Abba for his mass market zero electric fridge with the earthen pot. Simple things lead the way: http://www.rolexawards.com/profiles/laureates/mohammed_bah_abba/project

5. The Ithaka Institute for their work: http://www.ithaka-institut.org/en/milestones. They helped me understand some of the most fundamental elements in Nature.

6. Professor Zhen Chen of Stanford University for his work in Photonics Cooling: https://www.newscientist.com/article/2116040-future-air-conditioning-could-work-by-beaming-heat-into-space/ work deepened my understanding of materials.

These works and many others I don't have space for here, informed me.

There are also other people I may have omitted here, my thanks, please.

Lastly there is Nigeria, the country with perhaps the most trying challenges on Earth. Working here honed my problem solving skills. I was working against the wind all the time. I learnt a lot.

Please spread the word to make a better Earth.

 

Press

4. Mohammed Abba for his mass market zero electric fridge with the earthen pot. Simple things lead the way: http://www.rolexawards.com/profiles/laureates/mohammed_bah_abba/project
5. The Ithaka Institute for their work: http://www.ithaka-institut.org/en/milestones. They helped me understand some of the most fundamental elements in Nature.
6. Professor Zhen Chen of Stanford University for his work in Photonics Cooling: https://www.newscientist.com/article/2116040-future-air-conditioning-could-work-by-beaming-heat-into-space/ work deepened my understanding of materials.
These works and many others I don't have space for here, informed me.
There are also other people I may have omitted here, my thanks, please.
Lastly there is Nigeria, the country with perhaps the most trying challenges on Earth. Working here honed my problem solving skills. I was working against the wind all the time. I learnt a lot.
Please spread the word to make a better Earth.
 
Press

story:
CONSTRUCTIS is an alternative energy company developing Kinetic Energy solutions to “Move Energy Forward.”

We’re intent on bringing to market the worlds first Kinetic Energy Units to capture the energy created from one of our biggest everyday headaches “Traffic” and use it to power the world.

“Read our Impact section to learn how Kinetic Energy can reduce your taxes, lower your power bill and are cheaper than solar and wind solutions.”

Just one Kinetic Energy Unit system set in an area with 10,000 vehicles per day will save over 803 lbs of CO2 emissions per year from being added to the atmosphere. With the addition of Kinetic Energy Units to our streets and highways we could offset that footprint by re-capturing the energy of each vehicle that is currently being lost.

The Kinetic Energy Units are installed in roadways, off ramps and at intersections, where a strike on a compression mechanism captures kinetic motion from your vehicle and converts it into metered power to be distributed to storage or the grid. 

A single Kinetic Energy Unit installation in a low traffic area will produce on average 2 kWh of power or more per day, turning daily traffic into one of the largest sources of alternative power.

To put it in perspective, the average residential household uses 32 kWh of power per day.  Installing these systems around your city in high traffic areas will power entire neighborhoods on a daily basis.

We have demonstrated through advanced computer modeling that a single pair of Kinetic Energy Units will produce 1.3MW Hours per year in a location with traffic of 10,000 vehicles / day.  This is comparable to any four-lane intersection in most medium sized towns or cities producing enough power to largely offset traditional power consumption in most areas. For a comparison, an average 2 lane highway has between 100,000 to 150,000 vehicles / day…imagine capturing that power!

Traditional Solar and Wind solutions require large areas of dedicated land and are often not effective or feasible in urban areas.  Our Kinetic Energy Units have the ability to transform alternative energy collection in urban environments and improve the sustainability of our towns and cities.

Modeling of RESS system installed in urban environment

Our Kinetic Energy Units have the lowest capital construction costs of any energy source with no infrastructure needs. Meaning we can add substantial electricity capacity at a fraction of the cost of a new power plant, with zero carbon emissions.

The power generated from our Kinetic Energy Units can support net metering, battery back up or direct use.

Kinetic Energy Units are the Urban alternative to wind and solar, are highly cost competitive with those alternative energy technologies and require no subsidies or land needs. With your endorsement, we’ll receive an official Dept. of Energy “Alternative Energy” designation in 2016 to increase our Nations use of alternatives.

Our Kinetic Energy Units are Zero Emission, climate resilient, and intelligently networkable through embedded operating intelligence software.  Help us disrupt the energy market and provide another option for our Cities!

We’ve built and tested our prototype in simulation software and proven a number of amazing capabilities.  Now we need your help to get our first sets of prototypes funded and built.

V1 modeling of the RESS Concept - We've significantly evolved between V1 and V4!

We’ve got opportunities to install our systems at multiple port locations across the southeast to capture power from the continual traffic of trucks entering and leaving the ports.  Now we just need your help to build them!

V1 modeling for kinetic energy capture from vehicles.

We need to raise at minimum $100K to build our initial set of prototypes.  One unit will be for ongoing Research and Development (R&D) and the other unit will be installed at a Port facility for field testing We’re looking to go further and much bigger and with your help we can surpass our goals as future clients are already waiting!

We’ve found some amazing perks to highlight our campaign that will not only keep you safe on the go but have you doing it in style while staying cool!  We appreciate all your support and even the smallest donation will help bring our dream of Kinetic Energy Units to life! Help us challenge big energy and push our product through the closed doors of our Government system!  WE WANT CLEAN ENERGY!

 

Kinetic Energy Modules are our lives work and have been in design since 2007.  We’ve got the patent, all the trademarks.  We’ve done the studies, worked the figures and now we’re ready to get them in the ground and start producing power.

Our scientific name for the Kinetic Energy Unit is the Roadway Energy Sensory System or (RESS).  We envision each RESS system as being a pivotal support system to the future of smart roadways and the Internet Of Things movement to support connected roadway systems.

RESS Systems will support intelligent monitoring of our bicycle lanes, streets and highways, enable future connected car systems, provide power to support electric vehicles, enhance roadway safety systems and even reduce your taxes!

Wait?  What? Reduce my taxes?  Yes, you read that correctly.  The power our RESS systems put back into the grid could be used to offset your local municipal budgets, resulting in reduced tax burdens and better-maintained roadways and cities.

Further, adding the power back into the grid will also help offset your local cost of energy, reducing your overall energy prices for your area.  Imagine having the RESS installed at your City parking lots and powering City lights.  And lets talk about the technology costs.  Power from Kinetic Energy Units will be cheaper than Solar and Wind, specifically for Urban applications.  We think solar and wind have great applications and are an integral part of our Nations energy solution, but we are excited to lead in the age of kinetics!  

Our challenge is to open a new door in a closed energy market and only with your help will we be able to do this.  Your endorsement is literally a vote to move this product to market!

Our RESS Kinetic Energy Units will have the lowest capital costs of ANY alternative power generating solution!

We’ve got over 25 years experience in commercial construction and roadway development throughout our careers.  Our team has installed over 2.5 Billion in commercial construction, supported the development of multiple new technologies and is certified by state and national highway safety boards.  We’re ready to bring the newest alternative energy solution to life and look forward to doing it with you!

With everything in life, there are risks and challenges.  T.S. Eliot is quoted as saying “Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.”  We don’t think there is a too far when it comes to increasing our capability to become energy independent and sustainable as a society.  We see Kinetic Energy as the future of urban alternative energy.

Our primary risks are in material development.  We have rated all our chosen materials for construction of the RESS systems through careful engineering processes. 

Identified secondary risks are associated with third party peripherals such as the ability to store the energy created from our RESS units or meter it back into the grid.  We are partnering with a number of technologies for testing to support these concepts and confident of our application and it's success.

Our marketing studies involved exhaustive interviews, phones calls and presentations with consistently shared excitement and successful outcomes.  When Henry Ford was asked whether he performed a market survey, he stated “If I asked the people what they wanted, they would have told me a faster horse!”

If you can’t contribute directly monetarily there are a number of ways you can still help be a part of the team.  We need your help to get the word out.

1.  Share this campaign through the indie go go sharing links on each of your social networks.  Got a Twitter? Shoot us out to your crowd.  Got a Facebook?  Please invite your friends to like us.  It’s that simple.

2.  If you want to go a step further, shoot us an email with a quick blurb on why you think our technology needs to be in the world.  We will use your testimonial in our support efforts.  Nothing is as powerful as our voice being heard to support change in our energy industry.

Have a question or idea on another way to support making Kinetic Energy the future?  We want to hear from you.  Contact us and let us know.

If you’ve made it this far, Thank You!  We look forward to bringing this revolutionary alternative energy technology to the world.  With your help, we can make it a reality.


Looking for more information?  Visit our website http://constructisllc.com

Want to contact Constructis for more information, arrange an interview or any further media outreach?  This campaign and media support is managed by Ring Tree Media - http://ringtreemedia.com  Contact constructis@ringtreemedia.com for further information.

story:
In September, 2012, we started Green Way Pavements (GWP), which served as Distributor of eco-grid-paver products imported from a German manufacturer, who recently sold their North America operations.

After four years of progressive growth and long-term projects in the making, GWP decided to manufacture our own product here in New York State, USA, with a multi-fold mission to create more jobs, better utilization of recycled materials, and to further educate the consumer.

Please NOTE: Our videos and photos show some of our work we did in the last few years installing imported grid-paver products.  Our own product, The Mission Grid-Paver™, is currently in its design and production phase.

Now is the time that "We, the People, Support the Mission of Building a Greener Tomorrow."

 

Join Us!

With your support, GWP can successfully complete this phase in our Mission Grid-Paver™ development. We promise to work as hard as we can, move forward with grid production and show you our progress.

So, if you intend to contribute, please do so at your earliest possible convenience!

Thank you so much for considering Green Way, our Mission Grid-Paver™ product, and become a “Heart-driven” Campaign Backer. 

                                                   Sincerely,

—Zeljka, Robert and the Green Way's Team​

Together, We Can Build a Greener Tomorrow

 

 

Product Summary:

The Mission Grid-Pavers™: A Permeable, Recycled, Plastic Grid-Paver, designed as the “Green Alternative” pavement method as opposed to asphalt and concrete: both environmental pollutants. Grid-Pavers serve as a practical pavement solution that offers long-term durability with low cost and simplified maintenance. They also serve as a soil and gravel stabilization systems that provide a solution for storm water and erosion control.

Grid-Pavers can be installed on residential, commercial and public areas. The design of the Grid’s cells permit a variety of fills from stone, sand, turf-filled, grass seeded, wood mulch, rubber, and glitter products.

What Makes the Mission Grid unique? 

Cost, quality design, and education are what separates Green Way's grid from competitors. When we sell our grids, we sell the reasons it helps our environment. Every purchaser will not only get a great grid, they will better understand its enviromental benefits. 

Applications:

Based on the client's specific desires and needs, the applications are unlimited. Sample pavement and hardscaping applications include: (1) Residential (DIY), (2) commercial customers, (3) Architectural Landscaping, Civil Engineering, and Geological (4) Governmental and Educational Institutions, (5) Erosion and Storm Water Developers, (6) Energy: gas and oil, (7) the Equine: ranches and arenas, (8) Livestock Agribusiness, (9) Environmental farming solutions: soil and ground water preservation, (10) Sports Facilities, National and State Parks, just to name a few.

 

VIEW: Mission Grid-Paver™ Product 

 

Features 

  • Made of recycled plastic LDPE & HDPE polyethylene compounds
  • Provides decades of life span: 20 years +
  • Lightweight, simply installed: 1 person/ 1 hr/ 1000 sq ft
  • No need for heavy construction equipment and excessive labor
  • Fill with gravel, grass, colored stone, rubber, chips, or dirt
  • Highly permeable, even thru storm surges
  • Minimal expansion and contraction
  • Strength and stability are excellent
  • 1.5% Run-off coefficient (asphalt and concrete 95%)
  • Relatively maintenance free, except if grass filled
  • Weather, chemical and UV resistant,
  • Stays dry as water instantly drains into the soil
  • Reduces surface heat, unlike asphalt
  • Can be snow plowed
  • Significant long-term savings as compared to asphalt

 

VIEW: Grid Drawing

 

Dimensions: 12"x12"

Wall height: 1.77"

Wall thickness (outer): 0.20"

Wall thickness (inner): 0.16"

Grid size: 1 sq ft

 

Installation

  • Determine weight load and drainage requirements
  • Mark and stake area where grid-pavers will be installed
  • Excavate designated area to specifications
  • Prep excavated area with aggregate base materials
  • Install grid-pavers
  • Fill
  • Tamper
  • Enjoy

 

VIEW: Grid-Paver Installation

 

Maintenance

  • Relatively maintenance free (if grass filled: requires only basic lawn care)
  • Self-cleaning as rain water washes dust away
  • Weather resistant, no deterioration 
  • Leaf Clearing: use low blower speed
  • Broom sweep occasionally
  • Winter considerations for snow removal:  simply snowplow 1 inch above the grid-paver, or use a rubber tip blade. Use only a 2-Stage Snow Blower and use the risers to adjust auger level.  There should not be any “black ice” as the snow/ice melts directly down through the grid-paver. 

 

Cost Comparisons of the Grid-Paver, Asphalt and Concrete Through 20 Years

 

Summarizing Benefits: 

  • Long-term savings and efficiency
  • Reduces pollution and better conserve water
  • Recharges ground water
  • Water flows through grid-pavers into the soil and it becomes naturally filtered. (Asphalt and concrete allow pollutants to flow into sewer drains, thereafter, into our streams and lakes.)
  • Simplified installations: gravel or grass
  • Can be used for soil or gravel stabilization
  • Reduces elaborate drainage construction costs  
  • Helps mitigate erosion and eliminates gravel migration
  • Better Mud Control on gravel driveways and access roads 
  • Qualifies with L.E.E.D. and adheres to ADA guidelines

 

 

Your campaign donations will help us (1) to purchase specialized manufacturing equipment to begin producing the Mission Grid-Paver, (2) to educate people, (3) to put product on procurement and vendors lists, into architect’s specs, (4) to act now to capture the market, and (5) hire staff to help us. We appreciate your contributions and support that enables GWP to utilize recycled consumer waste, which in turn reduces pollution, protect our waters and helps Earth to breathe better.

Please check our Budget Breakdown that shows you how the funds will be used.

Even if you see us reach our goal, please, consider making a contribution anyway.

Additional funding received will be used to strengthen our Mission with regard to the environment, education, micro-lending to environmental entreprenures.

Our Stretch Goal is to further develop installation machinery to quicken the install process.

 

 

Company:

Zeljka One Management, LLC, dba: Green Way Pavements® (GWP) is a New York State Certified Women’s Business Enterprise (WBE).

GWP began in Spring 2013 as a prime Import Distributor for a German manufacturer, which, in late 2016, unfortunately ceased operations and was recently acquired. Based on potential sales in our Pipeline and the increased interests in the permeable paver market, the decision to self-manufacture and distribute our own permeable plastic-grids became our goal. 

We are currently working with Binghamton University’s (BU) Small Business Development Center, BU’s Department of Mechanical Engineering, Plastic Engineers and Business Development Specialists to formulate manufacturing, distribution, marketing and sales milestones. Green Way has recently been accepted into the New York State's Department of Economic Development's LaunchNY Program (LaunchNY.org).

Green Way Pavements’ Valuable Customers:
Broome County, NY; Martha’s Vineyard, MA; Peoples Neighborhood Bank, PA; Longwood Gardens, PA; National Rifle Association, PA; Sterling & Francine Art Museum, MA; Huber Breaker Museum, PA; Columbus Park, City of Binghamton, NY; Raleigh, NC; Lackawanna State Park, PA; DNR Parks & Recreation, MI; Round Top Park, PA; Town of Union, NY; US Embassy in Kyrgyzstan, Asia.

Other prime organizations and agencies outside of GWP’s distribution network who used plastic grid-pavers are: FEMA, US Military, NATO.

 

 

We prepared many PERKS for you and hope that you will enjoy and utilize them.

Get your  PERK  and be part of Green Way’s Mission for improving the quality, value and planetary resources for its people.

 

 

Releasing the Product

In November 2017 all PERK items, except for the Grid-Pavers, will be shipped to our Campaign Contributors.

Around November 2018 we plan to SHIP Grid-Pavers to our Campaign Contributors.

 

Green Way can accelerate its Purpose and Mission, and even change the world a bit, and your support will greatly help us.  

The sooner we reach our funding goal, the sooner we can get started producing Mission Grid-Paver™ and ship Backers their PERKS. Obviously, the more funds we raise, the more we can drive our production costs down and better educate the consumer public.

As Green Way moves forward, we shall be happy to share our progress with you. You will always be part of our company and its Mission. We shall all grow together.

Please let us know if you have any questions, comments or suggestions!

For inquiries regarding Distribution, Retail, and Sales Affiliations, please apply at: missiongridpaver@gmail.com

You've heard from us and now we'd love to hear from you.

Sincerely,

—Zeljka, Robert and the Green Way's Team

 

 

The “Going Green Movement” has become a full-steam-ahead reality. This includes the monumental task to better understand the ramifications of “Climate Change” and “Water Conservation.”   States are being pushed by the EPA to deal with Storm Water and Erosion Control. These government regulations exponentially increase the size of our market! In 2017, Congress favors expending over a trillion dollars to improve America’s Infrastructure and permeable paving materials will be a part of that plan.

The European culture has been actively engaged in the “Green Environment” processes for over twenty years. Very little consumer wastes finds its way into landfills. In the US, the story is quite different, as the landfill business is quite lucrative and regretfully expanding. Ironically, we have found a way to better control landfills on behalf of the environment.

 

Below are some of the more frequent FAQs gathered by Category. If you would like to add and share to this list, please email your FAQ to Zeljka: missiongridpaver@gmail.com

 

COMPOSITION OF MISSION GRID-PAVERS:

Q: Is the Mission Grid-Paver™ made of recycled material?

A: YES. The Mission Grid-Paver™ is made of 100 % Recycled plastic.

 

Q: What’s the Difference between LDPE and HDPE plastic?

A: LDPE (low-density polyethylene) plastic is high-quality, flexible, resilient, fracture-resistant plastic made of recycled plastic bags, that makes the product elastic but durable and firm.

HDPE (high-density polyethylene) plastic is a rigid plastic. There are variations in HDPE from very brittle to flexible.

Best is to have product made from combined LDPE and HDPE plastics as Mission Grid-Paver™ is.

 

Q: What Temperature range can the Mission Grid-Paver™ withstand?

A: Temperature range -57°F up to 194°F.

 

Q: Can the Mission Grid-Paver™ Dimension change do to extreme temperature changes?

A: Minimal shrinkage or expansion may be experienced.

 

Q: Is the Mission Grid-Paver™ Chemically stable?

A: Mixture of LDPE and HDPE is extremely stable and does not naturally degrade, it is resistant to acids and alkalis.

 

Q: Is Mission Grid-Paver™ Soluble?

A: Not under general circumstance. It will not dissolve and is resistant against acid and leaches, alcohol oil and petrol (strewing salt, ammonia, acid rain etc.).

 

Q: Is the Mission Grid-Paver™ Environmentally friendly?

A: Brilliantly so…Ecological, groundwater neutral, weatherproof and UV resistant.

 

Q: Placing Asphalt next to Mission Grid-Paver™?

A: YES…you can safely pour asphalt NEXT To and/or INTO the Grid-Paver.

 

Q: What about Mission Grid-Paver™ Permeability?

A: 98% permeable. Offers successful storm water management utilization by allowing water to drain back into the soil.

 

Q: Mission Grid-Paver Durability?

A: The life span of Mission Grid-Paver™ is uncharted as its composition is not biodegradable. However, grids can be milled, which in turn can be recycled.

 

Q: Mission Grid-Paver™ Manufacturer’s Warranty?

A: Minimal warrantee is 5 years. Warrantee depends on installation method used.

 

GRID-PAVER INSTALLATION

Q: How quick is a Mission Grid-Paver™ installation?

A: One person can install over 1,000 sq ft of Mission Grid-Paver™ in one hour, on an already prepared surface. Again: 1 person; 1 hour; per 1,000 square feet.

 

Q: Does the Mission Grid-Paver™ have an Interlocking System?

A: YES… Mission Grid-Pavers™ have unique interlocking lugs that create a solid surface.

 

Q: Could pre-connected Mission Grid-Paver™ layers be disconnected?

A: YES …The pre-connected layers can be taken apart if necessary. To do so, place the layer you wish to take apart on the top of another layer. Using your foot, press the grid you want to remove down and out of the safety locking system.

 

Q: Could the Mission Grid-Paver™ be cut to fit?

A: YES … For quick and clean tile cutting the following tools have proved most effective in practice: Circular saw, Reciprocal saw, Compass saw.

 

Q: Is possible to make a curve with Mission Grid-Paver™?

A: YES, you can cut–to–fit Mission Grid-Pavers™.

 

Q: Can I lay the Mission Grid-Paver™ on a sloped driveway?

A: Absolutely. Mission Grid-Paver™ offers a unique locking system. 5% to 20% grades are common. Each tile is firmly locked on two sides to the next creating a highly secure surface. If you are still worried about laying it on a slope then you can place a few anchors for additional stability.

 

Q: Will the gravel in the Mission Grid-Paver™ run down the slope?

A: Gravel is restrained within each Grid-Cell especially when the gravel is compacted and locked. Depending on the slope and amount of traffic flow, some minor gravel migration may occur and can easily be removed.

 

Q: Securing Mission Grid-Paver™ System to the substructure?

A: It could be done with steel anchor spikes.

 

Q: Can you Snowplow Mission Grid-Paver™?

A: YES, Simply SNOWPLOW 1 inch above the paver. Adjust the skid setting on the blade. Recommend using a Two-Stage SNOW BLOWER for hand-push snow removal. The Mission Grid-Paver™ design actually improves tire traction and shoe grip. Check the video on GWP YouTube.

 

Q: Can you use salt and deicer on Mission Grid-Paver™?

A: YES… Mission Grid-Paver™ can withstand chemical (salt) treatment. Also, as snow and ice melt, it drains down into the Mission Grid-Paver™ so recommendation is a slight decrease in salt or even elimination of deicer application.

 

Q: Does the Mission Grid-Paver create black ice?

A: NO! Virtually no black ice. Mission Grid-Paver™ enhances walking and tire traction. On porous pavements, no standing water occurs, and thus — in areas with good solar exposure — plowing at the time of snowfall is sufficient for winter maintenance, resulting in a virtual elimination of deicer application.

 

Q: Can I turf or lay seed in the Mission Grid-Paver™ to create a ‘lawn’ that I can park on?

A: YES, imagine going out to ‘mow’ the driveway, totally porous, aesthetic and environmentally friendly.

 

Q: Does Grass filled Mission Grid-Paver™ require any special maintenance?

A: Grass filled Mission Grid-Pavers™ requiring only basic lawn maintenance (watering, fertilizer and mowing).

 

Q: How does the Mission Grid-Paver™ perform in Flood area?

A: Filled pavers are heavy enough and when connected should perform well in flood. In flood area recommended securing Mission Grid-Paver™ System to the substructure with steel anchor spikes.

 

Q: How does Mission Grid-Paver™ perform when there is Land Movement?

A: Minor land movements should not disrupt the condition of the area paved with Mission Grid-Paver™. The paved surface moves according to the land movement below it. If any damage occurs, it can be easily fixed by cutting the tabs, removing pavers, fix the surface, and again install the same pavers, then fasten them together or anchoring with earth nails.

 

Q: What is a Mission Grid-Paver™ “Sandwich” application?

A: Innovative Mission Grid-Paver™ “Sandwich” application reduces gravel requirements cost (“Sandwich” application: first layer of Grid-Pavers on the base (soil), fill pavers with gravel, thickness depends on the load, second layer of Grid-Pavers on the surface, fill with gravel.) “Sandwiching” serves as an excellent cost reduction and/or soil/gravel stabilization technique.

 

Q: What about the Installation of Mission Grid-Paver™ on SAND?

A: Mission Grid-Pavers™ could be installed directly on sand, without any base. (A technique used by US Military on sand). Pavers can be put upside down on sand. Also the “Sandwich” application works well with sand.

 

SAFETY:

Q: Can Mission Grid-Paver™ be installed on highways?

A: NO. Very heavy trucking generate tremendous horizontal inertia when braking at high speeds. For safety reasons, best to install Mission Grid-Paver™ on access roads with max speed up to 30 miles per hour.

 

Q: What about women with high heel shoes?

A: YES. Women can easily walk on Mission Grid-Paver™ with high heel shoes. Check the video on GWP YouTube.

 

Q: Does the Mission Grid-Paver™ Permeable Pavement surface conform to the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) requirements?

A: YES. ADA Design Guidelines require that surfaces be firm, stable and slip resistant. Permeable Pavement designs can provide a firm and stable surface for visually impaired persons and those using wheeled mobility devices. Check the video on GWP YouTube.

 

STORM WATER

Q: What MS4 stands for?

A: Municipal Separate Sewer & Stormwater System

 

Q: How to calculate storm water?

A: Storm water calculator is on this link:

https://www.epa.gov/water-research/national-sto...

 

Q: How does the Mission Grid-Paver™ help manage storm water run-off and pollutants removal?

A: Mission Grid-Paver’s™ permeable surface and gravel sub-base temporarily store rainwater runoff, as an Aquifer would, before infiltrating into the subsoil. When rainwater infiltrates directly through Mission Grid-Paver™ and into the soil, it receives purification treatment. Hydrocarbons from cars, pet waste, nitrogen, and other pollutants are filtered and removed by bioremediation, before polluting the ground water. In the void spaces of the sub-base of Mission Grid-Paver™ naturally occur micro-organisms that digest car oils. Gravel sub-base also captures the heavy metals preventing them from washing downstream and accumulating in the environment.

 

Q: What is Clean Water Act (CWA)?

A: In the United States, the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) is charged with regulating storm water pursuant to the Clean Water Act (CWA). The goal of the CWA is to restore all “Waters of the United States” to their “fishable” and “swimmable” conditions.

 

BENEFITS:

Q: What is unique about the permeable plastic Grid-Paver system?

A: Plastic grids were installed in Germany over twenty years ago. Upon inspection, these plastic grid pavers have retained their composition and, as compared to asphalt, have demonstrated an unequaled life span without maintenance.

  • Made from recycled plastic
  • Heavy Load capacity
  • UV stable
  • Aesthetically pleasing
  • Different colors
  • Economical delivery
  • Safety locking system
  • Swift and economical installation, 1000 sq ft / man / hour due to tile size

 

Q: What are the Benefits of a Mission Grid-Paver™ Permeable System?

A: Mission Grid-Paver™ Permeable Systems provide:

  • Water quality treatment in an area that serves more than one purpose. The depth of the pavement system can also be increased to provide flood control.
  • Permeable pavements can be used to reduce effective imperviousness or alleviate nuisance drainage problems.
  • Permeable pavements benefit tree health by providing additional air and water to nearby roots.
  • Permeable pavements are less likely to form ice on the surface than conventional pavements.
  • Permeable Grids offer excellent landscaping application for use as “Tree-Bed,” which can replace expensive steel gratings and concrete blocks that suffocate trees.
  • Some permeable pavements can be used to achieve LEED credits.

 

TERMS and CONDITIONS

All permeable grid-paver sales are final. Delivery of permeable grid-pavers will begin as stated above in Section: "Delivery of Product".

Should the Campign goal not be reached and/or production not be initiated within reasonable time, Contributors who purchased permeable grid-pavers agree to receive a comparable product of equal quality or agree to extend delivery time of product. 

If a Campaign Owner is unable to fulfill any of its commitments to Contributors (including delivery of any Perks), the Contributor agrees to work with the Campaign Owner to reach a mutually satisfactory resolution.

Contributors are solely responsible for determining how to treat their Contributions and receipt of any Perks for tax purposes. In any event, contributors are responsible for any state, local and sales taxes that are associated with this purchase.

 

Contact Info:

If you would like to ask us a question, please email to Zeljka or Robert: missiongridpaver@gmail.com

Sincerely,

—Zeljka, Robert and the Green Way's Team
story_txt:
In September, 2012, we started Green Way Pavements (GWP), which served as Distributor of eco-grid-paver products imported from a German manufacturer, who recently sold their North America operations.After four years of progressive growth and long-term projects in the making, GWP decided to manufacture our own product here in New York State, USA, with a multi-fold mission to create more jobs, better utilization of recycled materials, and to further educate the consumer.Please NOTE: Our videos and photos show some of our work we did in the last few years installing imported grid-paver products.  Our own product, The Mission Grid-Paver™, is currently in its design and production phase.Now is the time that "We, the People, Support the Mission of Building a Greener Tomorrow." Join Us!With your support, GWP can successfully complete this phase in our Mission Grid-Paver™ development. We promise to work as hard as we can, move forward with grid production and show you our progress.So, if you intend to contribute, please do so at your earliest possible convenience!Thank you so much for considering Green Way, our Mission Grid-Paver™ product, and become a “Heart-driven” Campaign Backer.                                                    Sincerely,—Zeljka, Robert and the Green Way's Team​Together, We Can Build a Greener Tomorrow  Product Summary:The Mission Grid-Pavers™: A Permeable, Recycled, Plastic Grid-Paver, designed as the “Green Alternative” pavement method as opposed to asphalt and concrete: both environmental pollutants. Grid-Pavers serve as a practical pavement solution that offers long-term durability with low cost and simplified maintenance. They also serve as a soil and gravel stabilization systems that provide a solution for storm water and erosion control.Grid-Pavers can be installed on residential, commercial and public areas. The design of the Grid’s cells permit a variety of fills from stone, sand, turf-filled, grass seeded, wood mulch, rubber, and glitter products.What Makes the Mission Grid unique? Cost, quality design, and education are what separates Green Way's grid from competitors. When we sell our grids, we sell the reasons it helps our environment. Every purchaser will not only get a great grid, they will better understand its enviromental benefits. Applications:Based on the client's specific desires and needs, the applications are unlimited. Sample pavement and hardscaping applications include: (1) Residential (DIY), (2) commercial customers, (3) Architectural Landscaping, Civil Engineering, and Geological (4) Governmental and Educational Institutions, (5) Erosion and Storm Water Developers, (6) Energy: gas and oil, (7) the Equine: ranches and arenas, (8) Livestock Agribusiness, (9) Environmental farming solutions: soil and ground water preservation, (10) Sports Facilities, National and State Parks, just to name a few. VIEW: Mission Grid-Paver™ Product  Features 
Made of recycled plastic LDPE & HDPE polyethylene compounds
Provides decades of life span: 20 years +
Lightweight, simply installed: 1 person/ 1 hr/ 1000 sq ft
No need for heavy construction equipment and excessive labor
Fill with gravel, grass, colored stone, rubber, chips, or dirt
Highly permeable, even thru storm surges
Minimal expansion and contraction
Strength and stability are excellent
1.5% Run-off coefficient (asphalt and concrete 95%)
Relatively maintenance free, except if grass filled
Weather, chemical and UV resistant,
Stays dry as water instantly drains into the soil
Reduces surface heat, unlike asphalt
Can be snow plowed
Significant long-term savings as compared to asphalt
 VIEW: Grid Drawing Dimensions: 12"x12"Wall height: 1.77"Wall thickness (outer): 0.20"Wall thickness (inner): 0.16"Grid size: 1 sq ft Installation
Determine weight load and drainage requirements
Mark and stake area where grid-pavers will be installed
Excavate designated area to specifications
Prep excavated area with aggregate base materials
Install grid-pavers
Fill
Tamper
Enjoy

 
VIEW: Grid-Paver Installation

 
Maintenance

Relatively maintenance free (if grass filled: requires only basic lawn care)
Self-cleaning as rain water washes dust away
Weather resistant, no deterioration 
Leaf Clearing: use low blower speed
Broom sweep occasionally
Winter considerations for snow removal:  simply snowplow 1 inch above the grid-paver, or use a rubber tip blade. Use only a 2-Stage Snow Blower and use the risers to adjust auger level.  There should not be any “black ice” as the snow/ice melts directly down through the grid-paver. 
 Cost Comparisons of the Grid-Paver, Asphalt and Concrete Through 20 Years Summarizing Benefits: 
Long-term savings and efficiency
Reduces pollution and better conserve water
Recharges ground water
Water flows through grid-pavers into the soil and it becomes naturally filtered. (Asphalt and concrete allow pollutants to flow into sewer drains, thereafter, into our streams and lakes.)
Simplified installations: gravel or grass
Can be used for soil or gravel stabilization
Reduces elaborate drainage construction costs  
Helps mitigate erosion and eliminates gravel migration
Better Mud Control on gravel driveways and access roads 
Qualifies with L.E.E.D. and adheres to ADA guidelines
  Your campaign donations will help us (1) to purchase specialized manufacturing equipment to begin producing the Mission Grid-Paver, (2) to educate people, (3) to put product on procurement and vendors lists, into architect’s specs, (4) to act now to capture the market, and (5) hire staff to help us. We appreciate your contributions and support that enables GWP to utilize recycled consumer waste, which in turn reduces pollution, protect our waters and helps Earth to breathe better.Please check our Budget Breakdown that shows you how the funds will be used.Even if you see us reach our goal, please, consider making a contribution anyway.Additional funding received will be used to strengthen our Mission with regard to the environment, education, micro-lending to environmental entreprenures.Our Stretch Goal is to further develop installation machinery to quicken the install process.  Company:Zeljka One Management, LLC, dba: Green Way Pavements® (GWP) is a New York State Certified Women’s Business Enterprise (WBE).GWP began in Spring 2013 as a prime Import Distributor for a German manufacturer, which, in late 2016, unfortunately ceased operations and was recently acquired. Based on potential sales in our Pipeline and the increased interests in the permeable paver market, the decision to self-manufacture and distribute our own permeable plastic-grids became our goal. We are currently working with Binghamton University’s (BU) Small Business Development Center, BU’s Department of Mechanical Engineering, Plastic Engineers and Business Development Specialists to formulate manufacturing, distribution, marketing and sales milestones. Green Way has recently been accepted into the New York State's Department of Economic Development's LaunchNY Program (LaunchNY.org).Green Way Pavements’ Valuable Customers:Broome County, NY; Martha’s Vineyard, MA; Peoples Neighborhood Bank, PA; Longwood Gardens, PA; National Rifle Association, PA; Sterling & Francine Art Museum, MA; Huber Breaker Museum, PA; Columbus Park, City of Binghamton, NY; Raleigh, NC; Lackawanna State Park, PA; DNR Parks & Recreation, MI; Round Top Park, PA; Town of Union, NY; US Embassy in Kyrgyzstan, Asia.Other prime organizations and agencies outside of GWP’s distribution network who used plastic grid-pavers are: FEMA, US Military, NATO.  We prepared many PERKS for you and hope that you will enjoy and utilize them.Get your  PERK  and be part of Green Way’s Mission for improving the quality, value and planetary resources for its people.  Releasing the ProductIn November 2017 all PERK items, except for the Grid-Pavers, will be shipped to our Campaign Contributors.Around November 2018 we plan to SHIP Grid-Pavers to our Campaign Contributors. Green Way can accelerate its Purpose and Mission, and even change the world a bit, and your support will greatly help us.  The sooner we reach our funding goal, the sooner we can get started producing Mission Grid-Paver™ and ship Backers their PERKS. Obviously, the more funds we raise, the more we can drive our production costs down and better educate the consumer public.As Green Way moves forward, we shall be happy to share our progress with you. You will always be part of our company and its Mission. We shall all grow together.Please let us know if you have any questions, comments or suggestions!For inquiries regarding Distribution, Retail, and Sales Affiliations, please apply at: missiongridpaver@gmail.comYou've heard from us and now we'd love to hear from you.Sincerely,—Zeljka, Robert and the Green Way's Team  The “Going Green Movement” has become a full-steam-ahead reality. This includes the monumental task to better understand the ramifications of “Climate Change” and “Water Conservation.”   States are being pushed by the EPA to deal with Storm Water and Erosion Control. These government regulations exponentially increase the size of our market! In 2017, Congress favors expending over a trillion dollars to improve America’s Infrastructure and permeable paving materials will be a part of that plan.The European culture has been actively engaged in the “Green Environment” processes for over twenty years. Very little consumer wastes finds its way into landfills. In the US, the story is quite different, as the landfill business is quite lucrative and regretfully expanding. Ironically, we have found a way to better control landfills on behalf of the environment. Below are some of the more frequent FAQs gathered by Category. If you would like to add and share to this list, please email your FAQ to Zeljka: missiongridpaver@gmail.com COMPOSITION OF MISSION GRID-PAVERS:Q: Is the Mission Grid-Paver™ made of recycled material?A: YES. The Mission Grid-Paver™ is made of 100 % Recycled plastic. Q: What’s the Difference between LDPE and HDPE plastic?A: LDPE (low-density polyethylene) plastic is high-quality, flexible, resilient, fracture-resistant plastic made of recycled plastic bags, that makes the product elastic but durable and firm.HDPE (high-density polyethylene) plastic is a rigid plastic. There are variations in HDPE from very brittle to flexible.Best is to have product made from combined LDPE and HDPE plastics as Mission Grid-Paver™ is. Q: What Temperature range can the Mission Grid-Paver™ withstand?A: Temperature range -57°F up to 194°F. Q: Can the Mission Grid-Paver™ Dimension change do to extreme temperature changes?A: Minimal shrinkage or expansion may be experienced. Q: Is the Mission Grid-Paver™ Chemically stable?A: Mixture of LDPE and HDPE is extremely stable and does not naturally degrade, it is resistant to acids and alkalis. Q: Is Mission Grid-Paver™ Soluble?A: Not under general circumstance. It will not dissolve and is resistant against acid and leaches, alcohol oil and petrol (strewing salt, ammonia, acid rain etc.). Q: Is the Mission Grid-Paver™ Environmentally friendly?A: Brilliantly so…Ecological, groundwater neutral, weatherproof and UV resistant. Q: Placing Asphalt next to Mission Grid-Paver™?A: YES…you can safely pour asphalt NEXT To and/or INTO the Grid-Paver. Q: What about Mission Grid-Paver™ Permeability?A: 98% permeable. Offers successful storm water management utilization by allowing water to drain back into the soil. Q: Mission Grid-Paver Durability?A: The life span of Mission Grid-Paver™ is uncharted as its composition is not biodegradable. However, grids can be milled, which in turn can be recycled. Q: Mission Grid-Paver™ Manufacturer’s Warranty?A: Minimal warrantee is 5 years. Warrantee depends on installation method used. GRID-PAVER INSTALLATIONQ: How quick is a Mission Grid-Paver™ installation?A: One person can install over 1,000 sq ft of Mission Grid-Paver™ in one hour, on an already prepared surface. Again: 1 person; 1 hour; per 1,000 square feet. Q: Does the Mission Grid-Paver™ have an Interlocking System?A: YES… Mission Grid-Pavers™ have unique interlocking lugs that create a solid surface. Q: Could pre-connected Mission Grid-Paver™ layers be disconnected?A: YES …The pre-connected layers can be taken apart if necessary. To do so, place the layer you wish to take apart on the top of another layer. Using your foot, press the grid you want to remove down and out of the safety locking system. Q: Could the Mission Grid-Paver™ be cut to fit?A: YES … For quick and clean tile cutting the following tools have proved most effective in practice: Circular saw, Reciprocal saw, Compass saw. Q: Is possible to make a curve with Mission Grid-Paver™?A: YES, you can cut–to–fit Mission Grid-Pavers™. Q: Can I lay the Mission Grid-Paver™ on a sloped driveway?A: Absolutely. Mission Grid-Paver™ offers a unique locking system. 5% to 20% grades are common. Each tile is firmly locked on two sides to the next creating a highly secure surface. If you are still worried about laying it on a slope then you can place a few anchors for additional stability. Q: Will the gravel in the Mission Grid-Paver™ run down the slope?A: Gravel is restrained within each Grid-Cell especially when the gravel is compacted and locked. Depending on the slope and amount of traffic flow, some minor gravel migration may occur and can easily be removed. Q: Securing Mission Grid-Paver™ System to the substructure?A: It could be done with steel anchor spikes. Q: Can you Snowplow Mission Grid-Paver™?A: YES, Simply SNOWPLOW 1 inch above the paver. Adjust the skid setting on the blade. Recommend using a Two-Stage SNOW BLOWER for hand-push snow removal. The Mission Grid-Paver™ design actually improves tire traction and shoe grip. Check the video on GWP YouTube. Q: Can you use salt and deicer on Mission Grid-Paver™?A: YES… Mission Grid-Paver™ can withstand chemical (salt) treatment. Also, as snow and ice melt, it drains down into the Mission Grid-Paver™ so recommendation is a slight decrease in salt or even elimination of deicer application. Q: Does the Mission Grid-Paver create black ice?A: NO! Virtually no black ice. Mission Grid-Paver™ enhances walking and tire traction. On porous pavements, no standing water occurs, and thus — in areas with good solar exposure — plowing at the time of snowfall is sufficient for winter maintenance, resulting in a virtual elimination of deicer application. Q: Can I turf or lay seed in the Mission Grid-Paver™ to create a ‘lawn’ that I can park on?A: YES, imagine going out to ‘mow’ the driveway, totally porous, aesthetic and environmentally friendly. Q: Does Grass filled Mission Grid-Paver™ require any special maintenance?A: Grass filled Mission Grid-Pavers™ requiring only basic lawn maintenance (watering, fertilizer and mowing). Q: How does the Mission Grid-Paver™ perform in Flood area?A: Filled pavers are heavy enough and when connected should perform well in flood. In flood area recommended securing Mission Grid-Paver™ System to the substructure with steel anchor spikes. Q: How does Mission Grid-Paver™ perform when there is Land Movement?A: Minor land movements should not disrupt the condition of the area paved with Mission Grid-Paver™. The paved surface moves according to the land movement below it. If any damage occurs, it can be easily fixed by cutting the tabs, removing pavers, fix the surface, and again install the same pavers, then fasten them together or anchoring with earth nails. Q: What is a Mission Grid-Paver™ “Sandwich” application?A: Innovative Mission Grid-Paver™ “Sandwich” application reduces gravel requirements cost (“Sandwich” application: first layer of Grid-Pavers on the base (soil), fill pavers with gravel, thickness depends on the load, second layer of Grid-Pavers on the surface, fill with gravel.) “Sandwiching” serves as an excellent cost reduction and/or soil/gravel stabilization technique. Q: What about the Installation of Mission Grid-Paver™ on SAND?A: Mission Grid-Pavers™ could be installed directly on sand, without any base. (A technique used by US Military on sand). Pavers can be put upside down on sand. Also the “Sandwich” application works well with sand. SAFETY:Q: Can Mission Grid-Paver™ be installed on highways?A: NO. Very heavy trucking generate tremendous horizontal inertia when braking at high speeds. For safety reasons, best to install Mission Grid-Paver™ on access roads with max speed up to 30 miles per hour. Q: What about women with high heel shoes?A: YES. Women can easily walk on Mission Grid-Paver™ with high heel shoes. Check the video on GWP YouTube. Q: Does the Mission Grid-Paver™ Permeable Pavement surface conform to the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) requirements?A: YES. ADA Design Guidelines require that surfaces be firm, stable and slip resistant. Permeable Pavement designs can provide a firm and stable surface for visually impaired persons and those using wheeled mobility devices. Check the video on GWP YouTube. STORM WATERQ: What MS4 stands for?A: Municipal Separate Sewer & Stormwater System Q: How to calculate storm water?A: Storm water calculator is on this link:https://www.epa.gov/water-research/national-sto... Q: How does the Mission Grid-Paver™ help manage storm water run-off and pollutants removal?A: Mission Grid-Paver’s™ permeable surface and gravel sub-base temporarily store rainwater runoff, as an Aquifer would, before infiltrating into the subsoil.
