story:
The First universal EV charger to maximise green energy

Dear electric vehicle owner, do you have solar panels or a wind turbine ?

If you do, then imagine driving your electric vehicle for FREE!

If not, you may be thinking of going green at some point in the future.

Either way, you can benefit from zappi

zappi - Works like any regular charging point but has special ECO charging modes which benefit homeowners with micro-generation systems like solar panels or a wind turbine. Meaning you could be cruising around in your electric car which was charged with free GREEN energy.

Our intelligent, slick looking zappi device will charge any electric vehicle with surplus power generated from your solar panels or wind turbine when you flick it into one of the ECO modes.

zappi can also be used as an ordinary charge point, otherwise known as an EVSE - Just use the FAST charge mode.

 

  

Zappi features

We designed zappi with both the user and installer in mind. Here are the main features and benefits of zappi...

  • 3 charging modes (Fast, Eco and Eco+)
  • Boost function - keeps the battery at a minimum charge level
  • Economy Tariff sensing to maximise savings
  • 6A to 32A variable charging 
  • Integral RCD for earth leakage protection
  • IP65 rated enclosure suitable for outdoors
  • Energy and savings data logging
  • Graphical LCD screen for ease of use
  • 5 metre, 32A rated cable with Type 1 or Type 2 charge plug
  • Adjustable charge current limit - allows installation with smaller circuit breakers (e.g. 16A)
  • Adjustable import power limit  - The maximum import limit can be set to limit power drawn by the house when charging
  • In-line mounting holes for easy fixing to brick or timber stud walls
  • Through-wall or surface mount cable entry options for easy wiring 

 

Zappi specifications

Dimensions: 362 x 220 x 78mm

Charging mode: Mode 3 (AC)

Maximum Charge Current: 32A (7kW)

Supply: 90-256V 16A or 32A 50/60Hz

Compliance: BS 8300:2009+A1:2010, BS EN 61851, BS EN 62196

Production schedule

Once we reach our pledge target, we will be able to go straight to manufacture - we already have experienced ISO accredited manufacturers lined-up ready to start. 

Taking into account the lead-time on all components, we expect to start shipping zappi's by June 2017.

Zappi in use:

 

Meet the team

Lee Sutton - Director -  Green tech enthusiast, electronics engineer passionate about supplying the market with reliable robust products and manifesting his eco ideas into reality. 

 

Jordan Brompton - Business Development Manager - Passionate about anything to do with renewable energy and business. The face of the company and the woman behind the sales, marketing and branding.

 

Robin Richard - Electronics Engineer - Robin is the main developer of the zappi. French graduate and little genius - Musk needs to watch his back.

 

Chris Horton - Software Engineer - Tech genius and friend.

Rose Read - Administrator, bookkeeper and all round sweetheart.

Richard - Electronic and Software genius our very own spud eating hippy.

Sean Reeves - Technical Assistant and character that always keeps us laughing.

Special thank you's

Without these people this project wouldn't have made it onto INDIEGOGO. Thank you for your kindness, generosity and help with the INDIEGOGO video. You truly are eco warriors.

Sophie Powles - Actress, advocate and friend. 

Laura Corrigan - Cinematographer & editor - advocate and friend 

Mark Waters - Cinematographer, Director, Editor, Mentor, advocate and friend. 

Rachel and Jonathan at Pension Geeks for helping us create the most beautiful website and branding.

 Development of Zappi

zappi has been 12-months in development and is now ready for production. Here are a few pics of early prototypes... 

 

 YESSS! It's finally working as expected :-) A working prototype - it may not look pretty but it does the job - see how pleased Robin looks.

 

Here we are testing that the charging power varies as it should do. It works perfectly!

End Result 

 

Industry testimonials

 

 

Risks and Challenges 

The team at MyEnergi have had a lot of experience in developing and releasing tech products similar to this and are behind products in use in thousands of home's across the UK.

The risks are very limited simply due to the experience, time and effort that has gone into testing the product.

Zappi has been built with the global market in mind. MyEnergi offer excellent technical support and a standard warranty of 2 years.

story:
Short Summary

solartrees mission is to create a healthy sustainable solar ag cooperative which benefits our environment in northern alberta and beyond, solar energy will be an important feature of our cooperative as well as industrial hemp and other organic crops.  the cooperative has use of land for growing, revenue streaming and financing with three properties to start, 162 acres with a 25,000 sq/ft building for a research and hemp cluster as we want to use 100% of this amazing plant

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for $100,000 to kickstart the cooperative which will be used to build our first solar farm and hempbarn on highway 63 land to be held in trust by all members of the coop. We have land offered already therefore this fund raiser can  exchange cash for land shares and/or perks of our industry. The perks are part of our sustainable living programs for those who prefer something tangible instead of the intangible of a ground floor opportunity that this cooperative represents. The board will have an invested interest also and open to barter as lack of funds should not hinder those who want to get involved

 

The Impact

the cooperative will impact solar energy installations in northern alberta(first system is a Electric Vehicle charger on highway 63 between edmonton and Fort Macmurray) creating micro-generation for our members and partner coops, farmer run processing for value-added goods, Our processing plant will use biomass for energy creation and expand to producing biodiesel for our farmers and members and as this is a social business we  invest in research and development of organic crops including hemp, solar micro-generation for building a Solar REA(Rural Electrification Associations.) to canvas for a premiums on green energy for all solar energy producers in alberta and as the Watershed is a big issue in northern alberta with tail ponds, leakage and oil spills we will support the keepers of the athabasca and similiar groups and open to parnerships with other indigenous groups such as the Metis settlements and those striving for sustainable living where mother nature weighs. Given half the chance we will solarize, enrich the soils of our farmers and enable the indigenous to share in our cooperative networks and partner with us TO BUILD COMMUNITY

Risks & Challenges

the challenge is the cost of initial solar farm to launch, costs of solar micro-generation for members as well as how we can use hemp to improve our healthy living practices as well as lack of money.

therefore, we will partner with a potential solar provider(s) to make financing easier, encourage members to provide assets on loan to improve the bottom line and cooperate with other coops to improve economies of scale. THERE ARE ALREADY 3 COOPERATIVES WHO WISH TO WORK WITH US AND SEVERAL INTENTIONAL COMMUNITIES AND INDIGENOUS GROUPS 

also, we will diversify into international markets to ensure a market for our members projects which will include a south american cooperative for superfoods, sharing our research facility with other coops and members to better develop and encourage sustainable living and to better develop healthy foods and medicines as well as a cooperative sponsorship in Madegascar,  africa to grow hemp and other crops and envision an intern/volunteer program here exclusive to our cooperative network with members considered first though this project is not for anyone as there are huge health risks and heart-breaking conditions, some time here will change you forever. 

hence a diversified portfolio involving many like-minded groups in alberta and beyond, ambitious yes, more important life changing for many YES OUI SI

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  •  get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Remind people to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • volunteer at one of our workshops(hemp gardening, medicinal growing, making rope, solar,etc
  • prepare marketing material for us according to your interests and our needs
  • share to unique places you go as each person with the right intention has a wealth of gestures to make this a better place to live
  • barter what you have for assets or artisan skills or services with our TRADING POST where we encourage trading and exchanging goods and services in our network
  • get involved with solar and hemp in anyway possible as we are needing to heal our planet and alberta and live more sustainable for the good of following generations

And that's all there is to it.

solartrees mission is to create a healthy sustainable solar ag cooperative which benefits our environment in northern alberta and beyond, solar energy will be an important feature of our cooperative as well as industrial hemp and other organic crops.  the cooperative has use of land for growing, revenue streaming and financing with three properties to start, 162 acres with a 25,000 sq/ft building for a research and hemp cluster as we want to use 100% of this amazing plant

What We Need & What You Get
We are looking for $100,000 to kickstart the cooperative which will be used to build our first solar farm and hempbarn on highway 63 land to be held in trust by all members of the coop. We have land offered already therefore this fund raiser can  exchange cash for land shares and/or perks of our industry. The perks are part of our sustainable living programs for those who prefer something tangible instead of the intangible of a ground floor opportunity that this cooperative represents. The board will have an invested interest also and open to barter as lack of funds should not hinder those who want to get involved
 

The Impact
the cooperative will impact solar energy installations in northern alberta(first system is a Electric Vehicle charger on highway 63 between edmonton and Fort Macmurray) creating micro-generation for our members and partner coops, farmer run processing for value-added goods, Our processing plant will use biomass for energy creation and expand to producing biodiesel for our farmers and members and as this is a social business we  invest in research and development of organic crops including hemp, solar micro-generation for building a Solar REA(Rural Electrification Associations.) to canvas for a premiums on green energy for all solar energy producers in alberta and as the Watershed is a big issue in northern alberta with tail ponds, leakage and oil spills we will support the keepers of the athabasca and similiar groups and open to parnerships with other indigenous groups such as the Metis settlements and those striving for sustainable living where mother nature weighs. Given half the chance we will solarize, enrich the soils of our farmers and enable the indigenous to share in our cooperative networks and partner with us TO BUILD COMMUNITY

Risks & Challenges
the challenge is the cost of initial solar farm to launch, costs of solar micro-generation for members as well as how we can use hemp to improve our healthy living practices as well as lack of money.
therefore, we will partner with a potential solar provider(s) to make financing easier, encourage members to provide assets on loan to improve the bottom line and cooperate with other coops to improve economies of scale. THERE ARE ALREADY 3 COOPERATIVES WHO WISH TO WORK WITH US AND SEVERAL INTENTIONAL COMMUNITIES AND INDIGENOUS GROUPS 
also, we will diversify into international markets to ensure a market for our members projects which will include a south american cooperative for superfoods, sharing our research facility with other coops and members to better develop and encourage sustainable living and to better develop healthy foods and medicines as well as a cooperative sponsorship in Madegascar,  africa to grow hemp and other crops and envision an intern/volunteer program here exclusive to our cooperative network with members considered first though this project is not for anyone as there are huge health risks and heart-breaking conditions, some time here will change you forever. 
hence a diversified portfolio involving many like-minded groups in alberta and beyond, ambitious yes, more important life changing for many YES OUI SI
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

 get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
Remind people to use the Indiegogo share tools!
volunteer at one of our workshops(hemp gardening, medicinal growing, making rope, solar,etc
prepare marketing material for us according to your interests and our needs
share to unique places you go as each person with the right intention has a wealth of gestures to make this a better place to live
barter what you have for assets or artisan skills or services with our TRADING POST where we encourage trading and exchanging goods and services in our network
get involved with solar and hemp in anyway possible as we are needing to heal our planet and alberta and live more sustainable for the good of following generations

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Sahara Spirirts!

Making pure ethanol as well as delicious vodkas, gins, rums, whiskeys, and liqueurs from unique African ingredients not only creates distinctive and delicious spirits, it generates hundreds of jobs for people and funds waste oil (and eventually plastic) recycling. We will make very cool drinks from banana, molasses,  palm trees sap, palm sugar, cocoanut sugar, sugar cane juice, corn, millet, cassava,  and sorghum. I love fresh palm wine so I am eager to capture its crazy "cocoanut water on steroids" deliciousness in a wine or liqueur.

Diesel and ethanol work well together! Our diesel fuels our generators to run our mobile distilleries and the methanol and acetone which are byproducts of the distillation process are used in our diesel fuel. But the real magic is that two ethanol machines will create enough profits to buy us one waste oil to diesel machine a month! In one year we will have 10 diesel machines removing 4000 liters of waste oil from being dumped, creating businesses for people,  and creating a high quality, low-cost community fuel!!  This mean environmental health and jobs!!!!

Short Summary

My name is Robert Clyne, I have a Ph.D. in Anthropology form Yale and I have lived in African off and on for 10 Years. I moved to Africa for the first time 50 years ago at the age of three and I am terrified by its future.  Between a shrinking global demand for commodities, automation destroying  development opportunities, and  climate change many countries will be at their tipping point.

The double revolution is using the natural synergies between diesel production and ethanol to create high profits, to clean up the environment, and to create hundreds of eco friendly entrepreneurial opportunities. Africans recycling their waste can clean up their environments,  can create jobs, and can cut their fuel cost by as much as 50%.  Africans making ethanol related products from activated charcoal, to yeast, to exotic raw materials, to  spirits, to perfume, and to essential oils could make very profitable small industries which would hopefully breed other profitable small industries.   Supporting our project will create revenues for at least 50 people in the first first year.  

What we need is pretty basic

We need  $19K..

Two  6 kilowatt ethanol stills                                                               10,000

1 waste oil to diesel machine 4kw                                                         5,000

1  used 50 kilowatt generator                                                                 4,000 

(which we will run on our own fuel)       

 

With the profits from the ethanol stills we hope to buy at least 10 waste oil recycling machines the first year!

                                                                                                    

.                                               What happens if we do not get enough funds.

This technology is very scalable.  As long as we can afford one distillation machine and a generator we can begin.  We can run our generators on a black diesel we developed for our ethanol distillation.  With more money we will simply open more recycling plants, cleaning up more waste, and providing more income for recyclers. 

The Impact

Africans must develop industries that can withstand climate change and they must develop attractive high-profit niche products they can export on the world market (the low-skill labor intensive industries that Asia used to develop economically will no longer work in today's automated world!).  Our eco friendly projects offer both environmental health and economic transformation.  

I have been a successful entrepreneur in Africa and recently I was awarded licenses to make diesel substitute fuel from waste oil in both Ghana and Burkina Faso.  With Alex Polinaski's proven technologies we are sure we will go to the next level and fast.  By buying one recycling machine a month in less than a year we will be keeping 4000 liters of waste oil off the ground and producing a community- based diesel at about half the price of diesel at the pump.  We are already talking with partners in Nigeria, Ghana, Sierra Leone, Mali, and the Gambia to spread this model!

Our collaboration with Alex Polianski and Lubrication Specialties Inc. insure we have the technical support to make high quality spirits and diesel even under very tough conditions.

Risks & Challenges

I have ten years living and working experience in Africa including 8 years in Nigeria.  I have worked as a consultant for Ford Foundation and I have run my own businesses.   I have already gone through the licensing and testing for my diesel substitute in Ghana and Burkina Faso.  It will be the same procedure again for ethanol.

The machines we use are time-proven to be super robust and to be easy to maintain and repair.  Ninety-five per cent of the raw materials we use will be available in country. The rest can be affordably air mailed.

No business is risk-free but with my prior business experience and connections in Ghana and Burkina  and the quality of our technology and technical support I am sure we will be able to overcome the inevitable obstacles.  Having two viable businesses helps insure adequate cashflow  during an occasional downturn.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are looking for importers in the US to buy our spirits.  We are looking for importers who want food grade ethanol.   We would love to connect with a Trader Joe's or similar establishments that specialise in international food and spirits.

We also love good recipes.   If you give  us a good recipe and we use it we will send you a case of your drink a year for as long as we use it. Contribute and join our Connoisseur's Club and help us keep improving!!!

We look for donors but we as we grow we will also be interested in investors.

We definitely want connections in the aromatherapy, perfume, or essential oil distillers

story:
Help us bring revolutionary clean energy to the world.

Tetragon Foundation, Inc. is a nonprofit research organization comprised of researchers and engineers. Our mission is to develop and deliver clean energy technologies to the global community. We are currently producing a clean energy solution that uses recyclable aluminum, not fossil fuels, to create electricity. This technology is non-hazardous, has no emissions and has a higher energy density and lower carbon footprint than lithium ion.  Soon even the production of aluminum will have a zero carbon footprint. Aluminum producers Alcoa and Rio Tinto recently announced a revolutionary process that produces oxygen and eliminates all green house gas emissions from the smelting process. 

Our technology extracts the energy aluminum producers put into it during production. Being infinitely recyclable, aluminum can now join solar, wind, and hydroelectric as a 100% carbon free energy solution!

 

You can be a part of demonstrating the first widespread use of this technology, helping the world move toward zero emission energy. This lead project is an aluminum-air fuel cell portable power generator. It brings the benefits of electricity on demand without creating toxic fumes or using hazardous chemicals. Unlike gas generators, you can even operate these units in high-rise structures, hospitals, and aircraft - and they are quiet - all while using a recyclable resource for fuel. 

 

We believe that starting with a portable generator that can be deployed to disaster zones or for in-home use will allow consumers and governments to see the advantage of this technology in a real-world environment.

 

 

At Tetragon Foundation, our team has decades of experience in industrial technology development including power control systems, electro-mechanical systems, advanced robotic systems, as well as experience in machine design and production for companies like Duracell, Ovonic Battery, and Gates Energy to name a few.  Our team has put progress ahead of profits and formed this nonprofit foundation, dedicating ourselves to clean energy. 

 

Key technical achievements enable the technology. 

This project is past the lab stage and has overcome key technical problems that have previously limited aluminum-air technology.  First, additives to the water-based electrolyte are safe and eliminate the need to alloy the aluminum anode with tin or other metals. This enables the use of common commercial and recycled aluminum.  Second, the additives prevent gelling of the aluminum hydroxide byproduct.  Instead, it forms a powder that settles without reducing electrical output.  Capturing and filtering this powder for easy recycling is a key part of this project.  Third, the patented and proven gas diffusion cathode design enables both high performance and low-cost production by a continuous extrusion method, another key component of this project. Over 3000 hours of lab tests confirm power densities greater than 350 Wh/kg (as compared to 140 Wh/kg for lithium ion), and it is ready for the production engineering process which is estimated to span 9-12 months.

 

Your financial support is needed!

We are not using venture capital or public equity funding.

All generated revenues will be continuously reinvested in clean energy development projects including further work in aluminum-air fuel cells, hydrogen on demand systems for hydrogen fuel cells, improvements in wind turbine transmissions, and several platforms for converting potential energy in our homes into electricity.   

 

Why this project is important for clean, sustainable energy and in reducing greenhouse gases

Aluminum packs an incredible amount of inherent energy. It is indefinitely recyclable and is the third most abundant element in the earth's crust. Its production has a lower carbon footprint than lithium-ion.  Soon, it will be produced 100% carbon free.  There is not one solution for reducing greenhouse gases, but many. We need to implement all those that are viable and will have a meaningful impact on reducing greenhouse gases.  Electricity from aluminum is certainly viable, and this project presses the collective global effort forward.

This project will not just make available a new form of portable power for emergency and disaster relief, it is a stepping stone towards the use of aluminum-air technology as range extenders in vehicles, larger stationary power systems, back-up power for communication systems, commercial applications, public transportation and portable systems for everyday recreational activities like camping or tailgating.

 

Energy from aluminum in everyday use can be a paradigm shift for the world.  You can help make that happen. 

 

Imagine…

Emergency power without gasoline or toxic emissions

 

Portable power that can be used in hospitals and transported with patients and the elderly during evacuations

 

Clean power for pumps and water purification systems

 

Temporary electricity for our homes, apartments, and more

 

Clean sustainable energy from recycled aluminum, the third most abundant element in the earth's crust behind only oxygen and silicon - 70% of all aluminum ever produced is still in use today!

 

Project Challenges

The primary engineering challenge now is improving ease of use for both replacing the aluminum plates and filtering the aluminum hydroxide for easy recycling.  We have several concepts for both that need prototypes. 

The secondary engineering challenge is improving production methodology for a diffusion membrane assembly.  However, we have extensive experience with inline converting and extrusion lines as used in plastics, rubber and printing industries.  We are confident in establishing an efficient and cost effective production method. 

The commercial challenge is in ensuring availability of replacement plates and electrolyte.  We believe this challenge will be met by both licensing and open sourcing.  This may take time as retailers and potential licensed manufacturing companies need to ensure demand is high enough before entering into agreements.  In part, this is why we chose to start production with small portable units for emergency use rather than focusing on a broader application such as powering electric vehicles.  At the start we plan to provide units with extra plates and nonhazardous electrolyte powder and will ensure more are available directly from us.  

 

Every step toward cleaner energy is important.

As our slogan says, we know the Time Is Now to press as hard as possible to develop and utilize clean energy solutions.  This project can play a pivotal role in using aluminum-air technology as a clean, sustainable energy source. We are dedicated to clean energy and together, we can take this step in reducing our reliance on fossil fuels and lowering greenhouse gases. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Connect with us to become part of the solution.

Facebook     Instagram      Twitter

Subscribe to our YouTube Channel 

Share our Indiegogo Campaign!

story:
Hago Energetics Inc., a startup company focused on tackling climate change from many angles, is currently working on a project designed to tackle one of the most pressing issues involved with the climate crisis: carbon dioxide. 

Here at Hago Energetics, we have designed a direct air capture unit to pull carbon dioxide out of ambient air by attaching these units to thousands of trailers to be pulled by trucks, SUVs, and – ideally – electric vehicles. Our design will utilize the movement of the vehicle by incorporating the wind and eliminating the need for fans, thus saving on electricity and energy. The unit will use a sorbent that acts like a sponge to adsorb the carbon dioxide, separating the CO2 from the air. A concentrated product of carbon dioxide will be returned at a central station. 

Our mission is to democratize carbon capture by scaling it down to be used by thousands of people around the nation. The world needs to be carbon neutral soon. Once we become carbon neutral, we need to become carbon negative, by removing the carbon still in the air. With technologies such as miniature direct air capture devices, Hago Energetics is transforming the way we can address global warming by reinventing large-scale technologies for individual consumer use.

Funding for this project will contribute to turning our concept into a reality. Therefore, we are asking you to help us do our part to create a sustainable and healthy planet for us all. If you can’t donate, please help us by spreading the word and sharing this post with the Indiegogo share tools!

Here is a link to a presentation about our design:

https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1Tupmaah...

To learn more about this project, read our article on Medium: 

https://emmettnovick.medium.com/democratized-di...

story:
Join the green revolution! 

Green is the new Gold! The app that keeps track of your green choices and rewards environmentally positive behaviour.

Find out the impact of your lifestyle choices: scan products and identify the best eco alternative.

Keep track of your impact! How many litres of water have been saved, how many emissions averted and how many animals’ lives have been spared.

Become an Eco Warrior. Earn points and increase your green score gaining tangible rewards and discounts.

If you want more information, scroll down!

 

Why?

We are living in a time of rapid population growth. A time of economic prosperity and environmental disaster. Technological advances have made us more aware of the cost to the planet of our lifestyle choices.

Mother Nature is dying.    

We need to save her because our governments and large corporations have failed. They value power and profit above the welfare of our planet.  They continue to ignore the warnings from scientists who tell us we only have 11 years to change how we co-exist with Mother Nature.

  We are the last generation who can make a difference to avert this catastrophe. 

We need to act now and be the change.  Like the flapping wings of a butterfly that can cause a hurricane, we all have to start making small changes to our lives. We need to force our governments and corporations to revolutionise their wasteful and harmful behavior.

The good news, many of us have already made changes but we still have a long way to go.

Together we need to lead the way.  We need to showcase our green credentials, to highlight the positive action we are taking to help save our planet.  

To help you showcase your green credentials and demonstrate the changes you are making today for the benefit of others who follow, , a community of likeminded green activists connecting to inspire one another. You are not alone!  Join the change and join  and let’s make a difference together!

 A green revolution that enables individuals like you to showcase and demonstrate the changes you are making. By setting an example, you’re  showing the world that each little change can make a big difference.

Whether its cycling to work instead driving, or planting a tree or switching to a plant-based or vegan diet, even the smallest change can and will help alter the way people think. It will put pressure on governments and corporations to consider how they respond to consumer demand.

By being the trailblazers of change, we can inspire one another and brands will be forced to follow suit.

We have a lot more power and agency than we think!

 

What?

It will track changes in diet, transport and offer points as well as information on the direct environmental and health implications from making those changes.

The app camera will identify an alternative – milk, for example -  and show you  how many litres of water have been saved, how many emissions averted (from the production of the item) and how many animals’ lives have been spared.

The app will reward you with points. The more you use the app and the more changes you make, the more points you accumulate. The points will create your personalised dashboard which can be used for sharing badges, photos, videos and text. You get to see the actual impact of your lifestyle changes.

As you collect more and more points, your level increases and you can earn badges which can be worn on your profile as a showcase of all your green credentials. (Eg Level 10 Eco Warrior: 100kg of CO2 averted, 10,000 litres of water saved and 22 animals spared.)

Users will be able to connect with friends and family as well as other people that they might find inspirational. The number of followers you have will not be visible, the focus is on your green score.

The accumulation of points will extend to transportation (geo tracker will show places walked to instead of driven, trains used instead of flying) as well as socially conscious activities (geo fencing of points in areas where users can participate in conservation, volunteering etc).

How?

Funding will be used to create the initial product. Early adopters will gain exclusive access to the private beta. This will allow a community of investors to be fully involved in the shaping of this platform from the get go. As a thank you for being a part of the future and supporting the vision of change, your profile will be permanently embellished with an exclusive "founders" badge.  You will also benefit from access to all future "founders discounts"

 

When?

An initial product will be available 8 weeks after the funding round closes. Every backer will be immediately notified, with the private beta being exclusively opened for those with "founder" status. 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

If you have no funds but want to be part of the movement, a share on your social media will be valued too!

As individuals we have such power and influence! Let us change the game and be the change!

Let us change the game and be the change!

story:
The video above shows the prototype Qwickfone base station - the heart and soul of our mission.

ONE SEVENTH OF THE WORLD HAS A FAILURE TO COMMUNICATE.

Over one billion people on Earth have no lifeline to reach out to other people. Any call for help goes unheeded... because there is simply no way of making one. 

A cell-phone is a device that a lot of us take for granted. It would be hard to imagine how we could run our lives without one. Our phones inform us, entertain us, allow us to talk to friends and relatives over long distances, but, most importantly, they can reach out in an emergency.

Imagine now that your phone doesn't exist, how would that change your life? Tough, huh? Well, for the lost billion, this is their everyday reality. Which makes us ask... why, in this day and age, do people not have access to something as basic as a telephone?

Maybe it’s geography, maybe it’s the sparsity of the population, but, in most cases, it’s just the unwillingness of Big Telecom to install towers, switches, satellite links or other technology in  rural areas. Those places are inconvenient. Big Telecom will never get a quick return on their money. In reality, as so often, it all comes down to profit – and we thought that was unacceptable...

...so we did something about it...

...we developed Qwickfone.  

Qwickfone is a fully integrated hardware and software package that can bring a cell-phone system to any village, hamlet or town that is not connected to the communications grid. No expensive towers, no wires, no complicated technology: Just our base station, an antenna and a single uplink is all that’s needed. It’s simple. It’s effective.

What’s more, Qwickfone system is far more than a cell-phone. The Qwickbiz software makes micro-commerce fast and easy. In a place where there are no banks or access to money, a simple transaction over a reliable system can lift many out of poverty: Farmers can sell their produce to small villages and get paid immediately. Small shops in one village can do business in other villages - expanding their market, making more money, hiring more people, buying more goods from other suppliers who can also expand their market, hire more people, buy more equipment, get microloans and expand their businesses even more. It’s an exponential win/win for everyone.

Then there’s Qwickcomm: An emergency broadcast system that can save lives by providing emergency text messages to warn of impending floods, fires, epidemics or even terrorism. Being forewarned is being prepared.

Qwickfone is an idea that has finally come.

Qwickfone is an Anglo/Canadian organization. Based in London, we're a small but dedicated group with a focus on solving the problems that the corporate world prefers to ignore.

With Qwickfone, our goal is to install a system in every unserved and forgotten community in the world. Geography, population, and the disinterest of Big Telecom have kept people poor, unenlightened and out of touch for decades – but now there can be no more excuses.

We need your support.

As of the time of this campaign, we have interest from the following nations: Canada, Congo, DRC, India, Indonesia, Kazahkstan, Kenya, Malawi, Tanzania, UK and Zambia. There is already a desire to see Qwickfone under full scale test and working in the unserved areas of these countries. To accomplish this, we need extra funds to further develop the system, manufacture bespoke equipment, install the management network and create the necessary technical and sales support infrastructure. We can do this over time, but right now, we need your help just to get us into the field in a large-scale test.

How you can help.

You can give money here or via our website at www.qwickfone.com. You can spread the word via social media – liking us on Facebook, following us on Twitter, getting others to look at our campaign and then spread the word again.

We want to reward you for having faith in us.

We believe in Qwickfone. We want to give back to you for believing in us. See our terrific PERKS to see what we have on offer – and remember, membership in the Qwickfone Community means you will not only be helping others who are less fortunate than you, it means you will be in a front row seat to see how Qwickfone revolutionises communication in the developing world!

Act NOW!

Those in need do not have the luxury of endless time. Every day that they're cut off from the world they're in danger and their quality of life is impaired. Act now and let’s do this together - bringing hope to the hopeless, making our vision come true, ending the silence for more than a billion.

story:
I am Dr Sara Andreotti, a Marine Biologist that have been working on white sharks for more than 10 years.

Together with shark conservationist Michael Rutzen, coastal engineer Laurie Barwell and the rest of the SharkSafe Barrier team, we want to bring to life a solution for saving large sharks from shark nets and drum lines.

 

 

A bit about myself

I moved in South Africa from Italy to study white sharks' DNA, and to count them using photographic identification, I estimated that there were less than 500 white sharks left around the South African coastline in 2014. Although there are several reasons behind the demise of this population, shark nets are the one cause of shark-death that we have the power to stop, as soon as we will provide an alternative solution to keep swimmers and surfers safe.

 

I put my genetic research on the side line in the last three years, to focus into bringing the SharkSafe Barrier to life. I love the Ocean and the sharks with all my heart and I can’t stand thinking that they will get extinct. Not on my watch. All sharks lovers have now a real chance to make a difference with us, as raising awareness is no longer enough: we need to change the way sharks are managed. We need to do so by improving what we know about them, and by keeping them safe from shark nets, nationally and internationally.

With this campaign I hope to get as many sharks lovers as possible behind our mission

 

I hope to have enough funds to finish the engineering work on the deep sand anchors, and I hope to deliver the SharkSafe Barrier on all places using shark nets against their shark populations.

I hope we will change the way we co-exist with sharks the same way we learned to co-exist with some large land predators. In the Kruger National Park of South Africa lions are a resource for the environment and for the local tourism. They are admired by the tourists in all of their beauty, and kept separated from the urban areas with high enclosures surrounding the Park. It is my hope that we can transfer this approach to our marine predators. Because the environment needs them, and because we have the moral duty to keep them safe, if we want to protect the marine ecosystem.

 

What do we urgently need!

For completing the engineering tests on the deep-sand anchoring system we appointed professional coastal engineers for testing the prototypes in the laboratory using a flume tank (a large aquarium simulating the waves action in which we can deploy our latest sand anchors).

This work doesn’t come cheap, and it will cost us 80 000 USD to be completed.

After this will be done, we will have a solid idea on how to deploy the SharkSafe Barrier on the deep sand of the South African coastline. We already obtained a research permit from the South African Department of Environmental Affairs, for 2018, to deploy our prototypes in deep sand. The at sea operation will cost additional 300 000 USD, that we hope to source in the near future, either thanks to a research grant, investors or, once again, thanks to the thousands of ocean loving people like you, reading this right now.

We approached a local South African company to make for us the best SharkSafe Barrier T-shirts and most amazing SharkSafe hats.

We decided to put our logo on wearable items, so that you can proudly show your support to our common cause. Please bear in mind that we are scientists and conservationists by trade, and we are exploring the crowdfunding world for the first time. Ever. We are super open to suggestions, and we will be really grateful to have your input on how to improve our campaign and how to make this work better together.

If we will reach our goal we will cover the engineering expenses for the lab-testing, and you will be able to follow our progresses, by following our news feed in the website (www.sharksafesolution.com) and our Facebook page (www.facebook.com/Sharksafebarrier).

If we don’t reach our goal, we will have to find a way to source the remaining funds elsewhere. The failure of this campaign will delay our mission for another year.

Every year without SharkSafe Barrier in the water is one more year of marine creatures killed and one more year of fear of entering the water. Only with your support we can get this done right now!

 

WHY DOES YOUR HELP COUNTS?

Thanks to your contribution you are going to really help us making a difference.

We have been working since 2011 until now, thanks to the in kind contribution and sponsorship of Shark Diving Unlimited, Innovus and the University of Stellenbosch, O’ Seas Conservation Foundation, seed funds from the Technology Innovation Agency, sponsorship form White Shark Diving Company and research grants provided by the NGO SHARKPROJECT, Taronga Zoo (Australia) and the Explorers Club. We went as far as we could with the funds provided, and managed to complete the scientific research on the sharks (you can see the list of our scientific publications here:  https://www.sharksafesolution.com/scientific-tests/). We managed to finalize the design of the vertical elements of the barrier to make it look just like a forest of kelp, and had it resist the turbulent waters of the Cape of Storm in South Africa.

The deep sand anchorage system is truly our last step for making our barrier available for all kind of beaches. We are planning to bring the SharkSafe Barrier from South Africa to the rest of the world, in any place needing to stop culling sharks, with the excuse of tourism.

Risks & Challenges

We realize that what we want to do is challenging, we experienced first-hand, for the last seven years, the peculiar ability the Ocean has to break things. He comes across as a really powerful toddler, who finds new way to break the most robust designs. We developed over the years a huge respect for the Ocean’s power, and we are not to underestimate the challenges this project is still going to present.

But, despite all of above, we believe we can do this, if we do this together. We believe we have to do this, if we care about the sharks, and we have to believe that no matter how huge the waves, we need to find a way to navigate this project forward. Too many marine creatures die already and too many families got shattered to pieces as a results of negative encounters with sharks. We have a real chance to fix this problem for good, so we just have to push forward and keep on testing until the final prototype will resist the Ocean, no matter the sea-floor composition.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you feel you can join us for making the SharkSafe Barrier a reality, please hit the donation button, a small contribution from many many people can go a long way.

If you feel you wish you could contribute but you can’t donate, please share this campaign to help us reaching out to more people (there is a Indiegogo share button just for you). Also, please or help us with your feedback, your suggestions are valuable to us, and we want to really make this change together.

WE VALUE YOUR SUPPORT! THANK YOU FOR BECOMING PART OF THIS JOURNEY

The deep sand anchorage system is truly our last step for making our barrier available for all kind of beaches. We are planning to bring the SharkSafe Barrier from South Africa to the rest of the world, in any place needing to stop culling sharks, with the excuse of tourism.

We realize that what we want to do is challenging, we experienced first-hand, for the last seven years, the peculiar ability the Ocean has to break things. He comes across as a really powerful toddler, who finds new way to break the most robust designs. We developed over the years a huge respect for the Ocean’s power, and we are not to underestimate the challenges this project is still going to present.
But, despite all of above, we believe we can do this, if we do this together. We believe we have to do this, if we care about the sharks, and we have to believe that no matter how huge the waves, we need to find a way to navigate this project forward. Too many marine creatures die already and too many families got shattered to pieces as a results of negative encounters with sharks. We have a real chance to fix this problem for good, so we just have to push forward and keep on testing until the final prototype will resist the Ocean, no matter the sea-floor composition.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you feel you can join us for making the SharkSafe Barrier a reality, please hit the donation button, a small contribution from many many people can go a long way.
If you feel you wish you could contribute but you can’t donate, please share this campaign to help us reaching out to more people (there is a Indiegogo share button just for you). Also, please or help us with your feedback, your suggestions are valuable to us, and we want to really make this change together.
WE VALUE YOUR SUPPORT! THANK YOU FOR BECOMING PART OF THIS JOURNEY

story:
The truth behind chocolate, is anything but sweet.

Ivory Coast, the origins of nearly half the world’s cocoa, has brought about numerous bad publicity from the issues of deforestation, child labor, and extreme poverty. Sadly, we as consumers have been disguised from the likes of these issues over its colourful and flavourful treats produced by cocoa. The beautifully wrapped chocolate candies over Halloween, Easter, Christmas, and birthday cakes are the perfect cover up; not informing us if the products we consume, have been produced by children, grown in deforested areas, or costs chocolate confectioners only $0.33 to pay its farmers for the produce of each unit sold.

As demand for chocolate and cocoa products continues to skyrocket, we could only work to redefine the supply chain, and to rebalance the disequilibrium of the situation faced by smallholder famers. We want to give growers the opportunity to independently develop their own communities, and to prioritise their child’s education over working at farms.

Children of cocoa planters - who had never tasted chocolate prior to this. Their parents labor to produce cocoa, but have never had the opportunity to purchase the finished product of chocolate.

 

Low and insecure income of farmers lead to serious social and environmental problems. Farmers are unable to invest in their farms, they cut salaries, and cannot provide workers with proper working conditions, and in the worst case, result to child labor. Hoping to increase their revenues through higher output, they extend plantations into protected areas, which becomes the cost of sustainable, ecological and diversified farming.

Africa Cocoa Village has been structured to provide independence to smallholder farmers, by improving the quality of their produce. Our model is to improve agricultural practices of famers with proper equipment’s, provide secure credit lines for farmers, and improve their environment with basic necessities. All of which, will help smallholder family farmers to earn a higher profit margin by producing premium quality cocoa beans. In the long run, this model becomes a reinforcement for farmers to reinvest their earnings to gain independence and freedom out of their economic situation.

 

What makes us different?

We engage field services with  our digital platform to execute this program. The platform opens uncharted development pathways of the cocoa value chain based on transparency, responsibility, and honorable sourcing. Connected with satellites, we are able to track and support agricultural activities in real time, establishing a new standard of consumption awareness.

Our management team, inspecting cocoa quality at one of the villages where we provided  proper elevated drying mats


Addressing challenges such like deforestation through our platform, we are able to monitor if farmers are extending their plantations into protected areas. Our on-ground team tracks on farmer’s practices, and keep them aligned with proper techniques and supports them with agricultural supplies if needed. With our mobile payment system to farmers, we practice immediate payment within 24h of releasing their cocoa bags. We have also extended the platform to track on teacher-student attendances, notifying us if children are working instead of attending classes.

 

The Outcome

Africa Cocoa Village guarantee’s that our cocoa beans are bagged from the individual plantation it grows from. It ensures that only matured pods are harvested, beans are carefully hand separated and placenta is removed, that fermentation and drying process are properly and safely conducted to keep the authenticity of flavour; prioritising quality over quantity.  One of our practices, is that cocoa beans are bagged directly in presence of the grower after the drying process, and tagged with an ID code. (This ID code is your log-in on our platform, that gives you information about the cocoa beans you have received).

We ensure that all children from our registered plantations will receive education, by providing incentives to parents to prioritise their child’s education over labouring at farms. Through the re-investments of farmers, we will support villages by building more schools, minimizing the distances children walk to school to 3km.

In addressing deforestation issues, we introduce agroforestry to growers and incentive them to engage in reforestation and revitalisation actions. Through the platform, we track on growers, and reward those who continues to participate in this practice.

The program structure has been modelled in a way to reinforce smallholder farmers to upkeep and align their agricultural practices to continuously produce premium quality cocoa beans, such that their income increases to over 500%.

 

About Manobi Group

Africa Cocoa Village is a program handled by Manobi Group. They have worked on optimising the efficiency and performance of value chains in agriculture and agro-industries, artisanal fishing, water management, management of local communities, and development of vulnerable populations by providing innovative business services through its platform. Manobi is pan-African comprehensive service company where all of its operations are digital ensure quality service and availability regardless of clients isolation and investment capacity. The Africa Cocoa Village focuses primarily on the cocoa sector in Ivory Coast, but is ready to expand into other cocoa producing countries and other cash and food crop productions.

Read more : www.agcelerant.com

 

Version française

Le problème

La chaine de production et de commercialisation primaire des fèves de cacao n’est pas formellement organisée, ce qui exclut les producteurs d’un accès structuré au marché et par conséquent de l’accès au crédit agricole, aux intrants et aux services de base. Les transactions dans cette chaine ne sont pas tracées avec pour conséquence une capture des marges de ce marché de 100 milliards de dollars essentiellement par les intermédiaires et les industriels, ne laissant aux agriculteurs que moins de 10% du prix d’une tablette de chocolat vendue au consommateur final. Cela maintient la plupart des producteurs de cacao dans une situation de pauvreté avec un accès limité à l’eau potable, à l’électricité, aux services de soins, à l’éducation et parfois à la sécurité alimentaire. Faute de pouvoir mettre en œuvre des pratiques agricoles durables améliorant la production et la qualité du cacao, la demande mondiale croissante est à l’origine d’une déforestation croissante qui réduit les zones protégées et les forêts naturelles a ainsi que la faune sauvage. Finalement le cacao devient le vecteur de tragédies économiques et environnementales au lieu de constituer le facteur de développement qu’il devrait être.

 

Notre promesse

Africa Cocoa Village veut transformer la chaine de valeur du cacao en la valorisant avec les producteurs pour répondre aux attentes actuelles du consommateur et ainsi poser les bases du standard mondial des réseaux d’alimentation du futur. Ancré sur l’amélioration des conditions de vie du planteur de cacao et da famille et son articulation avec la production d’un cacao de qualité, la traçabilité des opérations le long du continuum allant de la production à la commercialisation, la régularité de l’approvisionnement, la gestion responsable des ressources naturelles, Africa Cocoa Village redéfinit le chocolat comme un instrument unique de développement, en constituant une expérience universelle enrichissant à la fois les consommateurs et les planteurs.

Plus sur www.africacocoavillage.com

 

Comment çà marche?

Africa Cocoa Village marrie le suivi physique des transactions avec l’exploitation des solutions digitales et en ouvrant ainsi la voie à l’intégration d’une transparence complète, d’interactions responsables et d’un principe d’approvisionnement honorable entre les agriculteurs, les industriels et les consommateurs. Pour cela Africa Cocoa Village a conçu une plateforme digitale exploitée sur chaque plantation pour appuyer et tracer l’activité agricole des planteurs en temps réel et établir un nouveau standard de consommation responsable.

Africa Cocoa Village suit et trace chaque lot de fèves de cacao avec les planteurs depuis la plantation jusqu'au site de livraison de l’acheteur final, le plus souvent un chocolatier ou confiseur, fabriquant le produit destiné au consommateur. Grâce aux indicateurs de performance alimenté par ce système, Africa Cocoa Village « dérisque » toute la chaine de valeur, protège les investissements de l’agriculteurs et donc la chaine d’approvisionnement de l’industriel avec des services d’assurance agricole contre les risques environnementaux et climatiques. Chaque parcelle de cacao est précisément géo-référencée, les itinéraires techniques améliorés suivis par les planteurs sont documentés et chaque intervention renseignée en temps réel, un réseau d’agents techniques assiste les planteurs, la logistique est optimisée sur l’ensemble de la chaine, les paiements sont sécurisés. Enfin l'identifiant unique d’Africa Cocoa Village encodé sur chaque sac de fèves permet de retracer son origine, son itinéraire et son histoire détaillés et, de manière transparente et sincère, supporte la commercialisation d’un cacao Premium.

 

Notre objectif

En structurant ainsi la chaine de valeur du cacao, Africa Cocoa Village vise à sécuriser les transactions entre tous les acteurs et en particulier de manière inclusive des petits producteurs de cacao. Grâce à ces interactions sécurisées et transparentes avec le marché, Africa Cocoa Village renforce les capacités du planteur à produire du cacao de qualité Premium pour lui permettre d’augmenter de 60% ses revenus à l’hectare et d’améliorer son retour sur investissement avec les fournisseurs d’intrants, les banques, les compagnies d’assurance et ses acheteurs.

 

Impact attendu

Africa Cocoa Village offert aussi une des dernières chances de réponse effective à l’important niveau de déforestation provoqué par la production de cacao et d’autres cultures pérennes. Son dispositif de géo-référencement explicite et granulaire des plantations permet d’identifier immédiatement les plantations établies dans les zones protégées, les forêts et les parcs nationaux. De plus, Africa Cocoa Village ouvre des perspectives claires d’amélioration des solutions de gestion de la fertilité des sols qui contribuent à améliorer le rendement du cacao et donc à stopper la déforestation en accompagnant le développement de systèmes de production enfin durables.

Africa Cocoa Village optimise la logistique du cacao le long de la chaine de valeur, ce qui réduit les charges opérationnelles correspondantes et par conséquent libère des marges additionnelles partagées sous forme de prime à la qualité aux planteurs. Africa Cocoa Village génère ainsi un cercle vertueux dans lequel l’investissement de toute la chaine de valeur augmente les dividendes qui sont réinvestis dans des opportunités de développement local des planteurs et de leur communauté, comme la création d’emplois pour les jeunes, l’amélioration de l’accès aux services de base comme l’eau potable, l’électricité et les services de soins. Enfin en incitant les enseignants comme les élèves à aller à l’école, Africa Cocoa Village exploite la capacité de transformation d’un marché global comme celui du cacao pour engager et porter à l’échelle le développement local des communautés rurales productrices de cacao.

 

Risques et Challenges

La volatilité des prix du cacao sur le marché international peut limiter l’intérêt des planteurs à continuer à produire du cacao Premium pour les acheteurs et les industriels.

  • Africa Cocoa Village continuera à sécuriser les revenus des planteurs en les aidant à améliorer les rendements en cacao en généralisant l’exploitation des bonnes pratiques, et à développer l’économie de leur exploitation familiale grâce à une gestion optimisée de la diversification de leur production.

La compétition économique à l’intérieur de la chaine de valeur du cacao peut constituer une barrière à l’approche de transparence, de traçabilité et de confiance respective que développe Africa Cocoa Village.

  • En permettant au consommateur de participer activement à la construction de ce village, Africa Cocoa Village déplace le cadre de cette compétition économique pour explorer d’autres options économiques intéressantes pour les acteurs. L’adoption de ces options nécessitera l’engagement d’un important effort de marketing dont la probabilité de retour sur investissement restera forte.

 

Sur Africa Cocoa Village

Africa Cocoa Village est une initiative du groupe Manobi pan-africain spécialisé dans l’orchestration de création de valeur dans les chaines du secteur agricole, des sociétés d’eau, de la gestion des collectivités local et du développement des populations vulnérable, par la fourniture de services métiers innovants à travers sa plate-forme digitale. Dans le secteur de l’agriculture, Manobi a développé la plate-forme agCelerant™ (www.agcelerant.com) sur laquelle Africa Cocoa Village opère ses services. Africa Cocoa Village a démarré ses operations en Côte d’Ivoire, et est déjà préparé à les étendre dans d’autres pays producteurs de cacao et sur d’autres cultures à valeur commerciale et alimentaire.

story:
Our Story

My name is Fran Pickering, I am the life partner of Nigel Bamford, inventor of Bamford's Waterblade and now: 'Waterblade Easy'. We are ordinary people, concerned about our planet and what the future might look like.

Our future and that of all our children, rests on the choices make today. Nigel has dedicated all of his time for the past 5 years into developing his energy and water saving device, that will work with many standard mixer taps. A simple but brilliant idea that in real terms, saves the user over 60% on water and water heating for their tap. Having won many awards and had a good deal of success with Mark 1, we have creatively used all the feed back, to  improve on our product. Firstly, we have made it easy for anyone to install and effective in more diverse situations.We believe that the latest model, when brought to market, has the potential to impact water usage and energy consumption around the world. 

We are asking for your support in realising that potential.

For this to happen, we will need financial support to get high volume manufacturing, individual country accreditation, IP protection and a marketing campaign that will let the world know about the Waterblade "Easy". In return, we promise a clean supply chain, a quality  controlled, durable product that is affordable and environmentally friendly. Not to forget the warm feeling of knowing you are helping to change the world for the better. We are proud to be part of the new "ethical business revolution". 

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

Will it fit my tap?

Waterblade will fit most standard size Mixer taps. Just change the Nozzle. Standard size is 24mm or 15/16th inch in the USA. In the UK that is close to the size of a 10 pence coin , in the USA a quarter, one Euro in Europe, in Canada 25 cent, in South Africa 2 Rand and Australia 10 cent. 

 

How Easy is it to fit?

Simply remove the existing nozzle and screw in the 'Waterblade Easy'. That easy, which is why we think it has so much potential.

 

How confident are we that we can deliver? 

We have already successfully brought the award winning Waterblade to market, and sold 10,000 units in the UK and abroad. Our UK manufacturer is Quality assured (ISO 9001), and we have a fully tested, priced and working prototype for this new model. The answer is Very Confident!

Why are we giving to Wateraid?

Here at Waterblade we really want to be part of the solution to water scarcity issues globally and we really like the work Wateraid do in bringing water supply to highly impoverished areas around the world..

Why are we giving to Brighton Permaculture Trust?

Because we also believe in local action as part of the big picture. This is local to us, with multiple yields: Their "Sussex Orchard planting Project" for communities, gives healthy, nutritious fruit, free to the public for generations to come, while engaging and growing those communities in the here and now. All while taking Co2 out the atmosphere. 

We need to raise £35,000  to cover the costs presented here:

Sales and Marketing :                                                       £15,000

Getting our brand and message out there globally including a new launch video,website upgrade, including translations and other global selling requirements. New packaging and instructions.

Manufacturing associated costs and Stock;           £15,000     

If we  pre-order in volume, it will significantly bring down the unit cost, and we are already passing this on to our customers in our pricing structure.

Accreditation's and Patents in different countries:  £5,000

Mostly for maintenance of existing international patents and updates to approvals.

Total:                                                   £35,000

 

What do we bring to the table? 

  • We already have much of the infrastructure in place and have invested over £50,000 in the Waterblade products .
  • Bamford's Waterblade is a small ethically run family business.
  • We have had essential, invaluable support from the Brighton based "Green Growth Platform" .
  • Over 5  years of dedicated development and people time. In short we are completely committed to making the 'Waterblade Easy'.

What are we offering to our Supporters?

  • Perks:  UK/ Europe/ USA/Canada /Australia/ South Africa only as we currently cannot guarantee delivery in other areas without prohibitive postage costs. Postage is door to door except South Africa, where we shall use Postnet, pick up locally.
  • Tier 1:  £6. Washroom or Bathroom . 1 X ‘Waterblade Easy’  with 1 x Chromed collar and fitting instructions. (Expected Price Less 10%)
  • Tier 2: £11. Washroom and Bathroom . 2 X ‘Waterblade Easy’  with 2 x Chromed collar and fitting instructions. (Expected Price Less 15%) 
  • Tier 3: £26 Business Pack. 5 X ‘Waterblade Easy’  with 5 x Chromed collar and fitting instructions. (Expected Price Less 20%)   
  • Waterblade supports WaterAid and Brighton Permaculture Trust. We are committed to donate a minimum of 10p per Waterblade Pack.                       

What makes the 'Waterblade Easy' special?                                                                              

Here are 5 things:

  •  It can reduce your water use from as much as 14 litres a minute to just 2.7 litres a minute! What ever your water pressure- saving you over 60% : Water, Money, Co2 and Energy. 
  •  It is really easy to fit and requires little maintenance once installed.
  • It can be easily moved, re-used and is  recyclable (not that you will want to ever stop using it)
  • Perhaps most importantly, it gives a beautiful and  luxurious hand washing experience.
  • Its also good when brushing teeth or shaving
  • In case  we do not reach our full target, we shall prioritise our obligations to supporters,  and reduce our ambitious global marketing plans.

The Impact

  • The way we see it at Waterblade, in order to soften the now inevitable effects of climate change, we must effect change in some of our western practices, such as our thinking in a disposable, throw away manner. People love to be clean and its about how we go about things; no more the out of sight, out of mind, more systems thinking  like we are beginning to do with global supply chains and anti slavery. We the public are the consumer, so let us embrace this responsibility with real power and intention to do things better. Celebrate innovation and scientific breakthroughs, but question the hows and the whys of what we do. Each person is a member of the global economy and has something to say and choices to make about it. This includes, what kind of world  we want to create from here. A world where we are fighting wars over water, or one where water is treated with respect as a  resource for all? 
  • We think Waterblade helps us to do that, while taking the pain out of cutting back and giving satisfaction in savings at the same time.
  • We launched our original Waterblade a year and a half ago and have been steadily building relationships across many business sectors. we have found that the limitations of the first product meant it was ideal for a business, but lacked features ideal for the domestic user. So while we continue to promote Bamford's Waterblade, we have been beavering away to create "the Easy Fit" version which has integrated optimised flow, thus doing away with any faffing under the sink or a need to have isolation valves. From here on in, it's just screw in and go! No Plumber Required!

Risks & Challenges

One risk is not keeping up momentum, (which is why we really need people to like and share our campaign) .We have been committed to this for some years now, we know we are committed to continue.

Keeping the costs down around distribution so that it remains affordable. In order to do this, We are carefully selecting who and how the Waterblade will be distributed in different countries/ regions of the world. 

Another risk are Copycats. In these modern times of manufacturing it is virtually impossible to stop  fakes and copying and sadly, sometimes rip offs can destroy the original product.

To help us with this issue, we have a strong focus on building a branded product that is second to none in performance and reliability.  We have also invested heavily in patents and other intellectual property protections internationally.

We want you to know,  that what we bring to the table is embedded in quality, free from slavery , reliable and environmentally sustainable, from production to installation, not because that's fashionable, but because as individuals, we believe it is the only way to create a better world.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate not everyone can donate to our fundraiser, but we would really value your support by liking and sharing with your friends and colleagues.

Thank you for taking time and interest in "Waterblade Easy"

If you like what you see, Just hit the share button!
story_txt:
Our Story
My name is Fran Pickering, I am the life partner of Nigel Bamford, inventor of Bamford's Waterblade and now: 'Waterblade Easy'. We are ordinary people, concerned about our planet and what the future might look like.
Our future and that of all our children, rests on the choices make today. Nigel has dedicated all of his time for the past 5 years into developing his energy and water saving device, that will work with many standard mixer taps. A simple but brilliant idea that in real terms, saves the user over 60% on water and water heating for their tap. Having won many awards and had a good deal of success with Mark 1, we have creatively used all the feed back, to  improve on our product. Firstly, we have made it easy for anyone to install and effective in more diverse situations.We believe that the latest model, when brought to market, has the potential to impact water usage and energy consumption around the world. 
We are asking for your support in realising that potential.
For this to happen, we will need financial support to get high volume manufacturing, individual country accreditation, IP protection and a marketing campaign that will let the world know about the Waterblade "Easy". In return, we promise a clean supply chain, a quality  controlled, durable product that is affordable and environmentally friendly. Not to forget the warm feeling of knowing you are helping to change the world for the better. We are proud to be part of the new "ethical business revolution". 
 


 
 
What We Need & What You Get
 
Will it fit my tap?
Waterblade will fit most standard size Mixer taps. Just change the Nozzle. Standard size is 24mm or 15/16th inch in the USA. In the UK that is close to the size of a 10 pence coin , in the USA a quarter, one Euro in Europe, in Canada 25 cent, in South Africa 2 Rand and Australia 10 cent. 

 
How Easy is it to fit?
Simply remove the existing nozzle and screw in the 'Waterblade Easy'. That easy, which is why we think it has so much potential.
 

How confident are we that we can deliver? 
We have already successfully brought the award winning Waterblade to market, and sold 10,000 units in the UK and abroad. Our UK manufacturer is Quality assured (ISO 9001), and we have a fully tested, priced and working prototype for this new model. The answer is Very Confident!
Why are we giving to Wateraid?
Here at Waterblade we really want to be part of the solution to water scarcity issues globally and we really like the work Wateraid do in bringing water supply to highly impoverished areas around the world..
Why are we giving to Brighton Permaculture Trust?
Because we also believe in local action as part of the big picture. This is local to us, with multiple yields: Their "Sussex Orchard planting Project" for communities, gives healthy, nutritious fruit, free to the public for generations to come, while engaging and growing those communities in the here and now. All while taking Co2 out the atmosphere. 
We need to raise £35,000  to cover the costs presented here:
Sales and Marketing :                                                       £15,000
Getting our brand and message out there globally including a new launch video,website upgrade, including translations and other global selling requirements. New packaging and instructions.
Manufacturing associated costs and Stock;           £15,000     
If we  pre-order in volume, it will significantly bring down the unit cost, and we are already passing this on to our customers in our pricing structure.
Accreditation's and Patents in different countries:  £5,000
Mostly for maintenance of existing international patents and updates to approvals.
Total:                                                   £35,000
 
What do we bring to the table? 

We already have much of the infrastructure in place and have invested over £50,000 in the Waterblade products .
Bamford's Waterblade is a small ethically run family business.
We have had essential, invaluable support from the Brighton based "Green Growth Platform" .
Over 5  years of dedicated development and people time. In short we are completely committed to making the 'Waterblade Easy'.

What are we offering to our Supporters?

Perks:  UK/ Europe/ USA/Canada /Australia/ South Africa only as we currently cannot guarantee delivery in other areas without prohibitive postage costs. Postage is door to door except South Africa, where we shall use Postnet, pick up locally.

Tier 1:  £6. Washroom or Bathroom . 1 X ‘Waterblade Easy’  with 1 x Chromed collar and fitting instructions. (Expected Price Less 10%)

Tier 2: £11. Washroom and Bathroom . 2 X ‘Waterblade Easy’  with 2 x Chromed collar and fitting instructions. (Expected Price Less 15%) 


Tier 3: £26 Business Pack. 5 X ‘Waterblade Easy’  with 5 x Chromed collar and fitting instructions. (Expected Price Less 20%)   

Waterblade supports WaterAid and Brighton Permaculture Trust. We are committed to donate a minimum of 10p per Waterblade Pack.                       


What makes the 'Waterblade Easy' special?                                                                               
Here are 5 things:

 It can reduce your water use from as much as 14 litres a minute to just 2.7 litres a minute! What ever your water pressure- saving you over 60% : Water, Money, Co2 and Energy. 
 It is really easy to fit and requires little maintenance once installed.
It can be easily moved, re-used and is  recyclable (not that you will want to ever stop using it)
Perhaps most importantly, it gives a beautiful and  luxurious hand washing experience.
Its also good when brushing teeth or shaving
In case  we do not reach our full target, we shall prioritise our obligations to supporters,  and reduce our ambitious global marketing plans.


The Impact

The way we see it at Waterblade, in order to soften the now inevitable effects of climate change, we must effect change in some of our western practices, such as our thinking in a disposable, throw away manner. People love to be clean and its about how we go about things; no more the out of sight, out of mind, more systems thinking  like we are beginning to do with global supply chains and anti slavery. We the public are the consumer, so let us embrace this responsibility with real power and intention to do things better. Celebrate innovation and scientific breakthroughs, but question the hows and the whys of what we do. Each person is a member of the global economy and has something to say and choices to make about it. This includes, what kind of world  we want to create from here. A world where we are fighting wars over water, or one where water is treated with respect as a  resource for all? 
We think Waterblade helps us to do that, while taking the pain out of cutting back and giving satisfaction in savings at the same time.
We launched our original Waterblade a year and a half ago and have been steadily building relationships across many business sectors. we have found that the limitations of the first product meant it was ideal for a business, but lacked features ideal for the domestic user. So while we continue to promote Bamford's Waterblade, we have been beavering away to create "the Easy Fit" version which has integrated optimised flow, thus doing away with any faffing under the sink or a need to have isolation valves. From here on in, it's just screw in and go! No Plumber Required!


Risks & Challenges

Keeping the costs down around distribution so that it remains affordable. In order to do this, We are carefully selecting who and how the Waterblade will be distributed in different countries/ regions of the world. 
Another risk are Copycats. In these modern times of manufacturing it is virtually impossible to stop  fakes and copying and sadly, sometimes rip offs can destroy the original product.
To help us with this issue, we have a strong focus on building a branded product that is second to none in performance and reliability.  We have also invested heavily in patents and other intellectual property protections internationally.
