story: Project terminated.
story_txt: Project terminated.

story:
Why

We at ArganOne believe people will appreciate having zero energy bills, or get paid for generating more energy than they use at our houses. Solar and wind power are also clean, zero emissions power sources.

This is just the start! We are also looking to expand beyond Florida.

Our Background

With our combined experience of more than 20 years in the engineering and restaurant process management fields, we know we can succeed. We believe strongly in ethical principles, so you can be assured that the money you contribute will be used wisely.

We have also established hiring and employee management processes that we think new employees will love. The health, safety and overall well-being of our employees are very important to us.

Our Funding Needs

We are looking for $15,000,000 because we'd like to purchase and lease as well as resell at least 40 houses in Florida within the next year. All of them will be upgraded to use 100% solar and wind power along with other technologies such as energy storage and EV (electric vehicle) charging stations. The subsequent money from both leasing a percentage of the homes and selling the remaining portion will help fund future home purchases. If you consider the value of thousands of other companies in the US and beyond, the amount we are asking for is relatively small in comparison.

In addition to direct contributions of any amount, you also have the option of purchasing one or more of the items or discount packages we have available. See more to the right.

Moving Forward

Some of the challenges we face are:

1. Making sure each home we purchase fits our vision, as we want our customers to enjoy living in our houses and of course benefit from zero energy bills (or get paid for generating energy).

2. Coordinating simultaneous projects for the solar and wind systems as well as other home upgrades for multiple homes.

3. Work with suppliers and installers such as Tesla, Plugless Power and others to get the projects completed correctly and within a reasonable amount of time. We will use only quality materials and our methods will follow best practices.

4. Expansion outside of Florida, while very exciting, also comes with a significant amount of work required both in hiring new people for the new regions and working with new providers, including installers.

We know we can do all these things and more with your help. Now, let's continue the journey!

Our Team

As new people are hired, we will post updates here.

ArganOne team members:

Ray Brown: President and CEO

Jose Celis: Director

How you can Help

Whether you are able to contribute or not, we ask you to:

  • Help spread the word.
  • Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools at the top.

Frequently Asked Questions

1. I'm in Florida and am interested in one of your houses powered 100% by solar and wind energy. When will I be able to tour one?

A. We plan to have a demonstration ArganOne house available for viewing online, and of course you'll also have the option of touring it.

2. I would like to live in one of your houses, but I'm not in Florida. How soon will you expand to my area?

A. We are looking to expand beyond Florida, so stay tuned for details!

3. Are the houses you show with the solar panels and wind turbines real?

A. The houses shown are renderings we created for demonstrating the concept. We will be posting updates on our site as we purchase the homes and the solar and wind power installations are completed.

4. I heard that Tesla and other organizations are helping places such as Puerto Rico and Houston, which have been devastated by hurricanes this year. Do you have any plans to do the same?

A. We have seen the terrible impacts of multiple severe storms including hurricanes Harvey, Irma, and Maria in 2017. We not only sympathize with those affected but also have plans to give a minimum of 5% of the money we receive to the people impacted through direct contributions as well as assistance to companies such as Tesla, which brought the power back online in Puerto Rico at San Juan’s Children’s Hospital using 100% solar energy. While we did not contribute to that specific project, we absolutely want to help with others like it.

5. This looks like a lot of work. How can you better assure me that you will be able to do what you are saying?

A. We have more than 20 years combined of engineering and management experience, and we know we can accomplish this. We also have implemented sound financial management policies, and are working to ensure the business is run efficiently. We're not just dedicated to our mission, we're passionate about it!

Thank You

We very much appreciate you for checking out our fundraiser and considering being part of something amazing! We also thank everyone who made this campaign and the work we do possible. A special thanks goes to Indiegogo for hosting our campaign.

We additionally encourage you to visit and bookmark our site: ArganOne.com.

A. We have more than 20 years combined of engineering and management experience, and we know we can accomplish this. We also have implemented sound financial management policies, and are working to ensure the business is run efficiently. We're not just dedicated to our mission, we're passionate about it!
Thank You

We additionally encourage you to visit and bookmark our site: ArganOne.com.

story:
THE PROBLEM

Every spring, snowmelt creates flood conditions along many rivers across the country, from North Dakota to Louisiana and everywhere in between. Increasingly intense storms are dumping incredible amounts of rainfall in mountains that race to lowlands, causing rivers to swell beyond their banks. In every corner of the country, floods are a threat. And having protection against rising waters is critical. In the US 5.6 million families have flood insurance yet almost 25 million people live in flood-prone areas.

Flood insurance is getting more expensive every year and harder and harder to find. Because of sea level rise and other factors, insurance companies are not writing policies for people in flood-prone areas like they used to - from barrier islands to New York City's upper eastside. The flood threat is real and growing.

Options to fight floods are limited. Living at the mercy of Mother Nature is difficult and stressful, hoping your town, home and family will be spared. The most common solution is the sandbag.

OUR SOLUTION

Now there is another option - one that will put the power to protect your family and livelihood in your own hands, without all the hassle of filling thousands of sandbags before the waters rise. We call it Diluvium Dry and it’s the first portable and reusable flood barrier made from long life and industrial strength material and designed for rapid deployment.

Unlike sandbags, Diluvium Dry doesn’t require an army of volunteers to load mountains of sand into individual bags and put them in place well in advance of a flood’s arrival. Diluvium Dry also does not require special disposal after floodwaters recede. It can be rolled up and put away in a shed or other small space until it is needed again. Sandbags absorb all the contaminants in the floodwater and after the flood crisis is over they must be disposed of properly and at great expense.

Flooding is the number one emergency or natural disaster that people are likely to experience in their lifetimes. Hurricanes carrying deluges of water, intense storms and seasonal snowmelt make rivers rise and overtop their banks, threatening cities, neighborhoods and property.

Two major flood events last year – the Louisiana flood and Hurricane Matthew – damaged over 60,000 homes and businesses and cost taxpayers over $20 billion. Those were two significant flood events but there are the smaller, less severe floods that occur all the time and to the people effected, they are just as significant.

We want to put the power of flood protection in the hands of people that need it most. People who live in flood-prone areas who can’t just pick up and move out of the way when waters rise need a better solution than sandbags. They deserve more than just suffering through the devastation of a flood then plucking soggy photo albums from the wreckage of their homes.

Flood insurance is important but it only partly covers damages.  An insurance flood policy doesn’t prevent the destruction that Diluvium Dry can. It merely helps pick up the pieces afterwards when the damage has already been done.

We don’t think people should need to suffer through a flood only to hope for some sort of payout to rebuild their lives. We believe that people want to do all they can to protect themselves, their families and property. And we are offering an alternative that puts the power of flood mitigation in people’s hands.

Our patented technology is easy to use and only requires one or two people to set up. It's designed for rapid deployment. It is reusable. And, it's the same price per foot as sandbags.

Imagine being able to do something different when you hear waters upstream are rising and rolling your way. Now, people living in flood-prone areas move everything to higher ground – whether it’s farm machinery, furniture or photo albums. Once that chore is done, they either evacuate or hunker down and wait for the flood to arrive.

Most floods are slow-moving events that give people ample time to brace themselves and fill thousands of sandbags.

THE GOAL

Wouldn’t it make more sense to be able to go to your local home improvement store, get the Diluvium Dry kit and take it home for setup? Wouldn’t it be better after holding back floodwaters the first time to be able to go into the basement, shed or attic to get your roll of Diluvium Dry?

This is our goal. And with your help we can make sure that family farms, low-lying neighborhoods and riverfront communities have a new flood-fighting tool.

But it doesn’t stop there. We want to get Diluvium Dry into the hands of fire departments and first responders. We want to make sure disaster relief agencies can use Diluvium Dry during a crisis. And we want to be able to provide an outlet for clean, potable water in developing nations or in areas suffering after a disaster like a flood, earthquake or tsunami.

We want to be able to help protect important infrastructure – from airports to schools to public utilities – from floods.

 

By supporting this campaign you are contributing to a much-needed solution to fight floods. Whether or not you are someone who will buy Diluvium Dry yourself to safeguard your family from rising water this is a product that will add another layer of flood protection for us all.

By donating to bring this project to market you will help keep the price low and locked for those who need it most. And by getting us to our goal you will help us get the required certification to sell Diluvium Dry commercially.

 

THE STORY

We have been refining and testing Diluvium Dry in Norway for two years. Now we are ready to bring this important product to the US and the rest of the world.

Helge Krogenes is a Norwegian flood relief expert who has worked with flood- relief business development and customer installations in Europe, Asia and the US since 2003. He has been on the ground in during flood events, installing flood relief systems in Fargo, North Dakota, Bangkok, Thailand, New York, New Orleans and during similar events in Europe. With his years of experience he designed Diluvium Dry as a better solution than the obsolete sandbags and other existing flood protection systems. As a flood expert he wanted to create something more effective and less polluting than sandbags and something that doesn’t require heavy equipment to erect a semi-permanent structure to hold back a flood.

After doing a number of flood fights himself he confirmed that most floods don’t rise rapidly. Many standard flood events – flood fields, roads and low-lying neighborhoods can be handled with a four-foot tall barrier. So he set to work trying to figure out how to use the floodwater itself to make the barrier stronger.

After designing a prototype he began to test his theory. He knew what water weighs a lot and wanted to use the weight of water to hold the barrier in place and make the seal stronger. After tinkering with his design he built a lightweight flood defense system that rolls out and with a system of cables and battens creates an impenetrable flood barrier. And the Diluvium Dry system can be made any length simply by attaching pieces together with an interlocking and easy to use non permeable connection. 

This gives Diluvium Dry the flexibility that other flood barriers lack. You can build a Diluvium Dry perimeter around your home or a power station. It can protect a grain silo or an airport. Not only is the size of the barrier flexible but so is the industrial fabric. Unyielding flood walls must be assembled and attached to the ground with heavy equipment and a lot of advanced notice. Diluvium Dry can bend to go around corners and contour to any landscape. It can create concave or convex shapes.

And Diluvium Dry can reattach to itself, forming a complete circle. Imagine being able to run a flood-proof perimeter around your property, your neighborhood or your town.

Watch Diluvium Dry in action. 

 

THE HOPE

Disaster relief agencies will eventually be able to use Diluvium Dry to create water tanks for fresh drinking water. Often after a disaster – disease caused by contaminated water supply is an unfortunate after effect. With a simple modification to the flood barrier Diluvium Dry can be rapidly deployed as a fresh water containment tank. Not only will the system hold back flood waters but it will safely store safe and clean drinking water as well.

Imagine if Diluvium Dry had been available after the 2010 earthquake in Haiti. Cholera and other diseases may not have ravaged the population. Having access to clean water is something that most of us take for granted – until it’s gone. The next time global, national or local disaster strikes we want to make sure that first responders and disaster relief agencies have Diluvium Dry as an option – not just for keeping flood waters away from critical infrastructure but to ensure clean and safe drinking water is available in any crisis zone.

Your contribution will help make that possible. Support Diluvium Dry and help keep the price low for flood-prone families who need this product now. Donate today to help us reach our funding goal so we can become commercially certified and begin offering Diluvium Dry to Fire Departments, schools, airports and public utilities. Send us soaring beyond our goal to ensure that Diluvium Dry can be deployed by disaster relief agencies around the world – keeping flood waters away and providing a portable reservoir for safe and clean water.

In the US 5.6 million families have flood insurance yet almost 25 million people live in flood-prone areas. Flood insurance is getting more expensive every year and harder and harder to find. Because of sea level rise and other factors, insurance companies are not writing policies for people in flood-prone areas like they used to - from barrier islands to New York City's upper eastside. The flood threat is real and growing.Options to fight floods are limited. Living at the mercy of Mother Nature is difficult and stressful, hoping your town, home and family will be spared. The most common solution is the sandbag.OUR SOLUTIONNow there is another option - one that will put the power to protect your family and livelihood in your own hands, without all the hassle of filling thousands of sandbags before the waters rise. We call it Diluvium Dry and it’s the first portable and reusable flood barrier made from long life and industrial strength material and designed for rapid deployment.Unlike sandbags, Diluvium Dry doesn’t require an army of volunteers to load mountains of sand into individual bags and put them in place well in advance of a flood’s arrival. Diluvium Dry also does not require special disposal after floodwaters recede. It can be rolled up and put away in a shed or other small space until it is needed again. Sandbags absorb all the contaminants in the floodwater and after the flood crisis is over they must be disposed of properly and at great expense.Flooding is the number one emergency or natural disaster that people are likely to experience in their lifetimes. Hurricanes carrying deluges of water, intense storms and seasonal snowmelt make rivers rise and overtop their banks, threatening cities, neighborhoods and property.Two major flood events last year – the Louisiana flood and Hurricane Matthew – damaged over 60,000 homes and businesses and cost taxpayers over $20 billion. Those were two significant flood events but there are the smaller, less severe floods that occur all the time and to the people effected, they are just as significant.We want to put the power of flood protection in the hands of people that need it most. People who live in flood-prone areas who can’t just pick up and move out of the way when waters rise need a better solution than sandbags. They deserve more than just suffering through the devastation of a flood then plucking soggy photo albums from the wreckage of their homes.Flood insurance is important but it only partly covers damages.  An insurance flood policy doesn’t prevent the destruction that Diluvium Dry can. It merely helps pick up the pieces afterwards when the damage has already been done.We don’t think people should need to suffer through a flood only to hope for some sort of payout to rebuild their lives. We believe that people want to do all they can to protect themselves, their families and property. And we are offering an alternative that puts the power of flood mitigation in people’s hands.Our patented technology is easy to use and only requires one or two people to set up. It's designed for rapid deployment. It is reusable. And, it's the same price per foot as sandbags.Imagine being able to do something different when you hear waters upstream are rising and rolling your way. Now, people living in flood-prone areas move everything to higher ground – whether it’s farm machinery, furniture or photo albums. Once that chore is done, they either evacuate or hunker down and wait for the flood to arrive.Most floods are slow-moving events that give people ample time to brace themselves and fill thousands of sandbags.THE GOALWouldn’t it make more sense to be able to go to your local home improvement store, get the Diluvium Dry kit and take it home for setup? Wouldn’t it be better after holding back floodwaters the first time to be able to go into the basement, shed or attic to get your roll of Diluvium Dry?This is our goal. And with your help we can make sure that family farms, low-lying neighborhoods and riverfront communities have a new flood-fighting tool.But it doesn’t stop there. We want to get Diluvium Dry into the hands of fire departments and first responders. We want to make sure disaster relief agencies can use Diluvium Dry during a crisis. And we want to be able to provide an outlet for clean, potable water in developing nations or in areas suffering after a disaster like a flood, earthquake or tsunami.We want to be able to help protect important infrastructure – from airports to schools to public utilities – from floods. By supporting this campaign you are contributing to a much-needed solution to fight floods. Whether or not you are someone who will buy Diluvium Dry yourself to safeguard your family from rising water this is a product that will add another layer of flood protection for us all.By donating to bring this project to market you will help keep the price low and locked for those who need it most. And by getting us to our goal you will help us get the required certification to sell Diluvium Dry commercially.  THE STORYWe have been refining and testing Diluvium Dry in Norway for two years. Now we are ready to bring this important product to the US and the rest of the world.Helge Krogenes is a Norwegian flood relief expert who has worked with flood- relief business development and customer installations in Europe, Asia and the US since 2003. He has been on the ground in during flood events, installing flood relief systems in Fargo, North Dakota, Bangkok, Thailand, New York, New Orleans and during similar events in Europe. With his years of experience he designed Diluvium Dry as a better solution than the obsolete sandbags and other existing flood protection systems. As a flood expert he wanted to create something more effective and less polluting than sandbags and something that doesn’t require heavy equipment to erect a semi-permanent structure to hold back a flood.After doing a number of flood fights himself he confirmed that most floods don’t rise rapidly. Many standard flood events – flood fields, roads and low-lying neighborhoods can be handled with a four-foot tall barrier. So he set to work trying to figure out how to use the floodwater itself to make the barrier stronger.After designing a prototype he began to test his theory. He knew what water weighs a lot and wanted to use the weight of water to hold the barrier in place and make the seal stronger. After tinkering with his design he built a lightweight flood defense system that rolls out and with a system of cables and battens creates an impenetrable flood barrier. And the Diluvium Dry system can be made any length simply by attaching pieces together with an interlocking and easy to use non permeable connection. This gives Diluvium Dry the flexibility that other flood barriers lack. You can build a Diluvium Dry perimeter around your home or a power station. It can protect a grain silo or an airport. Not only is the size of the barrier flexible but so is the industrial fabric. Unyielding flood walls must be assembled and attached to the ground with heavy equipment and a lot of advanced notice. Diluvium Dry can bend to go around corners and contour to any landscape. It can create concave or convex shapes.And Diluvium Dry can reattach to itself, forming a complete circle. Imagine being able to run a flood-proof perimeter around your property, your neighborhood or your town.Watch Diluvium Dry in action. 
 THE HOPEDisaster relief agencies will eventually be able to use Diluvium Dry to create water tanks for fresh drinking water. Often after a disaster – disease caused by contaminated water supply is an unfortunate after effect. With a simple modification to the flood barrier Diluvium Dry can be rapidly deployed as a fresh water containment tank. Not only will the system hold back flood waters but it will safely store safe and clean drinking water as well.Imagine if Diluvium Dry had been available after the 2010 earthquake in Haiti. Cholera and other diseases may not have ravaged the population. Having access to clean water is something that most of us take for granted – until it’s gone. The next time global, national or local disaster strikes we want to make sure that first responders and disaster relief agencies have Diluvium Dry as an option – not just for keeping flood waters away from critical infrastructure but to ensure clean and safe drinking water is available in any crisis zone.Your contribution will help make that possible. Support Diluvium Dry and help keep the price low for flood-prone families who need this product now. Donate today to help us reach our funding goal so we can become commercially certified and begin offering Diluvium Dry to Fire Departments, schools, airports and public utilities. Send us soaring beyond our goal to ensure that Diluvium Dry can be deployed by disaster relief agencies around the world – keeping flood waters away and providing a portable reservoir for safe and clean water.

story:
SUPPORT THE FRONTLINE

Frontline workers need power to stay charged throughout the day while saving lives and staying connected.

Your support can help keep the frontline powered & connected. 
 

We are offering people the chance to buy a power bank at cost price, which will then be given to NHS frontline workers. Lifesaver power banks ready to be delivered to UK & US hospitals.

With over 300,000 UK nurses & 2.86m in the US, this is a global issue. 

US Astronaut, Scott Kelly launches Lifeline to the Frontline

 


Dr Eduardo Dolhun, explains the need for phone power for frontline workers.

Dr Eduardo Dolhun is a physician and Founder of DripDrop. Dr Eduardo Dolhun was awarded Mayo Clinic Humanitarian Achievement Award in 2017 

 

Chief Nurse Ruth May, shares story of the importance of phone power


 

910 LIFESAVERS DONATED TO HOSPITALS ALREADY...

UNIVERSITY LEWISHAM HOSPITAL, London, UK - 200 LIFESAVERS supported by Boodles
QUEEN ELIZABETH HOSPITAL, London, UK - 200 LIFESAVERS supported by Nissan
CHELSEA & WESTMINSTER HOSPITAL, London, UK - 400 LIFESAVERS supported by Octopus Energy
KINGSTON HOSPITAL, London, UK - 30 LIFESAVERS supported by Louise Piper, Lina Ghayor, Alex Taylor, Jessamy Baird, R. Viner, M. Quitmann, Chris Wilkinson, Michael Forder, Arlo Wilkinson
DOVETAIL CARE HOME, Leeds, UK - 30 LIFESAVERS supported by Caragh Booth, G. Elliott, D. Zwicky, Gary Shuckford
ROYAL HAMPSHIRE COUNTY HOSPITAL, Winchester, UK - 20 LIFESAVERS supported by Lauren Druce, Paul Kelleher, Sue Ansell, Edwin Hamilton, Sean Curtis, Oliver Hester
MACCLESFIELD DISTRICT GENERAL HOSPITAL, Cheshire, UK - 30 LIFESAVERS supported by Jake Aliker, Simon Burckhardt, Jane Middleton, Chris Parker, Jonathan Steinberg, Gary Shuckford

HELP US ADD MORE & WE WILL ADD YOUR NAME HERE



SUPPORT PARTNERS

Lifeline to the Frontline is a collaboration of partners to support frontline workers. 


"At Landbot, we do our best to celebrate moments that make life meaningful and we couldn’t be more excited to partner with Lifesaver to keep frontline workers powered and connected during this difficult time.” 
Jiaqi Pan, CEO, Landbot

“We are incredibly proud to be supporting this initiative from Lifeline to the Frontline and to be supplying the power banks that are distributed amongst NHS staff. Keeping devices charged keeps people connected. NHS staff can use devices to access their own support networks and patients can speak to loved ones in their time of need. Powering these devices with 100% renewable energy is beneficial for the planet and the people most affected by this virus.”
Zoisa Walton, CEO of Octopus Energy for Business

"We’re delighted and grateful that Lifesaver has joined our #FuelforNHSheroes campaign, donating 400 power banks to Lewisham and Greenwich Trust hospital. With Lifesaver’s generous help, we’ve expanded our support for frontline workers beyond healthy meals to pocket-sized power, proving what heights can be achieved by harnessing a community committed to driving positive change."
Paul van Zyl, The Conduit’s co-founder

USE OF FUNDS

For every £10/$12.50 raised this will be split as follows:

65% - Lifesaver power bank (5000mAh)
5%  - Shipping/delivery to hospitals and frontline workers
2.5% - Indiegogo transaction fee (50% reduced)
3% - Stripe transaction fee
16.7% - VAT
1.2% - Labour cost for charging power banks so they are full and ready to go
1.9% - Sticker for each power bank for frontline worker to share their story
4.7% - contribute to procuring more power banks

 

DONATION PERKS

£10 = 1 x Power bank donated to the frontline 
£20 = 2 x Power banks donated to the frontline 
£40 = 4 x Power banks donated to the frontline 
£100 = 10 x Power banks donated to the frontline
£500 = 50 x Power banks donated to the frontline
£2,500 = 250 x Power banks donated to the frontline + Corporate logo on website: www.lifelinetothefrontline.com


LIFESAVER POWER BANK 

Pocket size 
5000mAh battery size 
2 year warranty
All devices enabled (cables built in)
Rechargeable using micro usb 
Battery light indicator 


 

PACKED WITH CLEAN ENERGY

 


 

#LifelineToTheFrontline

story:
Chi Siamo

Tekiin srl è una startup innovativa nata in Italia nel 2019.

  • 5 anni di ricerca e sviluppo;
  • 1 brevetto internazionale;
  • 1 algoritmo di proprietà basato su intelligenza artificiale e machine learnig;
  • ​20 anni e più di esperienza nel campo elettronico e termo-idraulico dei nostri ingegneri.

Tekiin guarda al futuro con attenzione e cura dell’ambiente che ci circonda, con il massimo rispetto per il comfort individuale e la cura della collettività.

Un futuro in cui le persone lasciano alle macchine il compito di migliorare la propria vita, il proprio ambiente, e le economie domestiche.

I primi due prototipi stanno funzionando regolarmente da un anno.

I primi 5 prodotti pre-industrializzati sono installati e funzionano a meraviglia, rispettando gli standard richiesti e i risultati attesi.

Attraverso questa campagna di crowdfunding cerchiamo l'opportunità di avviare una prima produzione in serie di TekiinHome, progettato per le case di oggi, di ieri e soprattutto di domani.

Inizia a salvare il pianeta con noi, partecipa alla nostra campagna.

 

Quali innovazioni?

Il nostro algoritmo brevettato ci consente di ottenere importanti vantaggi e differenze significative rispetto ai comuni termostati intelligenti. Proprio queste differenze ci consentono di ottenere risparmi così importanti nella bolletta del riscaldamento.

Vediamo assieme di cosa si tratta:

  • Analisi dell'edificio in regime dinamico e continuo
  • Algoritmo di proprietà e brevettato
  • Calcolo dei risparmi in tempo reale e su dati reali
  • Definizione reale della classe energetica dell'edifico
  • Tecnologia dotata di machine learning

 

I Nostri Obiettivi

Siamo qui per raccogliere € 9,000 per finanziare la produzione dei primi 30 prodotti di serie di TekiinHome.

L'intero importo verrà utilizzato per la realizzazione e spedizione dei prodotti. Continuiamo a mettere, nel nostro lavoro, la passione che ci ha spinto a portare avanti questa idea visionaria e ambiziosa: raggiungere il 60% di risparmio energetico e di risorse fossili per il riscaldamento domestico.

 

Compatibilità

Questi primi prodotti saranno compatibili con tutte le abitazioni dotate di impianto termo autonomo con radiatori a parete e alimentate da caldaie a gas, con 1, 2, 3 o 4 di zone di riscaldamento (da 1 a 4 termostati).

 

Cosa puoi ottenere

L'offerta dedicata a coloro che credono in noi e nei nostri valori, include una serie di vantaggi unici e fantastici:

  • iniziare già dal prossimo inverno a risparmiare molte risorse e molti soldi per il riscaldamento domestico;
  • risparmiare fino al 60% sul prezzo di acquisto;
  • avere un abbonamento a vita sull'uso di TekiinHome, risparmiando denaro aggiuntivo;
  • prova per primi al mondo i vantaggi del comfort assoluto di TekiinHome.

Se non dovessimo raggiungere l'importo minimo di € 9.000, i soldi raccolti verranno comunque utilizzati per realizzare i prodotti da consegnare a coloro che ci hanno supportato; eventuali differenze di prezzo saranno a nostro carico.

 

Quale tipologia scegliere?

TekiinHome è stato sviluppato per gestire al meglio la temperatura, con il massimo del comfort e del risparmio, per case di piccole e medie dimensioni.

I quattro modelli si differenziano per il numero di zone di riscaldamento gestite:

  • TekiinHome 1 zone può gestire una sola zona di riscaldamento;
  • TekiinHome 2 zones può gestire una o due zone di riscaldamento;
  • TekiinHome 3 zones può gestire fino a tre zone di riscaldamento;
  • TekiinHome 4 zones può gestire fino a quattro zone di riscaldamento.

Le zone di riscaldamento sono riconoscibili dal numero di termostati presenti in casa: ogni singolo termostato equivale a una zona di riscaldamento.

A voi la scelta e, in caso di dubbi, non esitate a scriverci a in@tekiin.com.

 

Il nostro impatto

L'impatto sul bilancio energetico sarà decisamente ridotto quando molti clienti useranno Tekiin. La riduzione delle risorse utilizzate per riscaldare le case, che raggiungerà il 60%, contribuirà davvero a rallentare il cambiamento climatico globale.

Aggiungete a tutto questo un comfort abitativo mai sperimentato prima, senza mai avere troppo caldo o troppo freddo.

Non pensare più alla regolazione della temperatura o al costo della bolletta!

 

Rischi? Nessun Rischio

Tutti i prodotti acquistati saranno consegnati entro ottobre 2020. È il nostro impegno per coloro che credono nella nostra iniziativa e per il nostro pianeta.

Con il lancio di un nuovo prodotto, ci sono sempre dei rischi. Siamo certi che il rischio per questo progetto sia molto basso. Siamo pronti per iniziare la produzione una volta raggiunto il nostro obiettivo di finanziamento. Il nostro team è pronto al 100% per portare TekiinHome nelle vostre case.

Generalmente il rischio maggiore su qualsiasi piattaforma di crowdfunding è rappresentato dai ritardi della produzione. Le cose possono sempre cambiare lungo la strada quando si produce un nuovo prodotto per la prima volta. Con un prodotto tecnologico, ci sono molti ostacoli da superare e siamo pronti per questo.

Abbiamo già realizzato i primi 5 prodotti con tecniche semi-industriali, e tutto è filato liscio. Ma siamo qui anche per raccogliere sensazioni e suggerimenti, e tutte le informazioni che arriveranno, nei commenti, nei messaggi privati ​​o diretti in questa campagna o tramite e-mail saranno prese in considerazione per eventuali modifiche nella produzione.

Il nostro obiettivo finale è quello di far risparmiare i nostri sostenitori! E non mancheremo all'appuntamento.

 

Altri modi in cui puoi supportarci

Nel caso in cui TekiinHome non sia compatibile con le tue esigenze attuali, ma desideri comunque aiutarci a raggiungere gli obiettivi, aiutaci a spargere la voce e invitando i tuoi amici a incontrarci qui o sui nostri social network.

Nel caso in cui TekiinHome non sia compatibile con le tue esigenze attuali, ma desideri comunque aiutarci a raggiungere gli obiettivi, aiutaci a spargere la voce e invitando i tuoi amici a incontrarci qui o sui nostri social network.

story:
Graphene Super-Capacitors

An Effiecent Alternative to Batteries

Smaller Lighter More Storage Flexible

What is this?

- A green alternative to modern day batteries that could potentially be tossed into your compost pile when they become unusable. 

- Technically these devices are super-capacitors. Similar to the function of a battery but all of the energy stored can be replaced and removed very quickly. 

-These super-capacitors are very light weight, have a great power density (meaning they store a lot of energy in a small space) and best of all they are flexible. 

- The main electronic components are made purely of carbon, one of the most abundant elements in the world. 

What is my goal?

- I want to research and develop a range of battery replacements, that when thrown away are of no harm to the environment.  These replacements will have a wide range of uses. A few that come to mind include: Hearing aids, watches, toys, cellphones, RC vehicles, vehicle batteries, electrically powered clothing, wearable electronic devices, ect... 
- Short term: I want to produce a wide range of super-capacitor samples made from a variety of methods to identify the best possible combination of materials that contribute to the best result (In other words, hold the most energy in the smallest package). 
How will this replace batteries?
- Current batteries have to be taken to special recycling plants to dispose of them properly. Most batteries are just thrown into the trash and left to harm the planet while rotting away in landfills. The major components of these batteries can be tossed into a compost heap and would cause no harm to the environment. 
- The fundamental concept of any capacitor is that it can be charged very quickly, this means that a super-capacitor could be charged in a fraction of the current time required by most modern day batteries and achieve the same power output. 
What do I need?
- Your support! If you are reading this please share the news about this great material and the ways I plan to use it. Every little bit helps and people like you who want to make our planet a beter place to live is how technologies like this become a reality. 
- An oscilloscope: Used to test a wide range of electronic devices. For example, this can be used to chart out the actual voltage output over time. Cost for a starter oscilloscope is approximately $1000. 
- 100% pure graphite powder, approximately $20/pound. 
- Kapton tape (used in a wide range of electronic devices due to its durability and because it is nonreactive to thermal changes). 1 mil, 1/2 inch 36 yard roll is approximately $12/roll. 
- A Wide variety of materials needed to print the graphene onto ranges in cost. 
- Miscellaneous containers to hold different solutions and materials.
- Ideally, enough funding to support getting a couple of patents for my developments. 
What do you get?
- A YouTube video series every step of the way! 
- Up to date knowledge in a condensed space at the forefront of technological advancement. 
- Any of the perks that are currently available (if you have a special request just ask)
- The opportunity to invest in a burgeoning field that will result in great strides towards energy efficiency, thus a more eco-friendly world. 

About me:

Hello! 
I am a 24 year old inventor/entrepreneur of all kinds of electronic devices! Thus far it has been a passionate hobby of mine to create devices for my family, friends, and myself. Recently I have discovered some exciting new information regarding the creation of graphene by using graphite powder and a "Lightscribe" cd burner. Graphene is a material that has been theorized to exist for decades. Just recently however, it was discovered that it can quite easily be created with modern means. Please research this amazing new material. 

When speaking of graphene it has been held up to the same level as the creation of bronze and the bronze era that soon followed. Today we are at the forefront of the Graphene era! Recent tests have showed that a battery the size of a credit card (actually a super-capacitor that would replace a battery) can produce 5v and approximately 2.5Milli Amp Hours of power!!! The materials used to create the super-capacitor are all completely eco friendly and biodegradable. Perhaps the most exciting aspect of  super-capacitors is the amount of time it takes to actually charge them. In fact, you can charge a small graphene super-capacitor for about 2 seconds, and it will run a 1.5volt LED for about 5min. Imagine if you scaled that up 100 times! 

Now, what I plan to do is: Use my knowledge of electronic devices/batteries/capacitors/ect... and begin to produce flexible, multi-celled super-capacitors. They will produce a wide range of voltages and Milli Amp Hour ratings(Farads, Wattage, ect...) and have a wide range of applications. First of all, I will be placing a 12v version in my own personal quad copter. It will replace my 5000MAH LiPo battery, that weighs over a kilogram, with a super-capacitor that weighs < 500g. Not only is it an astoundingly light material, the MAH rating will be almost double that of the LiPo! This replacement will charge in less than a 1/4 of the time!! To top it all off graphene is made up of almost purely carbon, which is one of the most abundant and replenish able elements in the WORLD. On a large scale the abundance of carbon will make these products extremely cheap for the consumer. 

Later, I would like to create a small stitchable/flexible super-capacitor for use in luminescent clothing. Perhaps an excellent application would be a jacket that begins to glow when it's dark. A child could wear this jacket for saftey outside at night. The jacket could also contain graphene solar cells (also stitchable) and recharge the super-capacitor during daily use. This application could be applied to any article of clothing. 

Right now I have most of the equipment needed to get started. I have 2 "Lightscribe" burners on their way along with a couple ultrasonic devices needed to create the solution (Aqueous Graphite solution). Please look into this information, even if you have no interest in electronics the applications of Graphene is truly astounding (Ex: Tensile strength of pure graphene thread is 10x that of Kevlar, and can also conduct electricity better than copper) . What I would like to get is an oscilliscope and pure graphene powder. The oscilliscope is crucial for testing purposes. The powder I can supplement for now by crushing, grinding and blending substances that contain graphite. I would love to start producing green and efficient battery replacement kits for anyone who needs them. If there is a specific type/shape/power output/capacity you are looking for just let me know. 

Ideally I would be able to patent some of these devices but the cost is quite substantial so in the meantime I will just focus on experimentation and idividual needs. 

Thank you for reading!

story:
Frequently Asked Questions

How soon will swarm traps ship?

Retail and fully assembled units are NOW shipping!

Are honey bees included?

No, they are not.

That would defeat the purpose of the product, right?  All perks involving the trap will contain what you need to catch local, healthy honey bee swarms, leading to a cheaper alternative to bee packages.

Why is my swarm trap a different color?

As we are continually improving our product, the color and texture of your refuBees Swarm Trap™ may vary slightly from the pictures and videos online.  Think of it as a "2nd gen" purchase.

When is swarm season in my area?

It varies by your location.

We'll give you the answer a college professor gave us as we researched the product early on...

The Ruby-throated Hummingbird

Because this hummingbird has zero body fat, it requires the nectar flow to begin in an area before it can migrate north.  What does this mean in relation to honey bees?  They'll start foraging once sightings of the ruby-throated hummingbirds start regularly in your area.

Swarm season is generally delayed a week or two after this, but keep a close eye on the map, around then it is a good idea to have your trap ready if not hang and bait it.  (Other types of bees, like bumble and mason, will begin to forage before honey bees, another indicator swarm season is approaching.)

(Note: If this particular hummingbird does not migrate to your area, consult with a local beekeeper.  He or she should be able to give you info about swarm season for your region.)

How often should I bait the swarm trap?

Every 7 to 10 days AND right after an extended period of rain.  Not only does the rain wash some of the swarm lure off the trap, after a good rain is also prime time to catch a swarm.

Remember not to overdo it (or you might run out of swarm lure), and use your cotton swab to apply the lure around the entrance and as much inside the trap as possible.

Hooray!  I caught a swarm, now what?

First, make sure it's a swarm and not just scouts.  Easiest way to tell is to check the trap around sundown, because scouting activity will drop off with the decrease in temperature.  If you can see (or hear) the bees inside chances are you've got them.

Second (and because you're sure), congratulations.  It feels good, doesn't it?

(Remember not to lose track of time!  It's easy to get caught up watching the bees come and go from the entrance, or walk your property locating the current hot spot they're foraging.)

Now it's time to reach out to a local beekeeper.  If you don't know any, and turned up zero results via friends and family, a localized search on the internet for "swarm removal" should get you what you need.

Explain you have the honey bees in a swarm trap with medium frames, and make sure to be available to the beekeeper during the early morning or late evening hours.  This ensures most of the bees are inside the trap, and we don't waste good honey bees!

Also please explain you'd like the trap back once the beekeeper has taken the 24 hours or so before transferring the bees into the new hive.

(Transferring the swarm into the hive too early could result in part or all of the colony absconding to the trap's original location.)

How long does swarm season last?

Not long enough!

For Ohio, where we're located, it starts mid to late spring and runs (maybe) until the end of June depending on the weather.

Although it's possible to occasionally catch a "summer swarm" your best bet is in the spring.

Any additional tips to catch a swarm?

Along with the swarm lure, it's a good idea to provide the honeybees with a water source.  Bees require water for everything from nutrition to regulating the temperature in the hive.

A water source can be natural like a nearby stream or pond, or man-made like a shallow birdbath or a simple cup of water refilled regularly.

Another little trick we use is to make a simple sugar solution in a spray bottle.  Before reapplying the swarm lure we'll spray sugar water just inside the entrance to the trap a few times and wait a few minutes before swabbing the entrance with the swarm lure.

By doing this, the bees are attracted to the lure, but grab a quick bite as they drink the simulated nectar.  Bribing the scout bees isn't a crime in this instance.

How many traps should I hang on my property?

It might go against our corporate self interest, but being truthful (and wanting every supporter to be as successful as possible), the fewer options the better.

If you're on an acre or less, one trap (maybe two tops) will work.

The issue is the more traps you hang and bait regularly, the more choices the scouts have.  This may seem like a good idea, but it actually backfires, because an overwhelming majority of scouts is needed to agree on a single location before the swarm will settle for good.

Too many choices will confuse and divide them.

Where should I hang the trap?

Near the edge of your property and approximately 6 feet high.  This isn't so much for the bees as it is for your human friends and family.

Kids especially may be "too interested" in the trap which could lead to a variety of problems.  It's also a good idea to discuss the product with your neighbor so they're aware, and take into account any feedback they may provide, specifically allergies.

CAUTION: Remember honey bees are live creatures and can sting!  It's strongly suggested you observe them from a distance and let an experienced beekeeper remove the swarm once it's settled.

Our journey...

After discussing the plight of pollinators around the world with my sister, and the work she was doing with the staff at the Cincinnati Zoo for her Master's degree, it was my responsibility to help.  Like most of us though, I didn't want to wear the whole suit and wasn't allowed to keep bee hives in my subdivision.

What we needed was a "hang it and forget it" style hive, that was easy for any and all homeowners that wanted to help.

Unfortunately, hives have to be maintained and monitored, so the idea evolved into a swarm trap.

What started as a crude drawing morphed into a 3D model (thanks to a college buddy), then a 3D printed prototype that worked, and finally a plastic injected part.

We did the ground work, now it's your turn to join in.

Funding Needs and Perks

Leveraging our house to purchase a plastic injection tool, we're turning to the Indiegogo community to generate sales of our product in order to pay that back in addition to raising the costs of initial inventory.

When you purchase the $50 retail perk and above, you're purchasing the actual product not a concept.  It's not donating to the idea of helping honey bees in your area, it's a tangible good you'll assemble and hang with your own hands.

For a $50 backing you get the opportunity to observe local swarms scout and then possibly settle on your property, watching as they forage the early spring blossoms.  The sense of accomplishment that comes from catching your first swarm is contagious, and why we went from "We'll never wear a bee suit" to operating several hives on nearby farms.

Once you have a swarm, it's then that you can begin to build a relationship with a local beekeeper, who will be more than willing to come and retrieve the bees from you and talk your ear off over what they do.  Some may be so excited they'll give you honey and/or wax from their apiary as a "thank you."

One thing we pride ourselves on is our parts are manufactured in the USA, and for the most part Ohio MADE, meaning they're produced, sourced, assembled, and packaged in the state of Ohio.

A problem worth solving.

You'll be taking a small step towards improving the environment.  If that doesn't interest you consider that honey bees play a crucial role in the production of the food we eat.

Honeybees, and other pollinators, are essential to agriculture in not just the US, but globally. Unfortunately beekeepers are experiencing increased losses of colonies, particularly after the winter months.

With honeybees dying and/or absconding, beekeepers need to maintain full hives to market and sell their honey, wax, etc. Currently they have three options, buy packages of bees, use current swarm traps on the market, or retrofit old hive boxes and hope they can lure bees into it.

Our refuBees Swarm Trap™ allows you to help beekeepers by providing them local, healthy honey bees in a product that's easy to transfer without losing any of the bees' hard work.

What's the downside?

Unfortunately there's no guarantee you'll catch a swarm.

Like we mention in our video, honey bees are fickle creatures, and it is somewhat of a gamble.

Having said that, please review the tips we include in our FAQ above to tilt the odds in your favor, and remember to have patience.  If you've got scouts checking out the trap you're in good shape, and remember to reapply the swarm lure to the entrance every 7 to 10 days.

CAUTION: Remember honey bees are live creatures and can sting!  It's strongly suggested you observe from a distance and let a local, experienced beekeeper remove the swarm once it's settled.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't currently contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help!

Indiegogo makes it simple to share this campaign with friends and family via the social media icons above.

So don't be afraid to go out there and make some noise for us!

Special Thanks...

Whether the campaign is a success or not, we wanted to individually thank those who have helped us get to this point.

They include (in no particular order):

Tim O. for having the patience and knowledge to turn an idea into a working design that can be prototyped and then manufactured.

Bill and Tammy G. and Brad M. for working out a heck of a deal that allowed us to 3D print prototypes.

Chia L. and Chase B. for providing guidance and hives for the early swarms we caught.

David A. F. and Alex C. for helping us protect the idea.

All the wonderful folks at Custom Molded Products who helped take our swarm trap past the prototype stage.

David and Cathy F., Judy O., Juli and Brandon E., Patrick and Cathy T. for providing space to test the finished product.

Elizabeth S. for composing the video's music.

Marissa B. for assisting with stock photos and video.

And all my family and friends who act as a positive influence not just with business, but in everyday life.

Lastly, I want to thank "The Boss" who not only gave us three beautiful, talented children, but no matter how "hair-brained" the investment sounds, always takes time to listen and provide support.  Sometimes that's the space to flush out and then develop the idea myself, or the "gentle reminders" to focus on something else.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't currently contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help!
Indiegogo makes it simple to share this campaign with friends and family via the social media icons above.
So don't be afraid to go out there and make some noise for us!
Special Thanks...
Whether the campaign is a success or not, we wanted to individually thank those who have helped us get to this point.
They include (in no particular order):
Tim O. for having the patience and knowledge to turn an idea into a working design that can be prototyped and then manufactured.
Bill and Tammy G. and Brad M. for working out a heck of a deal that allowed us to 3D print prototypes.
Chia L. and Chase B. for providing guidance and hives for the early swarms we caught.
David A. F. and Alex C. for helping us protect the idea.
All the wonderful folks at Custom Molded Products who helped take our swarm trap past the prototype stage.
David and Cathy F., Judy O., Juli and Brandon E., Patrick and Cathy T. for providing space to test the finished product.
Elizabeth S. for composing the video's music.
Marissa B. for assisting with stock photos and video.
And all my family and friends who act as a positive influence not just with business, but in everyday life.
Lastly, I want to thank "The Boss" who not only gave us three beautiful, talented children, but no matter how "hair-brained" the investment sounds, always takes time to listen and provide support.  Sometimes that's the space to flush out and then develop the idea myself, or the "gentle reminders" to focus on something else.

story:
Short Summary

Background

After the Hurricane Maria hit in 2017, Puerto Rico was left without power for 8 months! In February 2018, earthquake in Mexico left half a million homes without power. It is not just lights – everything needs energy: businesses cannot function without it, schools cannot operate without computers or equipment, hospitals without hot water and so on. It costs not only money but also human lives. In Florida, people died in a senior housing because air-conditioning didn’t work. These events are becoming more frequent and more severe. Hundreds of millions of people live in a permanent state of disaster such as refugee camps, war zones, epidemics and other humanitarian crises. For them access to energy and clean water (which also requires energy) is a matter of life or death.

 

Summary

Today, when energy is needed on demand, practically the only solution is diesel generators, which require constant supply of fuel. There are several problems with this solution: 1) cost of fuel delivery can be high and it accumulates with the time; 2) burning fossil fuels creates emissions harmful for environment; but perhaps the most important, 3) a disruption of fuel supply, which is very likely in places where it is needed the most, will leave vulnerable people without source of energy and, in many cases, jeopardize lives.     

Unfortunately, renewable energy technologies are still expensive, intermittent in energy generation and can hardly be portable.

 

What Is New and Why We Need Your Help

Drawing on our experience in space applications, we have designed an Autonomous Mobile Energy System (AMES). It combines advantages of vacuum solar tubes and several other technologies in the way nobody has done before. It is designed as a self-contained module which can be delivered to any geographical location in the world, get rapidly deployed and serve as an uninterrupted source of clean energy on demand. The *brain* of the system is an advanced control software, which uses real-time environment data and machine learning algorithm for optimal decision making, which improve efficiency of the system three-folds. This is what makes our technology different!

We are currently testing our technology at the research facility in the University of British Columbia in Vancouver. We received support from the Government of Canada which helped to develop technology. Now we need help to build a full-scale prototype and demonstrate it in the real environment!

 

The Impact You Can Make

Over the last decade the US alone spent $350 billion on disaster relief efforts. Many problems are related to the need to respond to sudden “unexpected” events. Being prepared would save a lot of money and many lives. A fleet of AMES units ready to be dispatched to wherever and whenever is needed could be a big part of the solution for this growing problem. An organization working on restoration of Puerto Rico housing and infrastructure indicated they would need 10,000 mobile energy modules.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

According to the UN High Commissioner there are 22.5 million refugees in the world. They all need not only food and shelter but also energy and hot water for everyday living. Arrays of AMES units installed in the camps would provide these critical necessities and contribute into the solution for this problem helping millions of people.

                                                        

 

 

 

 

 

 

Accessing reasonably priced energy also remains a challenge for over 200,000 people living in Canada’s nearly 300 remote communities. For their energy needs they must stock diesel fuel to last for half a year. AMES units could relieve those communities from the constant risk of being left without heat, while avoiding greenhouse gas and other emissions.

Finally, there is a huge need for energy in developing countries, many regions of which have no access to the centralized grid. Building additional capacity is expensive and extending the transmission lines is wasteful due to unavoidable transmission losses. In most of the world power is still generated primarily by burning fossil fuels, which is responsible for a majority of greenhouse gas emissions and other damaging impact on environment.

One AMES module can provide an uninterrupted source of clean energy without need for fuel supply for 8-12 households in Senegal, Ivory Coast or Cameroon. An array of 10 AMES module can serve an entire village in Nigeria, Kenya or India.

Deploying AMES modules instead of bringing diesel generators or extending grids and pipelines would save more than five million ton of CO2 equivalent GHG emissions annually. This equates to more than a million passenger vehicles taken of the road! We can hardly estimate the number of animals saved and trees preserved!.

 

The Challenge

People, justifiably, only believe in something new when they actually see it working. This is why we need to build a full-scale prototype, test in the field and demonstrate its efficiency. We have all ingredients for success: a great concept, space-inspired technology and a highly skilled and passionate team. We just need your help to push it through.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, but share our vision:

  • Get the word out and let others know about Ascent Systems Technologies and AMES.
  • Share our web site url: ascentsystems.ca, like us on Facebook, follow on LinkedIn, tag #AMES on Twitter, use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
A unique experience

Our company DIRISOLAR SAS wants to offer an other way to fly, a unique experience that allows to discover or rediscover the most beautiful places in the world. The innovations patented in the US and Europe grant an availability of the airship like never before at an affordable price around € 70 or $ 80 per person for a thirty minutes flight.

 

The Dirisolar flying over Bryce Canyon

 

Our company designs since 2013 the Dirisolar, a new generation airship for four passengers and one pilot that solves technological, ecological and economical challenges bounded to airships. The Dirisolar is designed to ensure the safety of the passengers and to fulfill the eco-tourism expectations. The whole airship is powered up by solar panels offering carbon free flights. The electric motors propel the airship in silence with only 47 db (equivalent to a quiet office) which allows an experience in harmony with nature. Moreover in this perspective 90% of the airship's components are recyclable and the means of production will be controlled to limit the carbon footprint. 

 

The Dirisolar flying over a rice field in Vietnam

 

The Dirisolar experience is a flight in all freedom, in safety, in silence and carbon free.

 

The Dirisolar over the Norwegian sea near Tromsø

 

61% of people already questioned are willing to experience it, are you ?

 

Why fund us ?

Nowadays, climate change and the energy transition has become a global social issue. More and more people are protesting and asking their government, around the world, to act on it.

Dirisolar has the ambition to develop a safe and environmentally friendly aerial mobility device. We invite you to join our adventure by helping us go from virtual prototyping to reality by building our first full scale demonstrator.

The company was founded 10 years ago by Philippe Tixier, an aeronautic engineer from Sup Aéro with a great industrial experience in major french companies. Dirisolar's research and development department is located in Boulogne-Billancourt, France. This department is run by five engineers and supported by experts and special advisors.

Dirisolar, on its own funds with € 1.2 million from twenty-eight individual shareholders, invested € 2.5 million in feasibility study, design, simulations, virtual prototyping, test bench, flying model and specialists' advice.

The next step is the construction of a full scale demonstrator to validate all of our innovations.  EASA certification for a commercial use will come in a second time. The first experimental flight will occur in eighteen months and requires an amount of € 5.25 million.

The first commercial flight will occur in three years and requires an additional amount of € 4.7 million which will cover all the tests to obtain the said certification, the means to launch the production of the serial model and to put the Dirisolar in service. 

 

Your contribution up to the € 1 million flexible goal will allow us to build the hangar for the airship's assembly and to realize structural and electrical tests which are significant steps for the project. The additional funds needed to fulfill the project will be shared between crowdfunding, new shareholders, industrial groups and public funding. We are at the present time in close negotiation with a public administration.

 

 

The short term goal is the construction of the demonstrator in France near the headquarters that will validate all the innovations and performances of the Dirisolar.

The long term goal for Dirisolar is to be an airship designer and builder with a few operating sites while renting and selling the Dirisolar to local operators in order to offer the Dirisolar flight experience to the whole world.

 

The Dirisolar flying over Istanbul

 

Support the project and Perks

You have multiple ways to support our project.

First you can donate the amount you want using the back it button. The second way is to choose a perk. Every perk includes items tied with the project however according to Indiegogo community guidelines we cannot issue tickets for a flight in the Dirisolar. Finally, you can support the project by sharing our campaign and following us on our social media.

 

Acknowledgment

Every contribution is important, this perk is a way to support the project! As an acknowledgment of our gratitude your name will be displayed on our website Dirisolar.com.

 

The story of the design

As well as your name our website and our gratitude you will receive a PDF on the evolution of the design of the Dirisolar. The PDF includes photo rendering of the different design of the Dirisolar from the beginning to the actual design with explications on the development.

 

Your name on the envelope

Your name will be display on the envelope of the first demonstrator of the Dirisolar. After its life the envelope will be kept in our research department as a reminder of all the person that help us succeed. All the perks above are also included.

 

First flight live streaming

In addition to the perks above, you will be able to witness the opening ceremony and the historic moment of the inaugural flight of the Dirisolar through live streaming. Those events will be broadcast live for everyone who chose this perk.

In the meantime, you will receive a conference narrated by Philippe Tixier on the history of airships specially made for the backers.

 

Invitation to the first flight

You are officially invited to the opening ceremony and to attend the inaugural flight of the Dirisolar. This historic moment will be an occasion to meet our team and to see the Dirisolar flying with your own eye. It will be the occasion to find your name on its envelope! All the perks above are also included.

 

Name the production center

If you ever wanted your name on a building, you are in the right place. This exclusive perk allows you give your name to the demonstrator's hangar. You will be able to visit the hangar during the inaugural event. All perks above are included.

 

Name the first Dirisolar

If you want to give your name to the first Dirisolar ever built you have this opportunity by  choosing this unique perk. Your name will hence be the official appellation of the first Dirisolar.

 

The lighter the better

 

Airships are part of the lighter-than-air (LTA) family in the aircraft taxonomy. Unlike heavier-than-air (HTA), LTA does not require energy to stay in the air. The lift is generated by a lifting gas according to Archimedes' principle.

                           

 

The Dirisolar will use helium which is a stable and flame-proof gas that can lift approximately one kilogram per cubic meter.

 

But why have airships disappeared from our sky?

Airships have had a golden age in the early 1900s. At first airships were mostly use for military purposes then they were introduce to civil applications such as the first transatlantic commercial flights. However, airships remained difficult to maneuver due to their sensibility to the wind and meteorological conditions inducing a important flight cancellation rate.

Ground crew having difficulties to get the Clement-Bayard 2 out of its hangar in 1910

The Hindenburg fire in 1937 and the fast progression of aviation ended the civil use of airships and later on their military missions as well.

 

Why are they coming back?

In 2001, the German firm Zeppelin NT put a new airship into service. This improved performance airship launched the renewal of airships, dozens of innovative projects are emerging around the world.

NASA published in 2016 a file on the situation of airship projects mentioning Dirisolar (page 12). However, so far no projects reached the handiness expected by the market and the operators. The competition between innovative projects is still on, Dirisolar expects to improve the handiness and to greatly reduce the flight cancellation rate.

Today, the societal awareness has shifted for the energy transition. 20% of today’s pollution comes from transports and the aeronautic industry produces 2% of the CO2. The world needs less polluting aerial solutions. New technologies, like digital engineering and very light materials, are now available for the come back of airships.

Thanks to their low need in energy airships are the perfect candidate for solar energy. Moreover an airship possesses a large surface allowing it to achieve self-sufficiency in energy thanks to sunlight. It is the choice made by Dirisolar.

 

Structural Innovation

The Dirisolar is a rigid airship, that means its shape is given by its structure and not by internal pressure as blimps do. The Dirisolar's structure is mainly made of aluminium tube,  stretchers and a woven envelope. Each of those components are chosen for their light weight and high strength.

The rigidity of the Dirisolar offers major advantages :

Thanks to the structure the helium tanks are not in contact with the envelope offering a protection against hazard from the exterior. In addition helium will be stored in separated tanks which grants a natural stability and safety in case of leak of one tank.

The structure allowed us to design a tail that stabilize the Dirisolar offering a comfortable flight to the passengers.

It also allows the cockpit to be at the front of the airship giving a stunning view at 180°.

The Dirisolar flying next to chalk cliffs in Étretat

 

Last but not least, the structure gives its flat bottom to the Dirisolar. It is a major innovation that is patented in the US and Europe by Dirisolar. The flat bottom has already revolutionized automobile races, applied to airships it makes the landing easier and without the help of a ground crew.

Pressure around a formula 1 car

Pressure around the Dirisolar landed

Indeed, a depression occurs under the Dirisolar which attracts it to the ground and allows it to land easily.

 

This physical phenomenon has been validated by numerous computational fluid dynamics simulations and a proof of concept called the DS06.

 

Virtual prototyping

The virtual prototyping has been realized thanks to our partner ESI-group which helped us to make all the aerodynamics studies and mechanical simulations. 

The computational fluid dynamics simulations have optimized the shape of the Dirisolar and its flat bottom.

 

                          

Flow around the Dirisolar landed

 

It also was a powerful tool to design the tail granting the stability in flight of the Dirisolar.

 

                           

Flow around the Dirisolar in flight

 

The virtual prototyping helped us design the structure of the Dirisolar to ensure the safety of the passenger and the airship's performances. The mechanical studies cases include test from the smallest component to the whole airship.

 

                             

Putting in place a rivet between a tube and a connector

 

                           

Tanks filling up with Helium

 

                            

Stress on the Dirisolar in flight at 50 km/h

 

We already have made some test bench of structural sub-assembly to correlate results from virtual prototyping with the reel stress in the structure.

Sub-assembly of the upper part of the structure

 

   

Structural sub-assembly of the flat bottom

 

We were able to validate the flat bottom structure of our design and to optimize the connectors as long as to calibrate our virtual prototyping parameters.

 

Thanks to our researches and the experimental flights we will define the flight envelope of the Dirisolar to ensure touristic use in all safety for the passengers.

At the present date, the process of construction of the demonstrator of the Dirisolar is ready to be launched.

 

The team behind it

 

They talked about us
