story:
The Fishkeeping industry has largely remained unchanged from major breakthroughs to keep up with the times and has failed to address the questions and concerns millions of fishkeepers have wanted to be solved.

Is there a product that removes all the maintenance work?

Is there a better way to keep my freshwater aquarium clean without constant water changes?

Well, at NOMO, we are here to tell you there is, FINALLY!!  

 

What is NOMO?

NOMO is a micro-current technology product that maintains water conditions within safe parameters eliminating water changes for freshwater aquariums for up to two years. This is a first in the Aquarium industry!

NOMO also eliminates the need to cycle a new aquarium and the odor from aquariums that are not maintained on a regular timely schedule (both firsts in the industry).

So, HOW is this accomplished?

NOMO uses a precise micro-current that stimulates bacteria to two different behaviors:

  •      First, Aerobic bacteria consume uneaten food and waste; NOMO speeds up their activity.
  •       Second, anaerobic bacteria leave behind uneaten food and waste which is what spoils the environment. NOMO slows down their activity.

The combination of the two yields the results that allow NOMO to be the answer to millions of fishkeepers who have asked…There has to be a better way to have fish and enjoy them too!

With NOMO, your freshwater aquarium water will stay clear, chemical levels will stay within a safe perimeter and your fish won't stress and die because you’re not disrupting their environment on a regular basis by creating stress with regular water changes and gravel vacuuming. There are no replacement filters to worry about and one of the best parts is your aquarium won't smell because the uneaten food and waste are inert, while providing nutrients for plants by creating long, strong roots. Everyone benefits from the healthy environment NOMO provides, especially you!

Enjoy having the aquatic results of a professional maintenance company without all the cost or labor.

55-gallon freshwater aquarium. Fish and plants are healthy. No water changes for two years. Set up May 2014.

 

Questions to consider?

1. What is the value of your time per hour, per day, week or month?

2. What would a maintenance company charge to maintain your aquarium?

3. How much time do you spend maintaining your aquarium(s)?

4. How much money do you spend on aquarium products?

5. Does your aquarium reflect the value of your time, money and efforts with the successful results you get?

The vast majority of aquatic products available for fish keepers are nothing more than a Band-Aid approach, only masking the real issue by requiring you to buy another chemical or product to counter an unwanted effect from the previous one purchased while never correcting the root problem. No wonder so many people get fed up and sell their aquarium!

 

NOMO was developed to be the SOLUTION by addressing and resolving long-standing issues aquarists have complained and lamented over for decades such as aquariums being high maintenance, labor-intensive, time-consuming and expensive.

Buckets are great to use when washing your car, not sloshing smelly, poopy fish water all over the living room every week or two.

These external, “hang on the back” filtration devices are high maintenance, noisy, smelly, unsightly, inefficient, and unfriendly in achieving bacteria balance. This system needs to have the filter media cleaned or replaced regularly.

This picture shows a dirty filter that needs to be replaced as it is full of fish poop and smells terrible. Beneficial bacteria reside in this external filter and are removed when the filter is disposed of creating an imbalance in the ecosystem. What a dilemma!

 

NOMO is a onetime, very reasonable, upfront cost.  

NOMO will pay for itself in a very short time with no added costs due to the high maintenance, current replacement filters, canister filters or added chemicals needed each month to maintain a healthy aquarium. The cost of filter media is very expensive and more so with larger aquariums. NOMO eliminates all that extra expense. Enjoy the savings and the additional free time from maintenance chores!

We are so confident you will love NOMO and that it will be all you hope to find in a fishkeeping product that we are offing a Full One Year money back guarantee.

NOMO’s proven technology is taking aquariums to a new level of enjoyment never before experienced in the fish keeping industry. It is clear enjoyment for you, your family and your freshwater fish! With NOMO aquarium maintenance is minimal and easy, making your aquarium MORE enjoyable than ever before.

*No More water changes for up to two years

*No More water cycling needed

*No More smelly odor

 

The NOMO Advantage

      

              365+                                         30+

     Days without a water change                       Days without a water change

 

 

Product Features

 

Main Control Module

The control module contains a printed circuit board with state of the art electronic components, a Lithium Phosphate (LiFePO4) rechargeable battery and a red LED indicator light letting you know NOMO is working. Ports or connection points for the leads (wires) go to the solar panel and to the gravel, work continuously day and night to keep your aquarium clean and clear. NOMO provides the healthiest environment possible for your fish and plant life.

 

 

Solar Panel and Casing

NOMO’s solar panel provides energy to the rechargeable battery in the control module, operating off the aquarium light making it globally friendly and sustainable Green Technology. When the aquarium light is turned off at night NOMO is still working via its rechargeable battery and the energy received during the day when the light was on.  The solar panel is a thin design so as to fit between the aquarium glass top and the light in your aquarium.

No More bulky plugs and extension cords since NOMO is solar powered.

 

 

 

Image of a UGF (under gravel filtration system)

Why does NOMO use an Under Gravel Filter (UGF)?

Aren’t UGF’s obsolete and antiquated?

All aquariums need a filtration system. The achievements of NOMO are enhanced using a UGF for several reasons.

1. One of NOMO'S achieved goals is to CREATE "BALANCE" IN AN AQUARIUM. In nature, you will find bacteria residing in the substrate or the mud at the bottom of the lake or river and not on a disposable filter pad.  A  UGF allows for the bacteria to be contained within the tank where NOMO can stimulate the bacteria into activity or behavior that creates the results NOMO claims. With the bacteria left undisturbed and in the care of NOMO, balance is achieved. Other filters use media to filter the water, usually outside of the aquarium. Each time a filter is replaced or washed, beneficial bacteria is being tossed out with the particles that have been filtered. This only creates an imbalance in the ecosystem, much like when starting up an aquarium that has no bacteria colonies yet established to consume the newly introduced food and waste the fish are now creating. This is what causes toxins to increase resulting in poor water quality and the need to "cycle" a newly set up aquarium.  With NOMO, there is NO NEED TO CYCLE... WOW, this is another FIRST in the Industry! 

2.  UGF'S are INEXPENSIVE and do not require the additional cost of replacement pads or filter media; the gravel or substrate IS the filter media. This means you don't have to spend additional monies on an ongoing basis resulting in MORE MAINTENANCE and COST for you. This is NOT something product manufacturers like. They want you spending more money to create a constant stream of income for them.  And because UGF's are inexpensive, (providing a tiny profit margin), it’s better for THEM to make a more expensive filtration products that are STILL only a "Band-Aid" requiring more money for maintenance as well as your time to perform maintenance. So, of course, retailers will tell you "UGF's are antiquated”. The most expensive filtration systems are incapable of doing what NOMO does using a UGF! This is backed by the results NOMO provides. We use a UGF because it is the best type of filtration to create sustainability and balance in an aquarium, the least expensive and the most maintenance free. All benefits enjoyed and appreciated by your fish, your plants and you, the end user!  If you do not currently have a UGF, we have contracted with a UGF manufacturer to offer only PREMIUM GRADE UGFS. These are stronger, thicker gauge filter plates that will not break like the thin economy type.

3.   Another achieved goal of NOMO is to create an aquarium experience for the end user that is as close to maintenance free as possible while minimizing operating costs thus freeing up your time and money to do other things while at the same time elevating your aquarium experience to the highest level of enjoyment anyone has yet to experience. NOMO does this with ease.

 

NOMO is a Sustainable, Water Conserving and Energy Efficient, product. How?

For example: If you do a 25% water change on a 55 gallon freshwater aquarium every three weeks, that equals to 17 water changes a year and 13.75 gallons of water per water change. That is 233.75 gallons of water a year or 467.5 gallons over two years used for one 55 gallon aquarium. That is a lot of water.

Compare that to a 55 gallon freshwater NOMO aquarium. Do a 75 percent water change every two years. That equals to 41.25 gallons of water every two years. Big difference!

To look at it a different way

You will need to have 34 fifty-five gallon NOMO aquariums to equal the maintenance for two years of one fifty-five gallon non-NOMO aquarium. Mind boggling!

By maintaining and extending the quality of water in your aquarium, NOMO has the potential to save millions of gallons of water each year.

 

How to do a NOMO water change in two years

We recommend doing a 75% water change and deep gravel vacuuming about every two years.  If you feel you need to do a small water change and gravel vacuuming the first year do it, after all, it will take time to break habits of the “old way” of keeping fish. You may wish to wipe the interior glass once every two months for light algae using a magnetic glass cleaner made for aquariums. (Note: heavy algae can be a sign of feeding too much or lights being too strong or left on too long). Add water to top off the aquarium due to evaporation and that’s it. Spend the rest of your time enjoying your NOMO aquarium or on an outing with the family.

The NOMO Journey 2011-Today

We’ve made many prototypes of NOMO, starting out by using a plastic fishing lure box as its housing back in 2011 that we bought at Walmart. We produced some 15 at this time (anyone need a lure?) The solar panel was contained inside the lure box, but that shape presented potential problems, we needed to make NOMO fit different aquarium configurations. NOMO then evolved into two separate components, the control module and a separate solar panel. By creating two components of NOMO, we created more room to enhance NOMO’s capabilities within the control module by allowing for a larger PCB and additional electronics creating the capabilities NOMO offers today. This redesign solved the additional problem of NOMO sitting on top of the aquarium where it could potentially fall into the aquarium by a curious cat or other. Now it is attached to the upper, rear portion of the left side of the tank glass.

The design evolution of NOMO; from 2011…

To now. NOMO has a sleek and appealing design as well as a more appealing logo as seen above.

 

These are the very first NOMO test aquariums set up fall of 2011. The two in the background behind David and to his right were 55 gallon Oscar aquariums. They were already dirty. We put NOMO in one of them and within two weeks the water cleared up and was crystal clear. The other non-NOMO aquarium was struggling and the Oscar was gilling heavily; we needed to change the water immediately. In this picture, David is cleaning the non-NOMO 55 gallon Oscar aquarium.

These are two of our A/B 20 gallon test aquariums 2016. The left one used an external filtration with replacement filters smells as evidenced by David’s reaction. The one on the right is a NOMO aquarium. As you can see, the non-NOMO aquarium needed to have the water changed.  No water changes for the NOMO aquarium during testing.

Our many beta testers have been amazed at the results. Never before has a fish keeping product been able to resolve the negative aspects of aquarium maintenance until NOMO. This first NOMO is for freshwater aquariums. The technology for saltwater aquariums is different but is another product we want to offer in the near future. (See Our Stretch Goal below)

 

David setting up a freshwater NOMO aquarium in the lobby at UVU/BRC March 2015.

 

UVU/BRC lobby. No water changes for two years. First water change was April 2017. Aquarium looks great and no smelly fish water. Fish and plant life is flourishing.

 

Frank’s freshwater aquarium set up May 2014 in his shop lobby. He wanted an aquarium in the lobby of his business but didn’t want to have the high maintenance associated with fish keeping.

 

 

This three-year-old loves her 10 gallon NOMO aquarium. Each morning she and her mom turn on the aquarium lights and feed the fish. They take a few moments to enjoy looking at the fish and counting each one. This starts their day off together. Her mom says she wanted to get her daughter a fish tank but, she doesn’t have time to take care of one. She has way too many things to do during her day to worry about taking care of a fish tank. Since she got a NOMO aquarium for her 3-year-old, they can enjoy having one and mom doesn’t have to worry about a smelly dirty fish tank she has to clean every couple weeks. (This aquarium was set up September 2016 and has not had a water change, yet)

 

       

NOMO aquarium set up January 1, 2016

The top of the tank is closed, the aquarium is protected from kitties, floating airborne dust and other foreign matter.

 

                                    Be the one of the first 250 to get your NOMO shirt

                                 

                                    The first 250 contributors will get a free NOMO t-shirt.

                                               We will contact you for your shirt size.

 

The NOMO Team

Founders: David and Georganne Simeoli- our vision, hard work and determination to create such an amazing fish keeping product in the pet industry couldn’t have happened without our amazing NOMO team. Couldn't have done it without you!

Angel Viveros: Chief Marketing Officer

Brittany Foulger: Digital Marketing Strategist (SEM & Email)

Shane York: Design Engineer (creator of NOMO device)

 

Robert Kirschbaum: Science behind NOMO. Animal Science degree from CSU and more than 30 years’ experience in the fish industry.

Jonathan Viveros: Creative Consultant and Designer (Brand Strategy & Video Animation)

 

Daniel Webster: Videographer (photography and videography vision) Daniel is a Columbia College Chicago graduate with a bachelor in Film and Video.

 

Sione Tafangatoto: Web Development 

 

David and Georganne Simeoli

We love pet fish aquariums! Having owned our share (fresh and salt) we are also individuals who can’t stand (yes, even HATE) the smell and CHORE of regular water changes and gravel cleaning.

So... we got to work to find a solution, and... WE DID IT! Now, NOMO offers you all the advantages of aquarium ownership making it 100% enjoyable, without the typical pain and hassle.

With NOMO, a child can successfully keep fish without parents needing to take over the job, while aquarium enthusiasts alike will have a new found love and appreciation for the hobby. NOMO is turning old aquariums into “paintings in motion” as NOMO means no dirty, cloudy water and... No More Water Changes!

 

 

FAQ

Q #1. How do the fish and aquatic life react to NOMO?

Answer: We have seen (and others have commented) that NOMO fish swim with more vigor and vitality as all stress is removed from NOMO aquariums by virtue of the environment is not disrupted on a regular basis.

 

Q #2. If I don’t change the water in my fish tank, won’t the water start to smell?

Answer: No. This is one of the revolutionary achievements of NOMO. By balancing the bacteria activity, NOMO creates a more uniform balance in your aquarium which prevents the odor that comes from undigested food and waste.

 

Q #3. Is it safe to have my fish in the same water for two years?

 Answer: Yes. We have had aquariums equipped with NOMO running for over 5 years. Fish are consistently breeding, they are living longer and getting bigger because of their long lifespan.

 

Q #4.  How long do I go without a water change?

Answer: Up to now, the normal method recommended by standard fish keeping is to do a water change every week to three weeks. With NOMO, we recommend changing your water about every two years. This changes the standard fish keeping practices known at this time. We have made it simple.

 

Q #5: Do the wires in the gravel harm the fish or live plants?

Answer: NO. The wires in the gravel emit a very small micro-current that does not affect the fish, inverts or live plants. They don’t even notice it.

 

Q #6. Why does NOMO use Gravel as its filter media?

Answer:   The use of Gravel (not sand or dirt) allows for the free flow of food, waste and oxygen borne water to flow through and past the gravel where food and waste can collect, below the surface of the gravel. It is here, where the bacteria colonies will establish themselves, within in the nook and crannies of the gravel and where they will work to maintain a clean aquarium with the help of NOMO’S revolutionary technology. Sand or dirt will not allow for the flow of oxygen (needed by bacteria) or for the collection of uneaten food and waste below the media’s surface as these materials are more fine and compacted.

 

Q #7. How do live plants do with NOMO?

Answer:   Plants are stimulated by the micro-current technology.  Live plants should always be used as they help a great deal to create balance in any ecosystem and “balance” is what we want and what NOMO strives to maintain.

 

Q#8. Why does NOMO use a solar panel?

Answer:  We use a solar panel for several reasons.                                                       

1. Saves Energy

2. Create additional sustainability

3. Free up an electrical outlet that hobbyists find are in short supply and the unsightly addition of another electrical wire where there is already too many.                                    

4.  To allow NOMO to be used internationally where voltages are different.

 

Q #9. Why is there uplift tubes?

Answer:  The uplift tubes are components of the Under Gravel Filter and serve to move water and oxygen thru the aquarium and gravel where the bacteria resides. This helps to create healthy bacteria colonies in partnership with NOMO’s stimulation via a micro-current through wire leads. Uplift tubes are not part of NOMO but are part of the under gravel filtration.

 

Q #10. How much and how often do I feed my fish?

Answer: Following is the new standard for feeding with NOMO. When you set up your NOMO aquarium, you must feed your fish lightly for the first few weeks. If your tank becomes a little cloudy while bacteria is being established, you’re feeding too much. Cut back, the cloudiness will go away.

After that, you can start to feed a little bit more. They only need to be fed once a day (at most) and if you miss a couple days during a week, it’s okay too. Like people, fish also get accustomed to eating a lot or not. Your fish won’t be stressed so they don’t need to be fed so often. If you’re gone for 3-5 days, they can handle this without any ill effects. By noting the physical hardiness of your fish, you will know if you’re feeding too little. A fish should never look skinny or emaciated. If so, increase a little. If you have fry (baby fish), feed them twice a day for the first couple weeks.  Bottom line here is, DO NOT OVERFEED!

 

Q #11.  How many fish do I place in my tank?

Answer: Taking into account for a fish’s future full size, we recommend doing 1” of fish per gallon. If you have Goldfish, Oscars or Discus fish (these are considered “dirty” fish). We suggest 2 or 3 gallons of water per inch of fish. If fish are bigger, increase the gallons per inch of fish.  This is the fish keeping industry standard and we agree. 

 

Q #12.  Do I need to Cycle my aquarium using “sacrificial fish?

Answer: No. There is no need to send some poor innocent fishes to a known death sentence. This is a controversial issue in the fish keeping industry. All you need to do now is to install NOMO per directions, add gravel, decor, live plants, water and fish. Be sure you have your air pumps or powerheads, lighting and chlorine remover. Then add fish. That’s it.

 

Q #13.  What Maintenance will be required with NOMO?

Answer:  Since NOMO uses a UGF (Under Gravel Filter) there are no replacement filters to change. We recommend you top off the water level to replace evaporated water.  Additionally, you may wish to purchase magnets used to remove any potential algae growth from the glass that is unwanted.  Do a vacuum and water change after one or two years (depends if you have had difficulty in adjusting to the new fish keeping standards) and be sure to remove any algae and mineral buildup on the bottom of the glass lid to ensure your plants and fish continue to get the lighting they need.  As the aquarium owner, ultimately, the responsibility is YOURS to maintain a “balanced” aquarium. However, at NOMO, we just made that a whole lot easier for you. So, take more time now to enjoy your fish, and perhaps some other things you’ve always wanted to do.

 

Q #14. Do I need to use an external filter or any other type of canister filters with NOMO?

Answer: NO. There is no need to use any external filter, hang on the back of the aquarium filters, canister filters or any of the other external filtration systems with NOMO.

 

Q #15. What causes stress on fish in aquariums?

Answer:  Poor water quality due to toxins released by the fish, regular water changes and human intervention such disruption of décor and nets to catch fish. Also, if you don’t have the right fish together, such as aggressive fish with more docile fish. These conditions will cause stress that can lead to death.

 

Q #16. Does the Micro-current hurt the fish or plants?

Answer:  Not at all. This speaks to the success of what NOMO does. The micro-current is so small, the fish don’t even notice it. The plants are stimulated by the current as they take root in the gravel and because the plants are not uprooted each month their roots are usually quite long. Snails and other aquatic life are not affected by the micro-current either.

 

Q #17. How much gravel do I place on the UGF?

Answer:  Aquariums that are 40 gallons or less we suggest 2.5 inches. Larger aquariums that can handle larger fish (which produce more waste) we suggest 3-4“ or more depending on aquarium size and fish size. As more waste is generated, more gravel is required to both allow room for bacteria colonies and to conceal fish waste below the gravel surface.

 

Q #18. Do I need to add any chemicals to the water?

Answer:  The only chemical needed is the dechlorinating product to remove chlorine from the tap water when setting up NOMO or when water evaporates and water is added to replace the evaporation. If you desire to use a liquid plant fertilizer, use as directed; this will be ok.

 

Q #19.  Will Ammonia, Nitrites and Nitrates build and kill my fish if I do not change the water?

Answer: If these toxic chemicals are building up, your tank is not balanced properly. This may be due to several factors created by you.

1.    Too many fish for the size of your aquarium.

2.    Remember the rule of 1” of fish per gallon of water. 2”-3” for dirty fish such as Oscar, Discus and goldfish. Increase these numbers for larger bodied fish.

3.    Feeding too much or too frequently.

With an emphasis on “creating balance” and newly formed habits, your aquarium will be a stress-free, low toxic, and have a clear water environment that in all our test tanks, has been able to go up to two years without a water change.

 

Q #20. What about a lack of minerals? Won’t the fish be mineral depleted because the water is not being changed?

Answer: While fish do get some minerals from water, realize that not all water is the same. In some areas, the water is much less mineralized than others.  Fish get the minerals they need from the other aquatic life and the food they eat.

 

 

How Will We Use the Funds From Your Contribution on Indiegogo? We will use the funds from this campaign to pay for tooling of molds and supplies to begin mass production of NOMO to the fish keeping industry. With your contribution, you will get the first NOMO's made and help us launch into the fish keeping market with a disruptive product with the potential to change fish keeping standards forever and take it to a whole new level of enjoyment.

Our Stretch Goal: By exceeding our Indiegogo goal of contributions, we will be able to begin testing our Salt Water technology. The salt water technology is different from the freshwater technology.  So, if you are a saltwater fish tank enthusiast, please make your contribution towards this campaign so we can reach our stretch goal and begin that testing of the salt water technology. If you know someone who has a saltwater aquarium or who wants a saltwater aquarium, please pass this information on to them. They will be happy you did!

The potential for NOMO’s technology to be used in other areas is great and far-reaching. These areas include aquaponics and septic systems outside of saltwater aquariums and outdoor ponds. 

Warranty: NOMO comes with a one year money back guarantee. 

Possible Risks & Challenges: We have worked several years developing and perfecting this version of NOMO for freshwater fish tanks. However, because of your feedback, there will always be improvements and innovations to be made, after all, we will be listening to you and your suggestions to continue to deliver the best innovative products available in the NOMO line of products both now, and yet to come. By pledging to support NOMO, you are doing so with the understanding that this is a new product with disruptive technology that will radically change the way fish tanks are maintained and which we are striving to make available to you and the fish keeping industry at large. We do not take your support lightly and thank you for your support both now and in the future for allowing NOMO to change an industry that has long been stagnant.

 

Product Adjustments: To provide the best product possible, extensive design, redesign and testing have taken place over the past 6 years. NOMO is now ready to go to market. However, minor adjustments may be needed in the manufacturing as every step we take is a process of learning. Our goal is to get NOMO to you inside of 6 months from the close of funding. We certainly will keep all customers informed on a regular basis of our progress throughout manufacturing and fulfillment of your order. However, in the end, your patience will be appreciated as “life has a way of happening after you make plans”. Either way, we are committed to you, your satisfaction and the “pure enjoyment” of your aquarium as never before experienced with NOMO’S Micro-Current Technology.

Manufacturing: We have set up manufacturing at a local US based manufacturing facility in Utah. That way we can oversee NOMO's production and quality.

Fulfillment: Despite the best planning, there may be factors that we cannot control such as equipment malfunction, transport or delay in supplies. We will strive to produce the product quickly and make sure that the early perks and Indiegogo supporters are given priority. After all, it is you, our customer that we will always strive to please and take care of.

Future Products: by reaching our Indiegogo stretch goal, the NOMO team will begin testing the salt water technology. Once that is completed, we will introduce it through an Indiegogo campaign. We will keep you updated and in the know during this time. You can also watch our progress on our website at getnomo.com. After the saltwater NOMO is completed, we will work on other areas of product development to improve the fishkeeping experience globally.

 

Disclaimer: Delivery of perks and rewards are subject to best efforts and not guaranteed. 

We are confident we will deliver to all contributors. We will keep each of you updated through email on the progress of production and goals met.

Additional Disclaimer: NOMO does not and will not claim to cure any fish or fish tank related diseases or other problems that may occur by having a fish. Proper feeding and minor tank maintenance is still required to maintain a healthy fish tank.

 

To all those who supported NOMO on Indiegogo: We have been able to make this dream a reality because of you.

Thanks so much for all your support and contributions!

Please let us know how you heard about NOMO. This will help us reach those who can benefit from having a NOMO for their freshwater aquarium too.

We would love to hear about your experience with NOMO. Please feel free to send pictures and stories about your NOMO experience. Visit: getnomo.com

 

 

 

​

This system needs to have the filter media cleaned or replaced regularly.This picture shows a dirty filter that needs to be replaced as it is full of fish poop and smells terrible. Beneficial bacteria reside in this external filter and are removed when the filter is disposed of creating an imbalance in the ecosystem. What a dilemma! NOMO is a onetime, very reasonable, upfront cost.  NOMO will pay for itself in a very short time with no added costs due to the high maintenance, current replacement filters, canister filters or added chemicals needed each month to maintain a healthy aquarium. The cost of filter media is very expensive and more so with larger aquariums. NOMO eliminates all that extra expense. Enjoy the savings and the additional free time from maintenance chores!We are so confident you will love NOMO and that it will be all you hope to find in a fishkeeping product that we are offing a Full One Year money back guarantee.NOMO’s proven technology is taking aquariums to a new level of enjoyment never before experienced in the fish keeping industry. It is clear enjoyment for you, your family and your freshwater fish! With NOMO aquarium maintenance is minimal and easy, making your aquarium MORE enjoyable than ever before.*No More water changes for up to two years*No More water cycling needed*No More smelly odor The NOMO Advantage                    365+                                         30+
     Days without a water change                       Days without a water change  Product Features Main Control ModuleThe control module contains a printed circuit board with state of the art electronic components, a Lithium Phosphate (LiFePO4) rechargeable battery and a red LED indicator light letting you know NOMO is working. Ports or connection points for the leads (wires) go to the solar panel and to the gravel, work continuously day and night to keep your aquarium clean and clear. NOMO provides the healthiest environment possible for your fish and plant life.  Solar Panel and CasingNOMO’s solar panel provides energy to the rechargeable battery in the control module, operating off the aquarium light making it globally friendly and sustainable Green Technology. When the aquarium light is turned off at night NOMO is still working via its rechargeable battery and the energy received during the day when the light was on.  The solar panel is a thin design so as to fit between the aquarium glass top and the light in your aquarium.No More bulky plugs and extension cords since NOMO is solar powered.   Image of a UGF (under gravel filtration system)Why does NOMO use an Under Gravel Filter (UGF)?Aren’t UGF’s obsolete and antiquated?All aquariums need a filtration system. The achievements of NOMO are enhanced using a UGF for several reasons.1. One of NOMO'S achieved goals is to CREATE "BALANCE" IN AN AQUARIUM. In nature, you will find bacteria residing in the substrate or the mud at the bottom of the lake or river and not on a disposable filter pad.  A  UGF allows for the bacteria to be contained within the tank where NOMO can stimulate the bacteria into activity or behavior that creates the results NOMO claims. With the bacteria left undisturbed and in the care of NOMO, balance is achieved. Other filters use media to filter the water, usually outside of the aquarium. Each time a filter is replaced or washed, beneficial bacteria is being tossed out with the particles that have been filtered. This only creates an imbalance in the ecosystem, much like when starting up an aquarium that has no bacteria colonies yet established to consume the newly introduced food and waste the fish are now creating. This is what causes toxins to increase resulting in poor water quality and the need to "cycle" a newly set up aquarium.  With NOMO, there is NO NEED TO CYCLE... WOW, this is another FIRST in the Industry! 2.  UGF'S are INEXPENSIVE and do not require the additional cost of replacement pads or filter media; the gravel or substrate IS the filter media. This means you don't have to spend additional monies on an ongoing basis resulting in MORE MAINTENANCE and COST for you. This is NOT something product manufacturers like. They want you spending more money to create a constant stream of income for them.  And because UGF's are inexpensive, (providing a tiny profit margin), it’s better for THEM to make a more expensive filtration products that are STILL only a "Band-Aid" requiring more money for maintenance as well as your time to perform maintenance. So, of course, retailers will tell you "UGF's are antiquated”. The most expensive filtration systems are incapable of doing what NOMO does using a UGF! This is backed by the results NOMO provides. We use a UGF because it is the best type of filtration to create sustainability and balance in an aquarium, the least expensive and the most maintenance free. All benefits enjoyed and appreciated by your fish, your plants and you, the end user!  If you do not currently have a UGF, we have contracted with a UGF manufacturer to offer only PREMIUM GRADE UGFS. These are stronger, thicker gauge filter plates that will not break like the thin economy type.3.   Another achieved goal of NOMO is to create an aquarium experience for the end user that is as close to maintenance free as possible while minimizing operating costs thus freeing up your time and money to do other things while at the same time elevating your aquarium experience to the highest level of enjoyment anyone has yet to experience. NOMO does this with ease. NOMO is a Sustainable, Water Conserving and Energy Efficient, product.  How?
For example: If you do a 25% water change on a 55 gallon freshwater aquarium every three weeks, that equals to 17 water changes a year and 13.75 gallons of water per water change. That is 233.75 gallons of water a year or 467.5 gallons over two years used for one 55 gallon aquarium. That is a lot of water.Compare that to a 55 gallon freshwater NOMO aquarium. Do a 75 percent water change every two years. That equals to 41.25 gallons of water every two years. Big difference!To look at it a different wayYou will need to have 34 fifty-five gallon NOMO aquariums to equal the maintenance for two years of one fifty-five gallon non-NOMO aquarium. Mind boggling!By maintaining and extending the quality of water in your aquarium, NOMO has the potential to save millions of gallons of water each year. How to do a NOMO water change in two yearsWe recommend doing a 75% water change and deep gravel vacuuming about every two years.  If you feel you need to do a small water change and gravel vacuuming the first year do it, after all, it will take time to break habits of the “old way” of keeping fish. You may wish to wipe the interior glass once every two months for light algae using a magnetic glass cleaner made for aquariums. (Note: heavy algae can be a sign of feeding too much or lights being too strong or left on too long). Add water to top off the aquarium due to evaporation and that’s it. Spend the rest of your time enjoying your NOMO aquarium or on an outing with the family.The NOMO Journey 2011-TodayWe’ve made many prototypes of NOMO, starting out by using a plastic fishing lure box as its housing back in 2011 that we bought at Walmart. We produced some 15 at this time (anyone need a lure?) The solar panel was contained inside the lure box, but that shape presented potential problems, we needed to make NOMO fit different aquarium configurations. NOMO then evolved into two separate components, the control module and a separate solar panel. By creating two components of NOMO, we created more room to enhance NOMO’s capabilities within the control module by allowing for a larger PCB and additional electronics creating the capabilities NOMO offers today. This redesign solved the additional problem of NOMO sitting on top of the aquarium where it could potentially fall into the aquarium by a curious cat or other. Now it is attached to the upper, rear portion of the left side of the tank glass.The design evolution of NOMO; from 2011…To now. NOMO has a sleek and appealing design as well as a more appealing logo as seen above. These are the very first NOMO test aquariums set up fall of 2011. The two in the background behind David and to his right were 55 gallon Oscar aquariums. They were already dirty. We put NOMO in one of them and within two weeks the water cleared up and was crystal clear. The other non-NOMO aquarium was struggling and the Oscar was gilling heavily; we needed to change the water immediately. In this picture, David is cleaning the non-NOMO 55 gallon Oscar aquarium.These are two of our A/B 20 gallon test aquariums 2016. The left one used an external filtration with replacement filters smells as evidenced by David’s reaction. The one on the right is a NOMO aquarium. As you can see, the non-NOMO aquarium needed to have the water changed.  No water changes for the NOMO aquarium during testing.Our many beta testers have been amazed at the results. Never before has a fish keeping product been able to resolve the negative aspects of aquarium maintenance until NOMO. This first NOMO is for freshwater aquariums. The technology for saltwater aquariums is different but is another product we want to offer in the near future. (See Our Stretch Goal below) David setting up a freshwater NOMO aquarium in the lobby at UVU/BRC March 2015. UVU/BRC lobby. No water changes for two years. First water change was April 2017. Aquarium looks great and no smelly fish water. Fish and plant life is flourishing. Frank’s freshwater aquarium set up May 2014 in his shop lobby. He wanted an aquarium in the lobby of his business but didn’t want to have the high maintenance associated with fish keeping.  This three-year-old loves her 10 gallon NOMO aquarium. Each morning she and her mom turn on the aquarium lights and feed the fish. They take a few moments to enjoy looking at the fish and counting each one. This starts their day off together. Her mom says she wanted to get her daughter a fish tank but, she doesn’t have time to take care of one. She has way too many things to do during her day to worry about taking care of a fish tank. Since she got a NOMO aquarium for her 3-year-old, they can enjoy having one and mom doesn’t have to worry about a smelly dirty fish tank she has to clean every couple weeks. (This aquarium was set up September 2016 and has not had a water change, yet)        NOMO aquarium set up January 1, 2016The top of the tank is closed, the aquarium is protected from kitties, floating airborne dust and other foreign matter.                                     Be the one of the first 250 to get your NOMO shirt                                                                     The first 250 contributors will get a free NOMO t-shirt.                                               We will contact you for your shirt size. The NOMO TeamFounders: David and Georganne Simeoli- our vision, hard work and determination to create such an amazing fish keeping product in the pet industry couldn’t have happened without our amazing NOMO team. Couldn't have done it without you!Angel Viveros: Chief Marketing OfficerBrittany Foulger: Digital Marketing Strategist (SEM & Email)Shane York: Design Engineer (creator of NOMO device) Robert Kirschbaum: Science behind NOMO. Animal Science degree from CSU and more than 30 years’ experience in the fish industry.Jonathan Viveros: Creative Consultant and Designer (Brand Strategy & Video Animation) Daniel Webster: Videographer (photography and videography vision) Daniel is a Columbia College Chicago graduate with a bachelor in Film and Video. Sione Tafangatoto: Web Development  David and Georganne SimeoliWe love pet fish aquariums! Having owned our share (fresh and salt) we are also individuals who can’t stand (yes, even HATE) the smell and CHORE of regular water changes and gravel cleaning.So... we got to work to find a solution, and... WE DID IT! Now, NOMO offers you all the advantages of aquarium ownership making it 100% enjoyable, without the typical pain and hassle.With NOMO, a child can successfully keep fish without parents needing to take over the job, while aquarium enthusiasts alike will have a new found love and appreciation for the hobby. NOMO is turning old aquariums into “paintings in motion” as NOMO means no dirty, cloudy water and... No More Water Changes!  FAQQ #1. How do the fish and aquatic life react to NOMO?Answer: We have seen (and others have commented) that NOMO fish swim with more vigor and vitality as all stress is removed from NOMO aquariums by virtue of the environment is not disrupted on a regular basis. Q #2. If I don’t change the water in my fish tank, won’t the water start to smell?Answer: No. This is one of the revolutionary achievements of NOMO. By balancing the bacteria activity, NOMO creates a more uniform balance in your aquarium which prevents the odor that comes from undigested food and waste. Q #3. Is it safe to have my fish in the same water for two years? Answer: Yes. We have had aquariums equipped with NOMO running for over 5 years. Fish are consistently breeding, they are living longer and getting bigger because of their long lifespan. Q #4.  How long do I go without a water change?Answer: Up to now, the normal method recommended by standard fish keeping is to do a water change every week to three weeks. With NOMO, we recommend changing your water about every two years. This changes the standard fish keeping practices known at this time. We have made it simple. Q #5: Do the wires in the gravel harm the fish or live plants?Answer: NO. The wires in the gravel emit a very small micro-current that does not affect the fish, inverts or live plants. They don’t even notice it. Q #6. Why does NOMO use Gravel as its filter media?Answer:   The use of Gravel (not sand or dirt) allows for the free flow of food, waste and oxygen borne water to flow through and past the gravel where food and waste can collect, below the surface of the gravel. It is here, where the bacteria colonies will establish themselves, within in the nook and crannies of the gravel and where they will work to maintain a clean aquarium with the help of NOMO’S revolutionary technology. Sand or dirt will not allow for the flow of oxygen (needed by bacteria) or for the collection of uneaten food and waste below the media’s surface as these materials are more fine and compacted. Q #7. How do live plants do with NOMO?Answer:   Plants are stimulated by the micro-current technology.  Live plants should always be used as they help a great deal to create balance in any ecosystem and “balance” is what we want and what NOMO strives to maintain. Q#8. Why does NOMO use a solar panel?Answer:  We use a solar panel for several reasons.                                                       1. Saves Energy2. Create additional sustainability3. Free up an electrical outlet that hobbyists find are in short supply and the unsightly addition of another electrical wire where there is already too many.                                    4.  To allow NOMO to be used internationally where voltages are different. Q #9. Why is there uplift tubes?Answer:  The uplift tubes are components of the Under Gravel Filter and serve to move water and oxygen thru the aquarium and gravel where the bacteria resides. This helps to create healthy bacteria colonies in partnership with NOMO’s stimulation via a micro-current through wire leads. Uplift tubes are not part of NOMO but are part of the under gravel filtration. Q #10. How much and how often do I feed my fish?Answer: Following is the new standard for feeding with NOMO. When you set up your NOMO aquarium, you must feed your fish lightly for the first few weeks. If your tank becomes a little cloudy while bacteria is being established, you’re feeding too much. Cut back, the cloudiness will go away.After that, you can start to feed a little bit more. They only need to be fed once a day (at most) and if you miss a couple days during a week, it’s okay too. Like people, fish also get accustomed to eating a lot or not. Your fish won’t be stressed so they don’t need to be fed so often. If you’re gone for 3-5 days, they can handle this without any ill effects. By noting the physical hardiness of your fish, you will know if you’re feeding too little. A fish should never look skinny or emaciated. If so, increase a little. If you have fry (baby fish), feed them twice a day for the first couple weeks.  Bottom line here is, DO NOT OVERFEED! Q #11.  How many fish do I place in my tank?Answer: Taking into account for a fish’s future full size, we recommend doing 1” of fish per gallon. If you have Goldfish, Oscars or Discus fish (these are considered “dirty” fish). We suggest 2 or 3 gallons of water per inch of fish. If fish are bigger, increase the gallons per inch of fish.  This is the fish keeping industry standard and we agree.  Q #12.  Do I need to Cycle my aquarium using “sacrificial fish?Answer: No. There is no need to send some poor innocent fishes to a known death sentence. This is a controversial issue in the fish keeping industry. All you need to do now is to install NOMO per directions, add gravel, decor, live plants, water and fish. Be sure you have your air pumps or powerheads, lighting and chlorine remover. Then add fish. That’s it. Q #13.  What Maintenance will be required with NOMO?Answer:  Since NOMO uses a UGF (Under Gravel Filter) there are no replacement filters to change. We recommend you top off the water level to replace evaporated water.  Additionally, you may wish to purchase magnets used to remove any potential algae growth from the glass that is unwanted.  Do a vacuum and water change after one or two years (depends if you have had difficulty in adjusting to the new fish keeping standards) and be sure to remove any algae and mineral buildup on the bottom of the glass lid to ensure your plants and fish continue to get the lighting they need.  As the aquarium owner, ultimately, the responsibility is YOURS to maintain a “balanced” aquarium. However, at NOMO, we just made that a whole lot easier for you. So, take more time now to enjoy your fish, and perhaps some other things you’ve always wanted to do. Q #14. Do I need to use an external filter or any other type of canister filters with NOMO?Answer: NO. There is no need to use any external filter, hang on the back of the aquarium filters, canister filters or any of the other external filtration systems with NOMO. Q #15. What causes stress on fish in aquariums?Answer:  Poor water quality due to toxins released by the fish, regular water changes and human intervention such disruption of décor and nets to catch fish. Also, if you don’t have the right fish together, such as aggressive fish with more docile fish. These conditions will cause stress that can lead to death. Q #16. Does the Micro-current hurt the fish or plants?Answer:  Not at all. This speaks to the success of what NOMO does. The micro-current is so small, the fish don’t even notice it. The plants are stimulated by the current as they take root in the gravel and because the plants are not uprooted each month their roots are usually quite long. Snails and other aquatic life are not affected by the micro-current either. Q #17. How much gravel do I place on the UGF?Answer:  Aquariums that are 40 gallons or less we suggest 2.5 inches. Larger aquariums that can handle larger fish (which produce more waste) we suggest 3-4“ or more depending on aquarium size and fish size. As more waste is generated, more gravel is required to both allow room for bacteria colonies and to conceal fish waste below the gravel surface. Q #18. Do I need to add any chemicals to the water?Answer:  The only chemical needed is the dechlorinating product to remove chlorine from the tap water when setting up NOMO or when water evaporates and water is added to replace the evaporation. If you desire to use a liquid plant fertilizer, use as directed; this will be ok. Q #19.  Will Ammonia, Nitrites and Nitrates build and kill my fish if I do not change the water?Answer: If these toxic chemicals are building up, your tank is not balanced properly. This may be due to several factors created by you.1.    Too many fish for the size of your aquarium.2.    Remember the rule of 1” of fish per gallon of water. 2”-3” for dirty fish such as Oscar, Discus and goldfish. Increase these numbers for larger bodied fish.3.    Feeding too much or too frequently.With an emphasis on “creating balance” and newly formed habits, your aquarium will be a stress-free, low toxic, and have a clear water environment that in all our test tanks, has been able to go up to two years without a water change. Q #20. What about a lack of minerals? Won’t the fish be mineral depleted because the water is not being changed?Answer: While fish do get some minerals from water, realize that not all water is the same. In some areas, the water is much less mineralized than others.  Fish get the minerals they need from the other aquatic life and the food they eat.  How Will We Use the Funds From Your Contribution on Indiegogo? We will use the funds from this campaign to pay for tooling of molds and supplies to begin mass production of NOMO to the fish keeping industry. With your contribution, you will get the first NOMO's made and help us launch into the fish keeping market with a disruptive product with the potential to change fish keeping standards forever and take it to a whole new level of enjoyment.Our Stretch Goal: By exceeding our Indiegogo goal of contributions, we will be able to begin testing our Salt Water technology. The salt water technology is different from the freshwater technology.  So, if you are a saltwater fish tank enthusiast, please make your contribution towards this campaign so we can reach our stretch goal and begin that testing of the salt water technology. If you know someone who has a saltwater aquarium or who wants a saltwater aquarium, please pass this information on to them. They will be happy you did!The potential for NOMO’s technology to be used in other areas is great and far-reaching. These areas include aquaponics and septic systems outside of saltwater aquariums and outdoor ponds. Warranty: NOMO comes with a one year money back guarantee. Possible Risks & Challenges: We have worked several years developing and perfecting this version of NOMO for freshwater fish tanks. However, because of your feedback, there will always be improvements and innovations to be made, after all, we will be listening to you and your suggestions to continue to deliver the best innovative products available in the NOMO line of products both now, and yet to come. By pledging to support NOMO, you are doing so with the understanding that this is a new product with disruptive technology that will radically change the way fish tanks are maintained and which we are striving to make available to you and the fish keeping industry at large. We do not take your support lightly and thank you for your support both now and in the future for allowing NOMO to change an industry that has long been stagnant. Product Adjustments: To provide the best product possible, extensive design, redesign and testing have taken place over the past 6 years. NOMO is now ready to go to market. However, minor adjustments may be needed in the manufacturing as every step we take is a process of learning. Our goal is to get NOMO to you inside of 6 months from the close of funding. We certainly will keep all customers informed on a regular basis of our progress throughout manufacturing and fulfillment of your order. However, in the end, your patience will be appreciated as “life has a way of happening after you make plans”. Either way, we are committed to you, your satisfaction and the “pure enjoyment” of your aquarium as never before experienced with NOMO’S Micro-Current Technology.Manufacturing: We have set up manufacturing at a local US based manufacturing facility in Utah. That way we can oversee NOMO's production and quality.Fulfillment: Despite the best planning, there may be factors that we cannot control such as equipment malfunction, transport or delay in supplies. We will strive to produce the product quickly and make sure that the early perks and Indiegogo supporters are given priority. After all, it is you, our customer that we will always strive to please and take care of.Future Products: by reaching our Indiegogo stretch goal, the NOMO team will begin testing the salt water technology. Once that is completed, we will introduce it through an Indiegogo campaign. We will keep you updated and in the know during this time. You can also watch our progress on our website at getnomo.com. After the saltwater NOMO is completed, we will work on other areas of product development to improve the fishkeeping experience globally. Disclaimer: Delivery of perks and rewards are subject to best efforts and not guaranteed. We are confident we will deliver to all contributors. We will keep each of you updated through email on the progress of production and goals met.Additional Disclaimer: NOMO does not and will not claim to cure any fish or fish tank related diseases or other problems that may occur by having a fish. Proper feeding and minor tank maintenance is still required to maintain a healthy fish tank. To all those who supported NOMO on Indiegogo: We have been able to make this dream a reality because of you.Thanks so much for all your support and contributions!Please let us know how you heard about NOMO. This will help us reach those who can benefit from having a NOMO for their freshwater aquarium too.We would love to hear about your experience with NOMO. Please feel free to send pictures and stories about your NOMO experience. Visit: getnomo.com   ​

story:
Support team Solévolt tackle poverty and climate change

  • Buy a Solévolt system for yourself and reduce your CO2 footprint by over half every year. Our systems are great for household use, camping, RVs, and as a backup power source. Also, a portion of every sale will go towards providing energy to schools, clinics and homes in need - OR -
  • Off-set your carbon footprint and lift a community out of poverty by buying some hours of Solévolt power for some of the 1.2 billion people in the world currently without access to electricity

Help us achieve our goals by buying a system for your own use...

Our flagship product, Enterprise, is a portable, easy-to-use, plug-and-play, modular solar generation and storage system. Enterprise is great for off-grid tiny homes, camping, RVs and backup power. Thanks to its lithium-ion battery, it’s powerful enough to recharge phones, tablets, laptops, and household appliances like refrigerators and TVs.

The core of the system is the 'powerbox' which includes:

  • 1.2 kWh lithium-ion battery (expandable to 2.4 kWh) – high quality, safe, UL-listed
  • 1000W inverter
  • High quality MPPT charge controller
  • Plugs and sockets: charge all of your devices with USB, AC, DC and car cigarette lighter sockets. Charge the battery from the AC adapter or solar panels (integrated MC4 sockets)
  • Weighs 20kg (44 lbs)

* - 110V available for US & Canada

The system comes with four LED lights. Solar panels are sold separately, and the system can take up to 1000W in parallel.

(Photo: Solévolt- Enterprise system seen here in Guinea is capable of charging a number of devices and small appliances and can travel wherever you need them). 

A portion of every Solévolt system sold will help us provide solar energy to schools and clinics in parts of Guinea and the Philippines which would otherwise lack electricity. For every 50 units sold, we'll donate and install a complete 1kW, 2.4kWh system, and update you periodically through videos and social media.

 

...Or help us by helping pick-up the electricity bill for a family, business, school and clinic in need

(Photo: Community organizers power the community radio and neighbourhood devices in Cité Soleil, Haiti)

  • Solévolt Teams are located on the ground in Guinea and the Philippines with over a dozen of our systems already in operation. Based on your donations, our teams will either use our existing systems OR manufacturer more with your donations to make them available to communities in need. Our teams will identify end-users and conduct the necessary installation and follow-up.

  • Empower a single mother to set-up a small business and afford school fees  

  • Support a rural clinic with energy to refrigerate vaccines, keep patient records, and light medical procedures

  • Invest  in an overcrowded school to provide night shifts and evening lights for students

  • In addition to the perks, we will provide all contributors with regular updates of how and to whom their funds are being channeled. 

Goal: $60,000

If we reach our goal of $60,000, we will be able to:

  • Donate and install 15 Solévolt-Enterprise systems in clinics and schools in Guinea and the Philippines
  • Provide 2,120 days (nearly six years) of power to clinics, schools and homes in the same areas

Who we are and what we want to do

(Photo: Solévolt- Enterprise systems fresh off the production line at our factory in Shenzhen)

Solévolt is an off-grid solar energy company founded and staffed by former United Nations relief workers. We design and produce high-quality solar generation and storage systems that are portable, plug-and-play, and high-powered for home and business use. Our products  are currently operating in Guinea (West Africa) and the Philippines  (Southeast Asia), targeting those with no or little access to electricity; we also cater to the eco-lodge, tiny home, RV, camper and recreational markets in the US, Canada, and Australia. We're a for-profit company with potential for high social and environmental returns. Help us bring our vision to scale, and light up the world!

Impact

  • Reduce carbon emissions by over 30 tons per year by purchasing one Solévolt-Enterprise system 

  • Reach over 3,000 people in Guinea and the Philippines with life-changing access to electricity by donating Hours of Power. These communities will have a reliable and transformative source of energy for the first time which they can use for home, business or public services

Other Ways You Can Help: Easy as 1-2-3

  1. Connect: our network has been our net worth and we would be grateful if you could put us in touch with people you think would be interested in our product. E-mail us at info@solevolt.com
  2. Market: word of mouth is the most effective sales strategy we have. Please spread Solévolt far and wide! If you happen to be in Guinea, Haiti, and the Philippines and want to try a Solévolt product, our teams there can help
  3. Build Community: follow-us on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube for updates from the field, to engage in fiery debates on renewables and climate change, and to receive our life hacks on reducing your carbon footprint everyday 

Your feedback is always welcome at info@solevolt.com

...Or help us by helping pick-up the electricity bill for a family, business, school and clinic in need

(Photo: Community organizers power the community radio and neighbourhood devices in Cité Soleil, Haiti)

Solévolt Teams are located on the ground in Guinea and the Philippines with over a dozen of our systems already in operation. Based on your donations, our teams will either use our existing systems OR manufacturer more with your donations to make them available to communities in need. Our teams will identify end-users and conduct the necessary installation and follow-up.
Empower a single mother to set-up a small business and afford school fees  
Support a rural clinic with energy to refrigerate vaccines, keep patient records, and light medical procedures
Invest  in an overcrowded school to provide night shifts and evening lights for students
In addition to the perks, we will provide all contributors with regular updates of how and to whom their funds are being channeled. 


Goal: $60,000
If we reach our goal of $60,000, we will be able to:

Donate and install 15 Solévolt-Enterprise systems in clinics and schools in Guinea and the Philippines
Provide 2,120 days (nearly six years) of power to clinics, schools and homes in the same areas

Who we are and what we want to do

(Photo: Solévolt- Enterprise systems fresh off the production line at our factory in Shenzhen)
Solévolt is an off-grid solar energy company founded and staffed by former United Nations relief workers. We design and produce high-quality solar generation and storage systems that are portable, plug-and-play, and high-powered for home and business use. Our products  are currently operating in Guinea (West Africa) and the Philippines  (Southeast Asia), targeting those with no or little access to electricity; we also cater to the eco-lodge, tiny home, RV, camper and recreational markets in the US, Canada, and Australia. We're a for-profit company with potential for high social and environmental returns. Help us bring our vision to scale, and light up the world!
Impact


Reduce carbon emissions by over 30 tons per year by purchasing one Solévolt-Enterprise system 
Reach over 3,000 people in Guinea and the Philippines with life-changing access to electricity by donating Hours of Power. These communities will have a reliable and transformative source of energy for the first time which they can use for home, business or public services

Other Ways You Can Help: Easy as 1-2-3

Connect: our network has been our net worth and we would be grateful if you could put us in touch with people you think would be interested in our product. E-mail us at info@solevolt.com


Market: word of mouth is the most effective sales strategy we have. Please spread Solévolt far and wide! If you happen to be in Guinea, Haiti, and the Philippines and want to try a Solévolt product, our teams there can help

Build Community: follow-us on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube for updates from the field, to engage in fiery debates on renewables and climate change, and to receive our life hacks on reducing your carbon footprint everyday 
Your feedback is always welcome at info@solevolt.com

story:
Summary

At PolyGenomX we are a tightly-regulated Australian public company and we've cut entirely new ground in plant biotechnology by applying directed natural stress to embryonic plant material to bring about rapid,  beneficial adaptation at a genomic level, that is stable and heritable.

 

In the simplest terms, we've cracked Nature's code to produce faster-growing, earlier-maturing, higher-yielding, climate-tough plants of any species - and that includes food species.  All without genetic engineering. All natural.

We now want to start producing billions of new, faster growing trees that will not only yield extraordinary results for those growing them, but in the process will absorb more carbon (around 50% more than unadapted varieties), emit more oxygen and more water vapour, and progressively rebalance our environment.

For our Indiegogo campaign, we'd like to give you the opportunity to sponsor one or more - heck, hundreds if you like - of the biggest, fastest-growing trees on the planet.  Those trees will be planted for us as part of a sovereign national reforestation project . . .

. . . and nurtured for 5 years by which time they'll be big enough to look after themselves.  (BTW, this is the same epigenetically adapted tree at 15 weeks of growth - beside it is a standard plant with identical genetics - think Arnold and Danny DeVito in 'Twins' ☺)

 A bonus for us all is that in 4 short years the trees we've developed for this campaign reach the size that their un-evolved cousins would do in 10 years.  

And they suck up 10 years worth of carbon in that 4 years, and they put out 10 years' worth of oxygen and water vapor.  (If you count the rings on the two samples you'll find the same number of rings, but wide in the polygenomic specimen indicating more carbon packed into the wood in the same time frame).   

The Science

 

Our Promise

We keep our promises: We promise you the chance to help us make a difference to our planet, our World, right now. 

 

How It Works

The Faster Forest Program is a way in which YOU can play a part in re-balancing our environment – our planet – by sponsoring (adopting) one of the fastest growing trees on the planet, an extraordinary polygenomic Paulownia, an entirely new - but natural - plant variety.

It’s an extraordinary plant that gives:

  • 30% Faster Growth
  • 50% More Carbon Intake and capture
  • Is 100% Natural
  • Is fertile and will multiply itself many times over 
  • and has been developed to be Climate Tolerant.  They’re tough!

Here our K1 cultivar growing under irrigation in sand, in a trial under semi-desert conditions at Canarvon in the far North of Western Australia, in 2011. 

 

What We Need 

$3 million to move beyond trees and into food species (faster-growing, sweeter and more nutritious tomatoes; salt-tolerant potatoes capable of making damaged land productive, while progressively healing it;  and faster-growing, salt-tolerant rice to feed the world). 

Your contribution will fund our University partners to systematize our adaptive processes so that we can scale up, and to push our capabilities to develop disease resistant plants to end our reliance on chemicals which harm our ecosystem and our environment.  

What You Get

As a sponsor in PolyGenomX’s Faster Forests Program you receive a Certificate of Origin (that’s your plant's genetic passport); you are provided its exact GPS location.

 

 In the near future, you'll get on-line access to satellite imagery that allows you to see your plants - and thousands like them - growing over the years. And they’ll grow fast! 

So, how do YOU play a part in sponsoring a tree that will capture carbon for us all, breathe oxygen for us all, and create clouds and rainfall for us all?  And begin re-balancing our Earth?  For us, for you? 

You sponsor a tree:

  1. For just $17 we will grow, plant and nurture your sponsored trees.
  2. For just $27 we will grow plant and nurture your tree, and assign you another that you can gift as a “Hug” to someone you care for.
  3. For just $57 your family can have us grow, plant and nurture a family of 5 trees, and we’ll give you another 5 for Hug offs. 
  4. And for Companies, Tribes or Groups, for $500 (or more if you wish) we’ll grow, plant and nurture 100 polygenomic carbon-munching trees. Hell, for a little bit more we’ll plant whatever it takes to wipe out your entire carbon footprint if you want, and make you carbon-neutral! 

If you give in the first 48 hours of our campaign, we’ll double your impact:  $17 gets 2 trees; $27 gets 4; and families ($57) gets 10 trees.

Just to be clear:  We fund the first 5 years' nurture – guaranteed.  And after 5 years? Each tree is big enough and tough enough to go on growing, capturing carbon, breathing oxygen, making rain, re-balancing our planet and propagating itself naturally to make more of the world’s fastest growing trees - all on its own. 

Heck, at 5 years, we can even coppice the trees - cut them level with the ground - and use their timber, and in another 4 years they've achieved the same size again.

(The logs in the image above are 2 year-old polygenomic Paulownia awaiting wood quality and timber density testing.) 

And we can repeat that 4-year cycle 6 times!  That's a total of 7 tree-loads (33 years) of carbon captured and put to work as a renewable resource.  

And, being a sponsor doesn’t end at just one forest.  Because you’re now in the family you get advance notice and special rates on the next species we develop, the next project we launch, the next forest we create – or restore. 

It starts with just one plant – but it ends with just one planet. The only one we have.

Please, help us make a difference. 

You Can Contribute Just by Sharing

We know that not everyone can help us in raising funds for this planet-saving endeavor, but there is another way you can help!

With just a few clicks of your mouse, you can help us get the word out about our Faster Forests Program. Share the information about our campaign through social media to your family and friends by using the Indiegogo share tools provided here.

story:
Information

The Pantanal Partnership is a University of Michigan student organization focused on education, healthcare, and sustainable technologies in the Brazilian Pantanal. The Pantanal region of Brazil is one of the world’s largest freshwater wetlands and is protected as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The people of the Pantanal are critical to the environmental conservation of the area, but unfortunately, community members of these often isolated areas move to cities in search of improved education, jobs, and healthcare. One of the goals of the Pantanal Partnership this summer is to ensure these families can continue to live along the river, by offering safe, sustainable lighting to many families along the Cuiaba River, most of whom live without any electricity.

Our club has applied for many grants this year and done a lot of fundraising, but we are still $2000 short of the funds we need to travel this summer to implement our project. We would appreciate any and all donations or you sharing this page to help us out. Thank you and Go Blue!

If you cannot donate...

We will be having a fundraiser at Piada on Wednesday, 4/19 on S. State St! Along with this, on Thursday and Friday (4/20 and 4/21) we will be having a bake sale in Mason Hall in front of the posting wall. If you are unable to help us in any of these ways, please share this post! This project is extremely important in improving the education of students in the Pantanal, and if we do not get funds the trip will be cancelled. Any donation amount is appreciated!

story:
Nguyen Solutions

I’m Justin, founder of Nguyen Solutions. I have been studying Black Soldier Flies (BSF) for 3 years; last year I quit working full time to work out a viable way to commercially produce them. I have made a career out of solving problems. As an education consultant, I am constantly overcoming teaching obstacles for firms, private schools and home schools. Working in hospitality management, there have also been numerous instances that have required crafty conflict resolution. Now I set my sights on the environment.

I am joined by a dilligent, bilingual team, built on this ground breaking idea to spark a revolution in the waste management and animal food industries.

We started Nguyen Solutions as an engine to drive change:

  1. As Christians, we believe it is important to be a good stewards of the earth.
  2. As families, we believe its our responsibility to make a better world for the next generation.
  3. As Libertarians, we believe that social problems like the environment can be solved with market ingenuity.

With the help of our backers, we can put form to the world we envision. By creating new wealth from food waste, Nguyen Solutions is tackling one of the biggest social problems of our time: the environment. With food waste going to landfills at the tune of 1.3 billion tons annually, it is time to make a move. Not to restrict, not to regulate, but to create. Producing animal food via Black Soldier Flies, we will take something unusable and into it breathe new life.

Black Soldier Flies

BSF are INCREDIBLE. A complete realization of BSF potential will radically affect multiple industries: soil enrichment, waste management, livestock feed, petroleum diesel and even skin care. The full benefits are still being discovered.  We are using BSF because they possess specific benefits that we can harness. The number one benefit is that they become a protein rich, low cost animal feed. 

Other benefits: 

  • Non-nuisance, anti-social, sanitary (don't spread disease)
  • Eat food leftovers, up to 10 times their weight a day 
  • High in protein, fat and calcium 
  • self-harvesting
  • Super durable
  • Produce tons of nitrogen rich soil amendment  

Bright future:

  • The fats can be refined into biodiesel 

When the fats are removed, the protein is separated out and can still be used in animal feed! This can solve a major problem in driving down the price for biodiesel, because the byproducts still generate revenue. 

  • Their exoskeleton is high in chitin

Chitin is becoming known as a substance that is very beneficial for skin care. Promising research is currently underway with cosmetic companies collecting chitin from BSF.

The Project: Brass Tacks

Food leftovers from hotels and restaurants will be delivered to our recycling plant for processing. BSF will consume food waste for 14-18 days before self-harvesting. Next, they will be inactivated, sanitized and made into animal feed. This feed will be lab tested for quality and sent to a farm to be tested for efficacy. 

To learn more about BSF, check out the videos above or get the details of our project on our website.

Funding

We need $50,000 to make this a success.

Equipment                    19,400

12 Month Operating Cost            22,500

Quality Tests and Control            2,000

Fees, Media, Perks                    6,100

___________________

50,000

Our plan is to: 

  1. invest in our start-up equipment (warehouse, truck, etc.)
  2. operate for a 12 month period (labor, utilities, fuel, etc.)
  3. lab test our feed's nutrient profile
  4. pay for fees, perks and media

The Impact

The impact of this project is far-reaching. One facility at full capacity can handle over 200 tons of food waste monthly. From there, we multiply. This addresses our first social problem, the environment. But we won't stop there, we also want to advance charity. 

The second social problem that are taking on is charity. Once Nguyen Solutions becomes profitable, we are committing a majority of our profits to community development. We are passionate about using our business as a tool for genuine, organic and voluntary social development-- this takes shape not only for the environment but also with people. These are the ways we commit to philanthropy:

  • Sell soil Amendment at a very low cost to poor farmers with nutrient deficient soil 
  • Establish Bali’s first soup kitchen where anyone can come, eat and hear about Jesus

Long term: 

  • Link the soup kitchen with a small orphanage
  • Build a rigorous academic school for the homeless children of Bali

By supporting our project, you get to be a part of a company that wants to do more than just become profitable. We can solve environmental concerns and use that as a springboard to be unconditionally charitable.

Challenges

The actual process of food waste to animal feed is relatively simple. The three main challenges in BSF production are:

  1. Few animal farms are willing to try a new and untested product.
  2. Strict regulations in western countries impede new protein development.
  3. High investment costs are required to cover land, labor and capital.

We have a clear path to overcome these hurdles.

  1. We have already partnered with farms that are willing to help us develop new feed.
  2. We are industry and self-regulating; our own due diligence requires us to lab test our product and maintain the highest quality. 
  3. The cost of living is extremely low compared to western standards, making all of our start-up costs significantly less than they would be in America. 

We are fully prepared to take on the challenges inherent with a start-up. We have already solved some of the problems facing other BSF start-ups. We have the plan, creativity and work ethic to make this project a raging success.

Promote, promote, promote!

We appreciate all of our backers. If you can’t support us financially, here are some other ways you can back us:

  • Know a blogger or a writer for news media? Put us in contact with them. We want to create an avalanche of attention around this campaign.
  • Get other people to back us!
  • Like and share us across your entire network: 
    • https://www.facebook.com/NguyenSolutions.org
    • https://twitter.com/NguyenSolutions

Remember, if you have any questions, ask them in the comments! Chances are that others wonder the same thing as you- and we are happy to answer!

 

For more information, go to www.nguyensolutions.org

 

Thanks so much guys!
