story:
My Name is Rick-Ernest Bonnier from Mauritius and since June 2016 I have worked at WiseOceans Ltd as a Marine Educator. I am usually based at the Four Seasons Resort Mauritius at Anahita and, for a month, I was also based at Four Seasons Seychelles learning about the Reef Restoration Project. My work is to provide guests information on the marine biodiversity of Mauritius and to discover our beautiful reef through our Reef Discovery Snorkel program. We also have the Marvelous Mangrove Snorkel program where I bring guests to discover the creatures living inside the mangrove. I am passionate about wildlife, oceans, and conservation, and have been since a very young age. I also work with endemic and endangered birds, reptiles, marine mammals, sea turtles, tropical fish, and corals. In 2015, I was awarded a place for participation in the Mandela Washington Fellowship Program where I got the chance to do a course in Leadership at the Goldman Public Policy School at the University of California, Berkeley. After that, I got the chance to participate in a summit with President Obama, which really inspired me. Before going back home, I did a professional development program at the Cape Hatteras National Seashore. I have always been really influenced by old time inventors, fascinated by how they creatively thought and observed things around them, and I always try to think in the same way and try to get new ideas to solve issues. My favorite inventor is Garrett Morgan.  


The ocean is everything to me and I am sick of seeing marine animals dying due to plastic pollution. I want to give the ocean a second chance. International ocean plastic pollution is at an all-time high, and it is devastating habitats, the health of humans and animals, livelihoods, and communities alike. This is a massive global problem and we need to act now. In my spare time I invented a revolutionary machine to collect underwater and ocean surface plastic from the ocean, without hurting marine or aquatic life. Internationally the device will be an enormous help in cleaning the planet and will benefit many countries around the world. This project will create jobs, improve tourism, protect livelihoods, and at the same time clean our beautiful oceans, giving marine life a second chance to live peacefully again. The project will educate governments, organizations and schools about the dangers of plastic pollution, and promote recycling instead of dumping. Everyone loves being in a clean ocean to snorkel, dive, and swim. If we do not protect our oceans from pollution, we will not only lose our tourists, but it will negatively impact all the local communities and livelihoods including locals, skippers, hotel staff, fishermen and future generations around the world.

 

The project is at prototype level, but by reproducing ocean conditions in an aquarium, we can prove that the device works. To date, in a 10 litre tank, with pieces of plastic (2cm squared), the device has taken 100 % of plastic in less than 2 minutes, both on the surface and underwater. The contribution will help us to develop the prototype into an advance device for the first year once we have the required budget. It will make a huge difference into saving the ocean.

Methodology:  
The Ocean Cleaner Device works in two ways: on the surface and under water 
 
On the surface 
The Ocean Cleaner Device uses a source of energy that will be sent through the Plastic Attraction Unit (PAU). The PAU will then attract the plastic floating on the ocean surface. Once 
there is a large amount of plastic concentrated around the PAU, it will be collected by using a pumping system which will direct the plastic to a container.  
 


 
 
Underwater 
The second part of the Ocean Cleaner Device uses another source of energy. The unit which attracts plastic underwater is called the ‘Underwater Plastic Attraction Unit’. Once the plastic has been dragged to the surface, it can be collected with the PAU and sent to the pumping system joined to the plastic collection container.  

 
 
Neither method hurts marine life. 
 
Execution:  
There are two possible executions for this project: moving and stationary. 
 
Moving  
We can use secondary data from studies and reports investigating and identifying marine debris sites -this will tell us which areas are more affected by plastic pollution and we can visit these places for cleaning. A 50ft vessel (min. size) will be needed to store collected plastic. 

Stationary 
We can also leave the device in a specific place where it will continuously collect plastic. This concept is suitable for areas in which water current is strong.  
 

Similar Devices  
Ocean Clean Up 
The Ocean Clean Up is an ambitious invention designed by Boyan Slat, who was just 19 years old when he started the project. He uses a passive system, utilising ocean currents as its driving 
force, to catch and concentrate surface plastic. By suspending a large sea anchor in deep, slow moving water, his team can slow down their 600m floating device enough for the plastic to move faster than the cleanup system. This causes the plastic to accumulate against the plastic collector. Our Ocean Cleaner Device also collects plastic from the surface of the ocean, yet it requires less water surface area to operate, as it is used from a single boat, or stationary platform, to attract plastic. The Ocean Clean Up works only on the ocean surface, whereas the Ocean Cleaner Device will also collect plastic underwater and on the bottom of the seabed. The Ocean Cleaner Device uses not only ocean current, but also boat movement -therefore it is more maneuverable, allowing work on specific sites with greater priorities and greater concentrations of plastic. The project not only cleans the ocean, but also educates the world with our findings, and lets people know what a bad state the ocean is in. 
 
Seabin 
The Seabin is a floating rubbish bin located in the water at marinas, docks, yacht clubs, and commercial ports. The Seabin moves up and down with the range of tide, collecting floating rubbish. Water is sucked in from the surface and passes through a catch bag inside the Seabin. It uses a submersible water pump capable of displacing 25.000 LPH (litres per hour), plugged directly into a 110/22V outlet. The water is then pumped back into the marina, leaving litter and debris trapped in the catch bag to be disposed of properly. The Seabin also has the potential to collect a percentage of oils and pollutants floating on the water surface. It is, however, a fixed device, only able to collect surface rubbish. The Ocean Cleaner Device is movable, collects from the surface and underwater, and it can access places other than ports and docks. 

 

 

Financial proposal for the first year

 

Items

 Pound Sterling 

Salary( Four people working full time on this project, it include one director, one operation manager, one technician and one professional diver) 

30000

Salary for two research assistant

6000

Workshop rental with pool

12000

Vehicle

14400

Fuel

8400

Boat rental

20000

Contracted Graphic designer

1000

Accessories

4600

Normal/Underwater Cameras

4000

Insurance

2000

Government fees

200

Laptops

2500

Diver center operation support

7000

Unforseen situation cost

10000

Constigency cost

10000

 

 

Total

132100

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

We are very excited to provide a contributor certificate for those who contribute to our project.

The ocean covers around 72% of the planet's surface and contains 97% of Earth's water. It has been stated that less than 5% of the world’s oceans have been explored. The total volume of ocean is approximately 1.35 billion cubic kilometers, with an average depth of nearly 3,700 meters. Moreover, the oceans are a significant source of oxygen for our planet and are instrumental in the capture and storage of carbon dioxide. Marine species provide important ecosystem services such as the provision of food, medicines, and livelihoods. They also support tourism and recreational activities around the world. 80% of our land pollution ends up in the ocean and if we don’t do anything, it will lead to scarcity of ocean food, unemployment, and will negatively affect the people’s livelihood. In 1975, the National Academy of Sciences estimated that cargo ships and cruise ships had dumped 14 billion pounds of garbage into the ocean. Over 1 million seabirds and 100,000 sea mammals are killed by pollution every year.  The project is at prototype level, but by reproducing ocean conditions in an aquarium, we can prove that the device works. To date, in a 10 litre tank, with pieces of plastic (2cm squared), the device has taken 100 % of plastic in less than 2 minutes, both on the surface and underwater.

Please don’t hesitate to share this to your friends and family. And don’t hesitate to contact us if you have any questions.
story_txt:
My Name is Rick-Ernest Bonnier from Mauritius and since June 2016 I have worked at WiseOceans Ltd as a Marine Educator. I am usually based at the Four Seasons Resort Mauritius at Anahita and, for a month, I was also based at Four Seasons Seychelles learning about the Reef Restoration Project. My work is to provide guests information on the marine biodiversity of Mauritius and to discover our beautiful reef through our Reef Discovery Snorkel program. We also have the Marvelous Mangrove Snorkel program where I bring guests to discover the creatures living inside the mangrove. I am passionate about wildlife, oceans, and conservation, and have been since a very young age. I also work with endemic and endangered birds, reptiles, marine mammals, sea turtles, tropical fish, and corals. In 2015, I was awarded a place for participation in the Mandela Washington Fellowship Program where I got the chance to do a course in Leadership at the Goldman Public Policy School at the University of California, Berkeley. After that, I got the chance to participate in a summit with President Obama, which really inspired me. Before going back home, I did a professional development program at the Cape Hatteras National Seashore. I have always been really influenced by old time inventors, fascinated by how they creatively thought and observed things around them, and I always try to think in the same way and try to get new ideas to solve issues. My favorite inventor is Garrett Morgan.  The ocean is everything to me and I am sick of seeing marine animals dying due to plastic pollution. I want to give the ocean a second chance. International ocean plastic pollution is at an all-time high, and it is devastating habitats, the health of humans and animals, livelihoods, and communities alike. This is a massive global problem and we need to act now. He uses a passive system, utilising ocean currents as its driving force, to catch and concentrate surface plastic. story:
It's a powerful solar generator & portable power station capable of charging all your electronics when your're on an adventure! Huge capacity battery with a sleek yet rugged exterior and offered at an affordable price.

 

Capacity:595Wh

With 595Wh of power and a large variety of charging ports, Pegasus is the most powerful solar generator & portable power station on the market today!

 

Lightweight: 11.5 lbs

Largest portable battery capacity, a whopping 595 Wh of power, one of the most powerful generators on the market today.

Small enough to carry wherever you go. Going on a road trip or camping with friends? Don’t forget your Pegasus!

 

Recharge in 3 Ways

Pegasus gives you total freedom to charge from an outlet, a car, or with a solar panel.

 

Trustworthy Technology

PEGASUS is equiped with advanced technologies and multiple safety measures to insure you have best user experience. 

 

 

The Perfect Combination of Power, Reliability and Durability

Small enough to carry to the beach and powerful enough to power your entire campsite!

 

 

PEGASUS in the Press

 

 

 

 

 

General

Inputs

Outputs

Internal

 

 

Once the goal is reached, we will go directly into the production phase and fulfill perk orders as soon as we can.

MONEY-BACK GUARANTEE

Your Order will arrive in the month indicated on the perk you claim on Indiegogo or your money back!

 

Power Your Green Life

ACOPower is an established company based in Los Angeles dedicated to providing off-grid and portable power solutions to the market. The team members strive to satisfy the needs of our diverse group of customers ranging from campers, RV or boat owners, survivalists to disaster relief workers. With seven years of experience, we are confident that you will enjoy our new product and we can’t wait to hear what you think!

 

 

  • Where We Ship

We're able to ship worldwide to the United States, Canada, Mexico, European Union, Australia, Japan, South Korea, Singapore, and Hong Kong. VAT and GST is included. If you live outside of the USA, Shipping cost will be applied (free for USA).

  • When We Start Shipping

The first units will leave from factory starting Apr 2018. US & Canada backers can expect to receive your PEGASUS starting in May 2018. Other backers can expect the International version of PEGASUS to arrive starting in June 2018. 

  • Why Pre-Order Now

You'll be providing valuable feedback that will help us improve our products in the future. By pre-ordering today, you're supporting a world less dependent on gas and more on renewable energy.

 

 

General

  • What is PEGASUS?

PEGASUS is a portable power station that can be used as a mobile power source or an emergency power source. It can be used anywhere you go and is rechargeable by soar panels, cars and outlets.

  • Who created it?

The team at ACOPower have been in the solar power business over 12 years. We saw a demand from our customers for portable power stations and PEGASUS is the result.

  • What are the different ports and lights?

Pegasus is equipped with a total of 4×USB ports (1×Quick Charge, 1×Type-C), 2×AC Output, 2×DC 6mm outputs, 1×12V car port, 1×LED light panel, and 1× LED flashlight.

  • What sets Pegasus apart?

The Battery Management System (BMS) inside PEGASUS not only regulates temperature for best performance but it also tracks the power consumption from individual ports which is shown on the LED screen in real-time.

Technical

  • How do I charge my PEGASUS?

PEGASUS has two input ports, one for solar charging and one for wall or car charging. They are located on the left-hand side of the PEGASUS. Solar charging takes 5-8 hours, wall charging takes 9 hours and car charging takes 13 hours.

  • Can I use PEGASUS while it’s charging?

Yes! PEGASUS can output power while being charged.

  • Will my country's power plug be supported?

Yes! We do plan on making units with 220V and 230V outputs with Universal plugs. Depending on the demand, we will release other versions as well. Please contact us if interested!  

  • How do I store PEGASUS?

To prolong battery life, PEGASUS should be fully charged before storing at room temperature away from humidity.

  • How do I use it?

Simply press the On/Off button and wait for the LED screen to respond. Once its turned on, select which ports you will be using and turn their power on individually and start charging!

  • What is the acceptable temperature range?

For optimum performance, Pegasus should be charged from 32 – 113°F (0 – 45°C) and operated from 14 – 140°F (-10 – 60°C).

Shipping

  • When does shipping begin?

Shipping will begin in April 2018. US & Canada  backers should expect their units in starting in May. UK, EU, Australia, Japan, South Korea, Hong Kong, and Singapore will ship by June.

  • Where does it ship to?

We ship to US, Canada, Mexico, UK, EU, Australia, Japan, Singapore, South Korea, and Hong Kong. Shipping is free to the USA.  

Customer Service

  • What is the warranty?

For US purchases, ACOPOWER warrants PEGASUS to be free of manufacturing defects. ACOPOWER will pay for repair or replacement of parts and labor for 18 months from the date you receive PEGASUS. Specific terms are shipped with PEGASUS.

  • What is your pre-order refund policy?

If you change your mind or change addresses, we'll do our best to accommodate. We won't able to refund Indiegogo orders once they've shipped to you.

  • What is your return policy?

Don't return PEGASUS Power Station to the store. You'll be able to contact ACOPOWER directly with any questions or concerns you might have. Specific terms are shipped with PEGASUS.

  • Contact of customer service

Sales Inquires: Sales@ACOPower.com, +1-626-575 7722

Wholesale:  B2B@ACOPower.com, +1-626 575 8822

Technical Support: Support@ACOPower.com

Company Website: www.ACOPower.com

Pegasus Website: www.PegasusGenerator.com

Current technologies of harnessing energy, such as lithium ion batteries, are outdated and have a number of drawbacks including high cost, low storage capacity, slow recharge times, and the risk of combustion. 

We are developing a graphene-based supercapacitor which is a cheaper, cleaner and more attainable solution, with high storage density, yet lightweight, 500% faster charging speed and a longer life span.

The way we can accomplish this is because graphene has significantly greater surface area due to its nano particle size. Thus, it has greater storage capacity. Furthermore, unlike lithium-ion batteries which operate through ion exchange, the graphene-based supercapacitor operates through electron exchange, thus has slower discharge time i.e. it can hold a charge for longer. The electron exchange is also a very safe method and does not run the risk of combustion, as in the case of lithium-ion batteries. Additionally, graphene is very lightweight so the supercapacitors weigh significantly less than other storage devices today.

Confused? No worries, here’s the summary:

In case you are not familiar with Graphene, Graphene is a one-atom thick layer of carbon. This revolutionary material is a million times thinner than paper, flexible, the world’s best known conductor of heat and electricity to date, and 200 times stronger than structural steel.

Through current production methods, Graphene is one of the most expensive materials on Earth. Furthermore, the production processes currently have very low yields of 10-20%.

This is why Graphene product applications are still in R&D, and not yet in the commercial sector.

How did we get here?

At GOLeafe, we have dedicated our lives to researching carbon as a human-friendly alternative to the modern, industrial world. Carbon is all around us, we’re just learning to harness it.. We have developed a method that can produce large amounts of graphene at a low price, overcoming the two major hurdles to bringing Graphene to the commercial sector: price and scalability.
After nearly 4 years of R&D, we have had a major breakthrough. This is a leap towards introducing our latest innovation to the world, and we’d love for you to join the journey as we bring the dream to market.

This clean energy storage solution isn’t just our wish list. We have been able to use Graphene to SUCCESSFULLY store power! 

What you can do:

Join us in the journey to making Graphene-based technologies a reality. Whether you are on the fence about Graphene being all that it is talked up to be in Science  and Technology journals worldwide, but believe clean energy is a cause worth working towards, or if you are one that cannot wait to get your hands on some Graphene, support our campaign and we will keep you posted on all of our happenings! Your contributions to this campaign, beyond the perks you will receive, will go towards developing a refined Graphene supercapacitor prototype to showcase to the world, raise funds to continue our innovations and bring more Graphene-based products to market. We truly appreciate your support and would love for you to share this campaign. Together, we can make this planet cleaner and greener, in a time when it desperately needs us!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Tony; I'm a PhD researcher in electrical and electronic engineering from Ireland. My degree and educational background are also in electrical and electronic engineering. I am working toward sustainable solutions for our energy problems in the face of climate change.

This device, while it won't change the world or reduce climate change in a meaningful way, is a necessary first step toward my development goals. The device aims to provide an alternative to battery-based power packs, moving away from the use of lithium and cobalt often mined from conflict zones.

By supporting this project, I believe that we can make another small step toward a sustainable future by investigating other renewable technologies. This project being a taste of what's to come.

What We Need & What You Get

Funding is required for the following:

  1. Detailed engineering analysis (how can I make it better and better)
  2. Prototype development & evaluation (does it work in practice as it does on paper)
  3. beta testing (ok it works, but how well? what are the main problems?)

If we can’t raise the full amount, no problem... the funds will go toward as many steps from the above list as possible.

The Impact

As a contributor to this project, you will be helping investigate alternatives to the renewable technologies we currently use. We always need more. Our current state of sustainability isn't going to fix itself, nor will solar or wind alone meet our energy demands. This is all big stuff, so let's think smaller for now. This project allows for the full investigation of generating energy using electromagnetism. Larger scale adaptations of this will follow, but first, we need full investigation and testing.

I spent many years developing battery and hybrid battery energy storage technologies, much like the Tesla power wall. Such devices are great, and we need them if we want to use solar and wind to power our homes and businesses, but.... the manufacturing of batteries is harmful, and materials often come from war-torn areas, what if we could try something else? Use fewer and more common materials. Electromagnetism is a widely known phenomena, and many people have claimed to have been able to use magnetism to generate power. I was sceptical, so I did the math, made models investigated as best I can and so far, it seems to work.

But now, we need to take it further. An actual prototype turned product to thoroughly investigate the potential of this technology.

story:
Are you a family of four going car camping and don't want to drag a bulky, multi-kilowatt generator with you just to keep your mobile devices charged?

Experiencing a blackout and want to run some lights and a radio while you wait?

Are you at an outdoor event and want to play some music from your portable speakers, but the batteries just wont last?

Has a natural disaster caused you to leave your home, and you don't have a way to charge and power vital electronic devices?

Well, we can help you with that, and you can take it anywhere!

Our Project

At half the weight of high-capacity lithium-ion batteries, our portable power generator is designed to produce 20 watts for up to 100 hours while weighing less than 10 pounds. This is enough power to charge 2-4 smart devices at a time, and it can produce enough to charge about 50 smart phones in a single day. Using commonly available bottle fuel, this system is inexpensive, accessible, and safe to use. From military, to emergency services, to private use, this device can keep your small devices charged in any situation.

Target Performance

  • 4 kg (8.8 lbs) final gross weight
  • 20 W continuous operation for 100 hours (2,000 W-hr equivalent)
  • Emergency 20 W output for up to 15 min in extreme environments
  • Emergency 200 W output for 5 min burst
  • Switchable 5 / 12 Volt DC output, with a variety of receptacles
  • Operable while stationary or carried in all weather conditions

The Advantage

There is virtually no limit to the number of small devices that are available. The issue is that these devices need to be kept charged. Currently, the best way to do this away from a power outlet is either with a traditional gas generator, devices like solar chargers, or simply more batteries. There are other devices on the market which have a similar operating principle as this device, though these products still have shortcomings.

The issue with other devices is that they are heavy, cumbersome to use, may not work while on the move, and (in the case of things like solar chargers) simply do not work in all situations.

Our portable power generator is designed to work on the move. For equal performance, it is lighter than any of these other commonly available power solutions. It is small, compact, and safe to use. The generator uses commonly available bottle fuels, such as those used in small camping stoves, making it accessible and affordable.

This portable power generator can be used by the military to charge radios, GPS units, laptops, or any other small electronic device in the field. Emergency services and disaster relief can benefit from this device as grid power is typically unavailable and mobility is key. This generator can even be used in the home or for recreational applications. Keeping phones charged in power outages or during vacations or camping trips, this device is discrete when you don't need it but always ready whenever you do.

Our Goal

We are aiming to raise $20,000. These funds will be used in the following ways:

  • $7,500 to manufacture the five full-scale, full-function prototypes with some budgeted for replacement parts if needed
  • $5,000 for professional electronics and circuit consultation, testing, and manufacturing
  • $2,500 for required equipment - tools, sensors, data loggers
  • $2,500 for PR and hands-on testing with real users
  • $2,500 to fulfill campaign perks and for unforeseen misc. expenses

Development Schedule

Our current timeline looks like this:

  • June 22: Indiegogo campaign begins
  • August 1: Indiegogo campaign has ended, short wait for funds to be distributed
  • August 14: (approx.) orders placed for parts manufacture  and equipment
  • August 14 - September 1: Fulfillment of Indiegogo perks
  • September 1: Final assembly of prototypes begins and testing commences ASAP with design iterations occurring simultaneously
  • January 1: Testing is concluded and the product will be made market ready

This is a tentative timeline and is subject to change. We will work as quickly as we can and keep everyone involved updated to our progress.

The Challenges

Money is the number one challenge. Funding the project on a limited budget has led to delays in parts acquisition and manufacturing. Funding will alleviate many issues with and speed up product development.

Another major challenge is our inability to accurately take temperature or power measurements over time. Being able to see how the device performs while left running is critical. A portion of the funds is set aside to purchase temperature sensors and multimeters with logging functions.

The last major challenge is circuit design. We require a control circuit to regulate power generated by the device. This circuit must be as lightweight and efficient as possible to maximize power to weight of the device. As a result, expert circuit design by a trained professional is a necessity.

Your Help

A functioning prototype has already been built and a full-scale, full-function version has already been designed and is ready for immediate production. We have funded this project thus far completely out of our own pockets. This campaign is raising funds to move forward with proper testing.

Unfortunately, we are not able to put this product up for pre-sale at the moment. With your help, we will be able to reach that point more quickly. Our perks are intended as a token of our appreciation and to show that we are serious about getting this product and our name out there.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant help financially, then help spread the word! Everything helps.

Feedback is always appreciated. If you have questions or comments, feel free to contact me either through

  • Indiegogo
  • Contact form at http://www.mechanical-y.com/contact.html
  • Direct email to yuriy@mechanical-y.com
Don't worry about being blunt, I really want to hear your thoughts.

Campaign Result

Once we reach our funding goal we can move forward with prototyping and testing. These tests will determine actual performance parameters for the device and indicate whether any modifications need to be made to the design.

These campaign funds are enough to complete the testing phase of this device. Once this is complete, we can move on with full scale production and marketing.


Thank you!

For more information, please visit www.mechanical-y.com
story_txt:
Are you a family of four going car camping and don't want to drag a bulky, multi-kilowatt generator with you just to keep your mobile devices charged?
Experiencing a blackout and want to run some lights and a radio while you wait?
Are you at an outdoor event and want to play some music from your portable speakers, but the batteries just wont last?
Has a natural disaster caused you to leave your home, and you don't have a way to charge and power vital electronic devices?
Well, we can help you with that, and you can take it anywhere!
Our Project At half the weight of high-capacity lithium-ion batteries, our portable power generator is designed to produce 20 watts for up to 100 hours while weighing less than 10 pounds. This is enough power to charge 2-4 smart devices at a time, and it can produce enough to charge about 50 smart phones in a single day. Using commonly available bottle fuel, this system is inexpensive, accessible, and safe to use. From military, to emergency services, to private use, this device can keep your small devices charged in any situation.

Target Performance

4 kg (8.8 lbs) final gross weight
20 W continuous operation for 100 hours (2,000 W-hr equivalent)
Emergency 20 W output for up to 15 min in extreme environments
Emergency 200 W output for 5 min burst
Switchable 5 / 12 Volt DC output, with a variety of receptacles
Operable while stationary or carried in all weather conditions

The Advantage
There is virtually no limit to the number of small devices that are available. The issue is that these devices need to be kept charged. Currently, the best way to do this away from a power outlet is either with a traditional gas generator, devices like solar chargers, or simply more batteries. There are other devices on the market which have a similar operating principle as this device, though these products still have shortcomings.
The issue with other devices is that they are heavy, cumbersome to use, may not work while on the move, and (in the case of things like solar chargers) simply do not work in all situations.
Our portable power generator is designed to work on the move. For equal performance, it is lighter than any of these other commonly available power solutions. It is small, compact, and safe to use. The generator uses commonly available bottle fuels, such as those used in small camping stoves, making it accessible and affordable.
This portable power generator can be used by the military to charge radios, GPS units, laptops, or any other small electronic device in the field. Emergency services and disaster relief can benefit from this device as grid power is typically unavailable and mobility is key. This generator can even be used in the home or for recreational applications. story:
BeeEthic system sterminates Varroa by heating the comb to 108 F(42°C), thus stopping the reproduction of the Varroa and eradicating it from the colony. Varroa is a viruses' vector, hence without Varroa a colony is also much healthier and less exposed to viruses. 

The BeeEthic electronic control unit applies automatic treatment monthly. It also help bees to maintain the ideal temperature in the brood (95°F; 35°C) making it less dependent on climate variability.

This method is 100% effective, as certified by the Italian Ministry of Environment, after 6 years of testing by the Perugia University (Italy).  

BeeEthic has exceeded expectations thanks to the strong contributions of a team of engineers, researchers and beekeepers. In our research we have found out that by keeping the Varroa population under a certain level, bees improve honey production as they enjoy better health.

RESULTS (six years research by Perugia University)

  • NO SIDE-EFFECTS, NO QUEEN CASUALTIES

  • 80% EFFICIENCY IN KILLING VARROA MITES

  • VIRUS SPREAD REDUCTION

  • BROOD DISEASES' REDUCTION

  • INCREASING IN HONEY PRODUCTION up to 30%

  • SAVING BEEKEEPERS' WORK up to 50%

  • PRESERVING HONEY RESERVES THROUGHOUT THE SEASON

 

Media reports:

       

 

Main Partners:

  

     

     

   

 

Varroa mites are threatening the very bees' survival worldwide. Colony Collapse Disorder is killing bees at scaring rates and our system is the solution to save bees and mankind with them...as man cannot live without bees!

The BeeEthic system applies heat within the hive. Varroa mites are sensitive to high temperatures and they cannot survive to temperatures higher than 108 F (42°C). This is an automatic system that does not require any manual application and enables beekeepers to get rid of dangerous chemical products to kill Varroa.

The "brain" of the BeeEthic system is an electronic control unit which applies anti-Varroa treatments when they are needed. It also help bees to control the brood temperature, expecially during rapid variations due to climate irregularities.

Varroa mites reproductive cycle is much faster than the bees' reproductive cycle, making Varroa very aggressive. In one season a whole colony can be destroyed by Varroa, as shown in the graph below.

Up to today, Varroa has been killed only with strong chemical products which damage also bees and leave residues in the bees' products. Varroa adapts quickly to chemical remedies which has to be strengthened yearly to be effective.

All solutions that aremarginally effective are either highly toxic or illegal, because of their hazard to animal and human health.

Bee ethic - Test of efficacy​

 

Research Outlights

Many studies show the thermal treatment's effectiveness. This is the only treatment certified as 100% effective, following a five year study by the Tubingen University (Germany). Tubingen inserted honeycombs into special ovens with a laborious process which makes it not easy to be used by beekeepers.

Varroa reproduction takes place in bee broods. About 80% of Varroa lives in the brood, with the remaining 20% traveling attached to the bees (phoretic Varroa).

  

Chemical treatments are successful mostly on the phoretic Varroa. With the exception of the formic acid which can kill the Varroa also inside the brood. This has massive side-effects on bees, though. 

Normally, beekeepers uses ossalic acid, which is also admitted for organically-certified honey as it does not have strong residues. However, its application is labor-intensive as up to ten treatments per season are necessary.  

After 6 years of field research and testing in cooperation with university, expert beekeepers and clients, we did not come across any side-effect of the BeeEthic sytem,  which destroys Varroa mite during its reproduction cycle, avoiding its dangerous demographic explosion.

  

With automatically repeated treatments throughout the season (at every brood incubation), newborn bees are healthier!

By removing around 80% of the Varroa from the brood, we lowers the risk of viruses which are carried by the Varroa mite (DWV, ABV, IAPV, KBV CBPV, etc.)

With a constant temperature in the hive, controlled by the BeeEthic system, we reduce honey self-consumption by the bees. In fact, over half of the honey produced in a hive, is needed by bees to  production is needed to maintain the ideal temperature of 95 F and support healthy bees.

With evident effects of climate change, challenges to the bees have become formidable. BeeEthic helps maintaining a constant temperature in the honeycomb, avoiding several problems, such as  COOLED BROOD, CALCIFIED BROOD, FUNGUS, MAL DI MAGGIO, DYSENTERY, MAL NERO, etc.

 

Research Results obtained in 2013 

The initial research was carried out in collaboration with the Beekeepers Cooperative in Gubbio Italy and the Perugia University. It resulted in a 70% mortality rate of the Varroa mite after a single treatment which took place on five hives at the end of August 2013. This was a great result as efficiency was higher than any other product in the market, which were tested in control units.

Applied Research Results Obtained in 2014

In 2014, our research covered 100 hives, making it a scientific relevant sample. The treatment resulted in the destruction of experimentation 80% of Varroa mites! Results were certified by the Perugia University and the Italian Ministry of Environment. A result much stronger than expected!

BeeEthic hitting the market in 2015

BeeEthic was marketed in 2015 and so far it is been used by more then 100 beekeepers worldwide. Many of them are making plans to expand the system to their whole apiary!!!

In 2017 we develop our software to apply the treatment automatically.  We care about our clients, whom we know personally and we consider friends. We did then upgrade the new software to all the systems already sold.

In January 2017, at the ABF Conference in Houston TX, we launched the Langstroth frame for the US market.

Currently, the company produces and sells:

1) Hive kits to install in an existing Dadant or Langstroth hives

2) Complete BeeEthic hives (with a Control Unit every 5 hives, powered by the grid, a solar system or a fuel engine, supporting also nomadism)

About 1,000 BeeEthic hives have already been installed throughout the world to full satisfactions of our friends bee-keepers.

With the funding we are collecting in this campaign, we will upgrade the BeeEthic System to:

BeeEthic 2.0 - 2017

The BeeEthic 2.0 system is connected to the BeeEthic cloud, enabling beekeepers to get access on their smartphones to their hives' information, including the brood temperature, the anti-Varroa treatments schedule. Beekeepers will also have the possibility to start manually a treatment over the phone, if they deem it necessary.

 

BeeEthic Testimonials

Dr. Tiziano Gardi, Perugia University, Head of the Research Team:

"The research was carried out in collaboration with F.A.I. (Italian Beekeepers Federation ) and the Beekeepers Cooperative from Gubbio-Gualdo for the past 5 years, during which we perfected the system, which has given good results. Three students did their graduation thesis on this research and every year we keep improving the system".

 

Dr. Marco Porporato, Researcher, Turin University

"Today we discovered this wonderful initiative promoted by BeeEthic, with their system that uses heat therapy to reduce the Varroa population breeding in the colony, I think it is a great innovation in the beekeeping scene, surely it will be favorably received by beekeepers"

 

Dr. Aulo Manino, Turin University

"I am familiar with the heat treatment method, but infortunatelly it presents serious technical difficulties. BeeEthic is a new device that addresses many of the problems that so far prevented the use of the heat treatment. Therefore it represents a turning point in the implementation of this methodology to fight Varroa"

 

Dr. Annalisa Balloi - Researcher and CEO of Micro4You

"Micro4You and BeeEthic have been working togheter for several years and during this period I was able to appreciate the effectivenees and innovative aspects of this method that I'm sure will lead to a revolution in beekeeping with positive ripercussions throughout the entire agribusiness sector"
 
 

 

Some of our Clients:

 

Don Mario Beekeeping -  Lugano, Switzerland

"Sixt months ago I've seen a BeeEthic advertisement and I've bought the system for 10 colonies. Now we are at the end of the season. I have opened the BeeEthic hives and I can conclude that they are the best in my 100-hive apiary!  To me the system works very well and I will buy it again, because for us what is important is the Bee!"

 

Mr. Federico Fusco, BeeEthic Beekeeper from 2015 - Italy

"I approached the BeeEthic world a bit by chance and slowly I used this technology a bit like a trial... and I have to say that - from this year - after a first year with a bit of uncertainty - I had the first results from the 4 BeeEthic colonies. They look very well. They have passed the Winter and now they are the best of my apiary! I'm expanding the BeeEthic apiary, doubling it from last year"

 

Adi Apicoltura, Large Beekeeping Company in Tornareccio since 1858 - Italy

"We are an historical company established in 1858 by my grandfather. We are organic beekeeper since 1999 and this led us to try this new opportunity to fight Varroa. We saw Varroa mites dying. I wish you to secceed in making your product lighter and simpler because it is still a bit complex"

 

Beekeeping Giannini, Large Beekeeping Company in San Marino

"I have been professional beekeeper for more then 30 years, I own about 1,000 hives. I always had problem with Varroa and I wanted to try new solutions. I use Ossalic acid and Apivar. Sometimes I have also blocked the queens but this is very complex as I have many hives.  BeeEthic impressed me! The first 5 test BeeEthic hives, after the first season, are beautiful, without using any chemicals. I then bought another 14 hives and I intend to expand the presence of BeeEthic in my apiary because I am fed up with so many chemical treatments."

 

Beekeeping Rohrwacher - Professional Organic Bekeeper, with Bee ethic from 2015 - Italy

 

"I have been a beekeeper for  many years, since long time I have chosen to fight Varroa with methods approved under certified organic beekeeping. The main problem is the adaptation of the Varroa mite to whatever chemical substance we use. BeeEthic enables beekeepers to treat bees all year round, even doing the production period. The treatment is efficient as we can observe within the brood comb several dead mites. I'm certain that this will be the future!"

 

Other Thermal Treatment Technologies

The competitive advantage of the BeeEthic system is the integration of the thermic treatment within the hive as compared to treating honeycombs in ovens. This  makes the treatment simple and effective also for inexperienced beekeepers. BeeEthic is substantially less labor-intensive compare to the chemical treatments available in the market. It guarantees that all bee products (honey, propolis, royal jelly, wax, pollen, poison) are fully natural and organic!

Other thermic systems in the market are not even close to the results obtained by BeeEthic!

Why BeeEthic? 

If you have high death rates in your colonies, BeeEthic is the best solution for you!

  • For Hobbyist Beekeepers. Your hobby will be more fun as your bees will get stronger, healthier and more productive. You will be able to stop using chemicals for your hives,  enjoying more your time with bees!
  • For Professional Beekeepers. With BeeEthic you will get stronger colonies and lower death rates. You will obtain healthy honey, without any residues. Treatments are complitely automatic, saving up to 30% time and labor. You will produce up to 30% more honey and you will stop loosing colonies. You will get your investment back in  less then 2 years!
  • For Start-up Beekeepers. BeeEthic offers the solution for healthy colonies without using any chemicals. You can enjoy more time to learn about bees, without bothering about the main beehives' problem: Varroa mites.
  • Honey consumers. Help saving honeybees, supporting our project. We will reward your support with delicius healthy honey!

 

How does it Work?

In stead of spending their whole time to fight Varroa mites, beekeepers can check their hives' information directly on their smartphones! 

8 thermal frames (with an heating element inside the honeycomb) are included in each beehive. They are connected by new spacers. A central frame is connected by a cable to the control unit, which controls the temperature in the hive.

The control unit controls automatically the brood and the bees, making information available online to beekeepers.
 

 

Cost to Beekeepers

As shown in the graphs below, a 10 BeeEthic hives apiary costs similarly to traditional systems, if we compute the cost for treatments and the labor it takes for their application. 

The investment is paid fully after two years of production. The system's be life span is guaranteed for 5 years. Guarantee can be expanded to 10 years. Increased honey production (up to 30%) is not computed in this calculation, hence your BeeEthic system will be paid back even earlier! It will be even earlier if you consider that your organic honey can now be sold at a premium price!

 

Perks

T-Shirt Save The Bees

Unique custom-made T-shirt Save the Bees. It will allow us to bring our message to the world and to support with a small contribution bees and BeeEthic.

Each t-shirt is available in all sizes for both men and women, in black or yellow color.

 

Adopt a BeeEthic Hive

You get pure BeeEthic honey, which is the natural product of honey bees. Organic honey is produced by bees that were only fed with organically grown flowers. The BeeEthic Honey is the best you can find in the market because our bees were not treated with any chemicals.

You get  10 x 500g (176,37oz) honey jars twice a year!
By reading the QR code on the jar, you can watch the latest news in a beekeeper's video-clip. This will enable you to stay connected to the producer, to get information on the honey, including on the different flowers' seasonality (Acacia, chestnut, millefiori, clover, arbutus, etc.).

By adopting a bee-hive you will help beekeepers, bees and the environment!

 

BeeEthic 2.0 Hive - Plug-in

With the BeeEthic 2.0 hive you use electricity from the grid to heat-up the hive. Heat is used for the automatic monthly treatment against Varroa and for hive conditioning throughout the season to increase honey production.
You only have to put bees in the hive, plug the system in, check it on your mobile or laptop and it's ready to work.

 

Beeethic 2.0 Hive - Solar

BeeEthic 2.0 Hive - solar is equipped with a solar panel, it performs heat treatments without connection to the grid. Heat is used for the automatic monthly treatment against Varroa and for hive conditioning throughout the season to increase honey production. You only have to put bees in the hive, plug the system in, check it on your mobile or laptop and it's ready to work.

A Dadant Wooden BeeEthic Hive

 

Why crowdfunding?

We are a small team, which is using its savings to launch this fantastic product. We know we have a great idea and we want to use the community to spread it throughout the whole world!

We have a product tested by researchers and beekeepers for the past 5 years. This is working and we want to use crowd-funding to keep improving it and make it available to as many beekeepers as possible. This will help saving the world's bees!

We need 100.000 usd to upgrade the system to the BeeEthic 2.0 Hive, which will be the best practical solution against Varroa ever.

We need to develop a new single hive control unit, autonomous and connected to the cloud with an application. The control unit manages 350 W power and the sensors. It has a wi-fi connection and a box which is sufficiently durable to be used on a typical bees' field.

Part of the investment will also be used to develop a new plastic frame mold and a new lithium battery for a portable photovoltaic generator.

For a small team this is a large investment and we need all the help we can get to upgrade the system and make it easier to use for millions of beekeepers.

 

Possible Risks & Challenges

Manufacturing

Our experience is still with middle volumes of hives. So far we have produced about 1,000 hives. There is a slight risk of delay in the manufacturing process due to our limited production capacity.

However we have agreements with carefully chosen manufacturers to cover the growing demand. Hence, we are in a position to expand production to respond to higher demand from the market. 

Shipment

We will be shipping the complete assembled hive to ensure consistency in the product quality.  Shipping a plastic hive reduces costs. 

Fulfillment

We are ready to face market demands originating from the campaign. We are ready to answer to a successful campaign raising 100,000 usd. It can be challenging to answer to larger demands...but we are ready to get ready!

If we don't achieve the campaign target, we will be able to develop a new generation hive, but this will not be connected to the cloud.

 

Bee ethic Group

Tagliaferri Inc.

Sales and Service Worldwide

Mauro Tagliaferri - CEO

The inventor of BeeEthic and the patent holder. He is a young entrepreneur from Gubbio (Perugia - Italy).

He has always taken care of the family's land and bees with passion and respect for biodiversity and the ecosystem. These values led him to search for ways to ensure natural beekeeping and to finally discover the thermostatic anti-varroa treatment.
In 2012, he entered into a partnership with the Beekeepers Cooperative of Gubbio/Gualdo.
In 2013, he applied for two patents for anti-varroa treatment and climatization inside the hives.
In 2014, after years of research, he decided to dedicate his life to BeeEthic and he applied for two international PCT patents which are identified by the brand name BeeEthic.
In 2015, he marketed the first version of the BeeEthic hives.

Eng. Ascanio Tagliaferri - FCO

Ascanio is Mauro's brother. They have been working together for the last 10 years in their limited company, Skanergy.

He graduated for the second time in 2006 and worked some years on a large photovoltaic company close to Bologna. He then decided to start Skanergy, a limited company, which installed about 5,000 kWp of photovoltaic energy generators in Italy.

In 2012, he decided to refocus the company on the BeeEthic project, which was taking off.

Ascanio is responsible for the technical research, prototyping and production.

Currently he took over responsibility for administration and R&D.

Viola Tagliaferri - Secretary

Viola has been helping the company for the past 5 years, focusing on its EU and American markets.

She is the Secretary of the Board of Directors and she is responsible for clients in the US and Canada.

 

Skanergy srl - Italy company

Production and R&D

Eng. Ascanio Tagliaferri - CEO 

Mauro Tagliaferri - General Management​

Dr. Fabio Artuso - Sales Manager

He is the first private investor who trusted in the project potential. He believes money should go where the hear beats...and Fabio's heart beats close to nature!

Fabio has been working as diplomat for several years and he is now consulting with several international organizations supporting development in emerging Asian economies, including with the World Bank Group, the United Nations and the European Union.

He is responsible for the international expansion of the company.

Dr. Aldo Biondi - Strategic Planning

He is an investor with an Agronomist and Beekeeping background. Aldo fell in love with the project and he decided to support the team both financially and with sharing his multi-annual experience in developing economies.

Also is currently supporting the international expansion of the company.

Theo Ramoz Rodriguez - Operations

Theo has been responsible for the production of BeeEthic in Italy for nearly three years. He is in charge of logistics, warehouse management and production.

Amor Zaafouri - Operations

Amor's family has been involved in beekeeping in Tunisia for three generations! Today he is engaged in production in Italy of special BeeEhic frames, and he focuses on field trials with bees along with Mauro.

PRESERVING HONEY RESERVES THROUGHOUT THE SEASON
 Media reports:        Main Partners:                Varroa mites are threatening the very bees' survival worldwide. Colony Collapse Disorder is killing bees at scaring rates and our system is the solution to save bees and mankind with them...as man cannot live without bees!The BeeEthic system applies heat within the hive. Varroa mites are sensitive to high temperatures and they cannot survive to temperatures higher than 108 F (42°C). This is an automatic system that does not require any manual application and enables beekeepers to get rid of dangerous chemical products to kill Varroa.The "brain" of the BeeEthic system is an electronic control unit which applies anti-Varroa treatments when they are needed. It also help bees to control the brood temperature, expecially during rapid variations due to climate irregularities.Varroa mites reproductive cycle is much faster than the bees' reproductive cycle, making Varroa very aggressive. In one season a whole colony can be destroyed by Varroa, as shown in the graph below.Up to today, Varroa has been killed only with strong chemical products which damage also bees and leave residues in the bees' products. Varroa adapts quickly to chemical remedies which has to be strengthened yearly to be effective. All solutions that aremarginally effective are either highly toxic or illegal, because of their hazard to animal and human health.Bee ethic - Test of efficacy​ Research OutlightsMany studies show the thermal treatment's effectiveness. This is the only treatment certified as 100% effective, following a five year study by the Tubingen University (Germany). Tubingen inserted honeycombs into special ovens with a laborious process which makes it not easy to be used by beekeepers.Varroa reproduction takes place in bee broods. About 80% of Varroa lives in the brood, with the remaining 20% traveling attached to the bees (phoretic Varroa).  Chemical treatments are successful mostly on the phoretic Varroa. With the exception of the formic acid which can kill the Varroa also inside the brood. This has massive side-effects on bees, though. Normally, beekeepers uses ossalic acid, which is also admitted for organically-certified honey as it does not have strong residues. However, its application is labor-intensive as up to ten treatments per season are necessary.  After 6 years of field research and testing in cooperation with university, expert beekeepers and clients, we did not come across any side-effect of the BeeEthic sytem,  which destroys Varroa mite during its reproduction cycle, avoiding its dangerous demographic explosion.  With automatically repeated treatments throughout the season (at every brood incubation), newborn bees are healthier!By removing around 80% of the Varroa from the brood, we lowers the risk of viruses which are carried by the Varroa mite (DWV, ABV, IAPV, KBV CBPV, etc.)With a constant temperature in the hive, controlled by the BeeEthic system, we reduce honey self-consumption by the bees. In fact, over half of the honey produced in a hive, is needed by bees to  production is needed to maintain the ideal temperature of 95 F and support healthy bees.With evident effects of climate change, challenges to the bees have become formidable. BeeEthic helps maintaining a constant temperature in the honeycomb, avoiding several problems, such as  COOLED BROOD, CALCIFIED BROOD, FUNGUS, MAL DI MAGGIO, DYSENTERY, MAL NERO, etc. 
Research Results obtained in 2013 The initial research was carried out in collaboration with the Beekeepers Cooperative in Gubbio Italy and the Perugia University. It resulted in a 70% mortality rate of the Varroa mite after a single treatment which took place on five hives at the end of August 2013. This was a great result as efficiency was higher than any other product in the market, which were tested in control units.Applied Research Results Obtained in 2014In 2014, our research covered 100 hives, making it a scientific relevant sample. The treatment resulted in the destruction of experimentation 80% of Varroa mites! Results were certified by the Perugia University and the Italian Ministry of Environment. A result much stronger than expected!BeeEthic hitting the market in 2015BeeEthic was marketed in 2015 and so far it is been used by more then 100 beekeepers worldwide. Many of them are making plans to expand the system to their whole apiary!!!In 2017 we develop our software to apply the treatment automatically.  We care about our clients, whom we know personally and we consider friends. We did then upgrade the new software to all the systems already sold.In January 2017, at the ABF Conference in Houston TX, we launched the Langstroth frame for the US market.Currently, the company produces and sells:1) Hive kits to install in an existing Dadant or Langstroth hives2) Complete BeeEthic hives (with a Control Unit every 5 hives, powered by the grid, a solar system or a fuel engine, supporting also nomadism)About 1,000 BeeEthic hives have already been installed throughout the world to full satisfactions of our friends bee-keepers. With the funding we are collecting in this campaign, we will upgrade the BeeEthic System to:BeeEthic 2.0 - 2017The BeeEthic 2.0 system is connected to the BeeEthic cloud, enabling beekeepers to get access on their smartphones to their hives' information, including the brood temperature, the anti-Varroa treatments schedule. Beekeepers will also have the possibility to start manually a treatment over the phone, if they deem it necessary. BeeEthic TestimonialsDr. Tiziano Gardi, Perugia University, Head of the Research Team:"The research was carried out in collaboration with F.A.I. (Italian Beekeepers Federation ) and the Beekeepers Cooperative from Gubbio-Gualdo for the past 5 years, during which we perfected the system, which has given good results. Three students did their graduation thesis on this research and every year we keep improving the system". Dr. Marco Porporato, Researcher, Turin University"Today we discovered this wonderful initiative promoted by BeeEthic, with their system that uses heat therapy to reduce the Varroa population breeding in the colony, I think it is a great innovation in the beekeeping scene, surely it will be favorably received by beekeepers" Dr. Aulo Manino, Turin University "I am familiar with the heat treatment method, but infortunatelly it presents serious technical difficulties. BeeEthic is a new device that addresses many of the problems that so far prevented the use of the heat treatment. Therefore it represents a turning point in the implementation of this methodology to fight Varroa" Dr. Annalisa Balloi - Researcher and CEO of Micro4You"Micro4You and BeeEthic have been working togheter for several years and during this period I was able to appreciate the effectivenees and innovative aspects of this method that I'm sure will lead to a revolution in beekeeping with positive ripercussions throughout the entire agribusiness sector"   Some of our Clients: Don Mario Beekeeping -  Lugano, Switzerland"Sixt months ago I've seen a BeeEthic advertisement and I've bought the system for 10 colonies. Now we are at the end of the season. I have opened the BeeEthic hives and I can conclude that they are the best in my 100-hive apiary!  To me the system works very well and I will buy it again, because for us what is important is the Bee!" Mr. Federico Fusco, BeeEthic Beekeeper from 2015 - Italy"I approached the BeeEthic world a bit by chance and slowly I used this technology a bit like a trial... and I have to say that - from this year - after a first year with a bit of uncertainty - I had the first results from the 4 BeeEthic colonies. They look very well. They have passed the Winter and now they are the best of my apiary! I'm expanding the BeeEthic apiary, doubling it from last year" Adi Apicoltura, Large Beekeeping Company in Tornareccio since 1858 - Italy"We are an historical company established in 1858 by my grandfather. We are organic beekeeper since 1999 and this led us to try this new opportunity to fight Varroa. We saw Varroa mites dying. I wish you to secceed in making your product lighter and simpler because it is still a bit complex" Beekeeping Giannini, Large Beekeeping Company in San Marino

"I have been professional beekeeper for more then 30 years, I own about 1,000 hives. I always had problem with Varroa and I wanted to try new solutions. I use Ossalic acid and Apivar. Sometimes I have also blocked the queens but this is very complex as I have many hives.  BeeEthic impressed me! The first 5 test BeeEthic hives, after the first season, are beautiful, without using any chemicals. I then bought another 14 hives and I intend to expand the presence of BeeEthic in my apiary because I am fed up with so many chemical treatments."
 Beekeeping Rohrwacher - Professional Organic Bekeeper, with Bee ethic from 2015 - Italy "I have been a beekeeper for  many years, since long time I have chosen to fight Varroa with methods approved under certified organic beekeeping. The main problem is the adaptation of the Varroa mite to whatever chemical substance we use. BeeEthic enables beekeepers to treat bees all year round, even doing the production period. The treatment is efficient as we can observe within the brood comb several dead mites. I'm certain that this will be the future!" Other Thermal Treatment TechnologiesThe competitive advantage of the BeeEthic system is the integration of the thermic treatment within the hive as compared to treating honeycombs in ovens. This  makes the treatment simple and effective also for inexperienced beekeepers. BeeEthic is substantially less labor-intensive compare to the chemical treatments available in the market. It guarantees that all bee products (honey, propolis, royal jelly, wax, pollen, poison) are fully natural and organic!Other thermic systems in the market are not even close to the results obtained by BeeEthic!
Why BeeEthic? If you have high death rates in your colonies, BeeEthic is the best solution for you!

For Hobbyist Beekeepers. Your hobby will be more fun as your bees will get stronger, healthier and more productive. You will be able to stop using chemicals for your hives,  enjoying more your time with bees!

For Professional Beekeepers. With BeeEthic you will get stronger colonies and lower death rates. You will obtain healthy honey, without any residues. Treatments are complitely automatic, saving up to 30% time and labor. You will produce up to 30% more honey and you will stop loosing colonies. You will get your investment back in  less then 2 years!


For Start-up Beekeepers. BeeEthic offers the solution for healthy colonies without using any chemicals. You can enjoy more time to learn about bees, without bothering about the main beehives' problem: Varroa mites.

Honey consumers. Help saving honeybees, supporting our project. We will reward your support with delicius healthy honey!
 How does it Work?In stead of spending their whole time to fight Varroa mites, beekeepers can check their hives' information directly on their smartphones! 
8 thermal frames (with an heating element inside the honeycomb) are included in each beehive. They are connected by new spacers. A central frame is connected by a cable to the control unit, which controls the temperature in the hive.

The control unit controls automatically the brood and the bees, making information available online to beekeepers.
 

 Cost to BeekeepersAs shown in the graphs below, a 10 BeeEthic hives apiary costs similarly to traditional systems, if we compute the cost for treatments and the labor it takes for their application. The investment is paid fully after two years of production. The system's be life span is guaranteed for 5 years. Guarantee can be expanded to 10 years. Increased honey production (up to 30%) is not computed in this calculation, hence your BeeEthic system will be paid back even earlier! It will be even earlier if you consider that your organic honey can now be sold at a premium price! PerksT-Shirt Save The BeesUnique custom-made T-shirt Save the Bees. It will allow us to bring our message to the world and to support with a small contribution bees and BeeEthic.Each t-shirt is available in all sizes for both men and women, in black or yellow color. Adopt a BeeEthic HiveYou get pure BeeEthic honey, which is the natural product of honey bees. Organic honey is produced by bees that were only fed with organically grown flowers. The BeeEthic Honey is the best you can find in the market because our bees were not treated with any chemicals.You get  10 x 500g (176,37oz) honey jars twice a year!By reading the QR code on the jar, you can watch the latest news in a beekeeper's video-clip. This will enable you to stay connected to the producer, to get information on the honey, including on the different flowers' seasonality (Acacia, chestnut, millefiori, clover, arbutus, etc.).By adopting a bee-hive you will help beekeepers, bees and the environment! BeeEthic 2.0 Hive - Plug-inWith the BeeEthic 2.0 hive you use electricity from the grid to heat-up the hive. Heat is used for the automatic monthly treatment against Varroa and for hive conditioning throughout the season to increase honey production.You only have to put bees in the hive, plug the system in, check it on your mobile or laptop and it's ready to work. Beeethic 2.0 Hive - SolarBeeEthic 2.0 Hive - solar is equipped with a solar panel, it performs heat treatments without connection to the grid. Heat is used for the automatic monthly treatment against Varroa and for hive conditioning throughout the season to increase honey production. You only have to put bees in the hive, plug the system in, check it on your mobile or laptop and it's ready to work.A Dadant Wooden BeeEthic Hive Why crowdfunding?We are a small team, which is using its savings to launch this fantastic product. We know we have a great idea and we want to use the community to spread it throughout the whole world!We have a product tested by researchers and beekeepers for the past 5 years. This is working and we want to use crowd-funding to keep improving it and make it available to as many beekeepers as possible. This will help saving the world's bees!We need 100.000 usd to upgrade the system to the BeeEthic 2.0 Hive, which will be the best practical solution against Varroa ever.We need to develop a new single hive control unit, autonomous and connected to the cloud with an application. The control unit manages 350 W power and the sensors. It has a wi-fi connection and a box which is sufficiently durable to be used on a typical bees' field.Part of the investment will also be used to develop a new plastic frame mold and a new lithium battery for a portable photovoltaic generator.For a small team this is a large investment and we need all the help we can get to upgrade the system and make it easier to use for millions of beekeepers. Possible Risks & ChallengesManufacturingOur experience is still with middle volumes of hives. So far we have produced about 1,000 hives. There is a slight risk of delay in the manufacturing process due to our limited production capacity.However we have agreements with carefully chosen manufacturers to cover the growing demand. Hence, we are in a position to expand production to respond to higher demand from the market. ShipmentWe will be shipping the complete assembled hive to ensure consistency in the product quality.  Shipping a plastic hive reduces costs. FulfillmentWe are ready to face market demands originating from the campaign. We are ready to answer to a successful campaign raising 100,000 usd. It can be challenging to answer to larger demands...but we are ready to get ready!If we don't achieve the campaign target, we will be able to develop a new generation hive, but this will not be connected to the cloud. Bee ethic Group
Tagliaferri Inc.
Sales and Service WorldwideMauro Tagliaferri - CEOThe inventor of BeeEthic and the patent holder. He is a young entrepreneur from Gubbio (Perugia - Italy).He has always taken care of the family's land and bees with passion and respect for biodiversity and the ecosystem. These values led him to search for ways to ensure natural beekeeping and to finally discover the thermostatic anti-varroa treatment.In 2012, he entered into a partnership with the Beekeepers Cooperative of Gubbio/Gualdo.In 2013, he applied for two patents for anti-varroa treatment and climatization inside the hives.In 2014, after years of research, he decided to dedicate his life to BeeEthic and he applied for two international PCT patents which are identified by the brand name BeeEthic.In 2015, he marketed the first version of the BeeEthic hives.Eng. Ascanio Tagliaferri - FCOAscanio is Mauro's brother. They have been working together for the last 10 years in their limited company, Skanergy.He graduated for the second time in 2006 and worked some years on a large photovoltaic company close to Bologna. He then decided to start Skanergy, a limited company, which installed about 5,000 kWp of photovoltaic energy generators in Italy.In 2012, he decided to refocus the company on the BeeEthic project, which was taking off.Ascanio is responsible for the technical research, prototyping and production.Currently he took over responsibility for administration and R&D.Viola Tagliaferri - SecretaryViola has been helping the company for the past 5 years, focusing on its EU and American markets.She is the Secretary of the Board of Directors and she is responsible for clients in the US and Canada. 
Skanergy srl - Italy company
Production and R&DEng. Ascanio Tagliaferri - CEO Mauro Tagliaferri - General Management​Dr. Fabio Artuso - Sales ManagerHe is the first private investor who trusted in the project potential. He believes money should go where the hear beats...and Fabio's heart beats close to nature!Fabio has been working as diplomat for several years and he is now consulting with several international organizations supporting development in emerging Asian economies, including with the World Bank Group, the United Nations and the European Union.He is responsible for the international expansion of the company.Dr. Aldo Biondi - Strategic PlanningHe is an investor with an Agronomist and Beekeeping background. Aldo fell in love with the project and he decided to support the team both financially and with sharing his multi-annual experience in developing economies.Also is currently supporting the international expansion of the company.Theo Ramoz Rodriguez - OperationsTheo has been responsible for the production of BeeEthic in Italy for nearly three years. He is in charge of logistics, warehouse management and production.Amor Zaafouri - OperationsAmor's family has been involved in beekeeping in Tunisia for three generations! Today he is engaged in production in Italy of special BeeEhic frames, and he focuses on field trials with bees along with Mauro.

story:
It’s about time that people can walk into a grocery store and make eco-friendly purchases without any effort!

 

  • Our green startup, Good-For-You Certified, has created a set of logos that serve to label and certify foods that are eco-friendly, environmentally sustainable and those that have a low carbon footprint—so that consumers can more easily make environmentally-friendly purchases.
  • Our logos carry their own barcodes with different attributes. These logos would feature prominently on the front of every qualifying product.
  • Check out our website here!

 

 

The Impact

 

  • The active use of GFY logos will facilitate easy, eco-friendly consumption with no effort on the consumer's side. Our project will help reduce wasteful consumption and will help support the preservation of our planet, in addition to the well-being of future generations. 
  • The use of GFY logos will also put more policy power in the consumers' hands: if consumers are in a better position to make informed, eco-friendly purchases, then businesses will have to adapt to this new market trend and in turn integrate more sustainable business policies. Think about the huge impact that The Non-GMO project labels had on consumer decisions and the food economy in the past 10 years. GFY will be the first standard label for environmentally sustainable foods with an impact!

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • We need to raise $200k to file two strategic patents and roll out these logos to companies with qualifying foods. 
  • Our unique perk is that we are doing what no other startup has ever done: we want to make your every contribution count. For every amount one donates, we will lock in future shares e.g $50 for 50 shares, $100 for 100 shares, etc. This is non-negotiable.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Can't donate but still want to help? 

  • We'd love for you to share our campaign on any of your social media accounts!
  • We'd appreciate a follow on Instagram.
  • Or simply share our website!

 

 

Get In Touch 

 

For any questions, concerns, ideas, and support, email us at gfycertified@protonmail.com

Thank you for any and all of your support :)
