story:
In our travels we have witnessed whole families working in landfills, dump sites, and trash heaps, salvaging what they deemed of value, just to survive; exposing themselves to harmful elements, and therefore, endangering their health and safety. With our units, we hope to eliminate that danger by creating a cleaner, healthier environment for all of us; and in doing so, create jobs so fewer people will need to resort to such a way of life.

 

Hello, I’m Gene Sawyer, the CEO & President of BOSS Alliance LLC. which is an energy solutions partner with Dynamis Energy. Since 2012, we have explored and found ways to convert trash, primarily municipal solid waste (MSW), to energy (electricity & heat); therefore reducing environmental, economic, and social landfill disposal issues. 

BOSS Alliance has vetted  many Waste to Energy companies that claimed they had "the" solution for Waste to Energy. After visiting Dynamis Energy’s corporate offices and test site, we were accepted as a team partner. As an Independent Agent, we represent the Dynamis Energy technology. The last 4 years we’ve introduced and promoted the Dynamis Energy Waste to Energy technology domestically, and to several other countries. We have faced many challenges in the Waste to Energy development program, and one of the biggest has been in being able to show interested parties a “Live Demonstration” of the Waste to Energy technology in operation, without our clients traveling to the Dynamis test facility in Idaho. Dynamis Energy has agreed that, with a successful campaign funding program, they will modify the "Waste Station", and build for us a Mobile Demonstration Unit. 

With the MDU, we will be able to demonstrate the complete waste to energy process to large groups that would not otherwise have the ability to experience a demonstration. We will demonstrate the Waste to Energy process at the host location, from loading the waste, to demonstrating the developed electrical energy.

The  Mobile Demonstration Unit (MDU) is designed as a fully operational  Waste to Energy (WTE) demonstration tool to visually demonstrate the gasification of waste and production of heat and power. 

The MDU operates under the same engineering principles as a full scale waste to energy gasification facility. The WTE Dynamis proprietary process of 'controlled gasification', is a process without flame, utilizing heat to convert municipal solid waste to syngas, primarily methane (natural gas) and other flammable gases 'syngas', then utilizing the syngas in a clean combustion  to steam process making electrical power."

The Dynamis technology uses large Primary gasification chambers to process batches of mixed feedstock sources during each 14 to 16 hour cycle. If it is organic and fits into the chamber, it can be gasified. After the cycle is completed, ash is removed, collected, and can be reused as an additive for concrete. The SynGas produced by the Primary passes onto the Secondary Chamber where it is thoroughly mixed with air and ignited to combust all of the organic carbon based gases prior to exiting the exhaust flue. With the heat generated by the Secondary Chamber, it can produce steam to drive a turbine and generate electricity, or send as Process Steam. It can also be used to heat water and/or drive absorption chillers to make chilled or refrigerated water for other processes. The system is highly modular and expandable from 30 tons per day to 1800 tpd.

 

Of the  many challenges that we found to develope the sale of a Full Scale Waste To Energy facility,the following solutions for are just a few:

  • Challenge: Getting all the necessary decision makers in the same place at the same time.

       Solution:    With the MDU, we can now go to them.

  • Challenge:  Being able to demonstrate the technology in operation. 

       Solution:     With the MDU, it would be like taking a 'test drive'.

  • Challenge:  Making the presentation of the technology understandable. 

       Solution:     With a live demonstration, potential clients get their questions answered on the spot.

With YOUR help, we will lead the world to:

  • Convert trash into clean 'Green Energy'.
  • Clean up and minimize landfill operations.
  • Protect the environment.
  • Save and protect our land, air and waters.
  • Reduce the output of 'Greenhouse Gases'.
  • Produce clean, reliable, renewable power.

With Dynamis we have a  scaleable Waste to Energy solution, and with the Mobile Demonstration Unit as a demonstration tool, we're able to promote full scale Waste to Energy facilities. Our campaign efforts will initially be centered upon Central and South Americas, where urban centers are highly populated, and waste disposal technology is lacking current US standards.   

With the flexibility of moving the MDU from one demonstration site to the next, we are planning 4 different site demonstrations within the first year, and up to 8 demonstrations the second year.  We have the knowledge, the technology and the potential clients; now what we need is your help...Your contributions will help us to make Clean - Green - Renewable -Energy.

 

Our Progress:

We have completed several major steps along  our Campaign/Program path, including the signing of important documents:  

  • 'Independent Agency Agreements' with Dynamis Energy
  • Memorandum of Understanding with the country of Peru.
  • Pre feasibility study questionnaires completed and returned to us for project evaluation from several countries

Now we need to take our program to the next funding level to:

  • Purchase the MDU
  • Fund and train the operators & staff
  • Fund program transportation costs
  • Fund the MDU operation for one full year to ensure success  

We will host live demonstrations of the Dynamis Energy 'Waste to Energy' technology for the:

  • Municipalities
  • Landfill Operators
  • Waste Managers
  • Industrialists
  • Manufacturers

Clients will have full access to our team to assist with their decision to approve of the installation of full scale Waste to Energy facilities. The cities, states and countries will be able to take control of the trash, reduce pollution of air, water and soil, and develop a "true waste management" program.

Our goal is that by the end of the second year of demonstrating with the MDU: 

  • that Dynamis Energy will have several full scale, 250 to 1000 tons per day Waste to Energy facilities under contract
  • that new jobs will have been created by these new facilities
  • that existing landfill employees will have been retrained by the Waste to Energy companies
  • that awareness will have further spread as to the importance of proper Waste Management

After 2 years of demonstrations, BOSS Alliance will be donating to a nonprofit hospital complex within the region, the MDU modified by Dynamis Energy into a fixed location Waste to Energy System for processing site-generated medical and other waste into Clean Energy. 

To select the nonprofit hospital complex, we will publish and send out a 'Request for Qualification'  to the regional hospital complex's and create a ballot with the information from the RFQ. The Starred (Gold Star, Platinum Star and Diamond Star) funding members can then vote the hospital of their choice. The hospital with the highest amount of votes will receive the modified unit. The hospital installation will be within 6 months of issuance of permits. The Starred Contributors will have their names listed on the attached plaque of "Appreciation" from the winning hospital, and also the Starred contributors will be invited to attend that celebration.

Additionally, our Starred funders will have the opportunity to participate as hosted guests at an MDU Demonstration,  or of a full scale Waste to Energy Facility Commissioning  and 3 to7 day vacations, depending on their level of contribution. 

 

With your contributions we will be able to accomplish all the above goals by:

>>>> Our team visits to municipalities developing site demonstrations.

>>>> Introducing  the Dynamis Energy, "Waste to Energy technology" to municipalities, landfill operators, electrical utilities and waste managers.

>>>> Assisting Dynamis to develop full scale Waste to Energy Facilities that:

  • Require No pretreatment of waste
  • Require No presorting  
  • Easily scale to accommodate local and regional growth
  • Are a Modular, proven system design
  • Reduce scarce landfill space
  • Positively impact global warming 
  • Are Environmentally sound and safe
  • Reduce reliance on fossil fuels to produce power  

Our clients will have full access to our team to assist with their decision to approve of the installation of full scale Waste to Energy facilities. The cities, states and countries will be able to take control of the trash, reduce pollution of air, water and soil, and develop a "true waste management" program.

 

What We Need From You

We are asking for $2,476,340 USD for the Mobile Demonstration Unit Campaign/Program.

 

 BUDGET

Dynamis Mobile Demonstration Unit and Program Funding

Equipment                                                       Cost 

Basic Waste Station*                                           685,000

Waste Station Modification & Security            50,000

Demonstration Equipment                                   25,000

Steam Generator________________________475,000                                                  

Equipment Total                                      $1,235,000*

What we offer in return for your generosity:

Aside from a letter of appreciation, our gifts to you will create the opportunity for our contributors to display, wear, or participate in the celebration of the end goal in creating Waste to Energy facilities. Depending on your level of contribution, there are hats, shirts, vacations and  the opportunity to visit and see a demonstration first hand, attend a ribbon cutting ceremony or a donation celebration.* Contributors of all levels will have their names on a letter of recognition. In addition, all contributors will receive a monthly digital newsletter of the Campaign's progress. We're thinking that you'll find your greatest perk is in the knowledge that your contribution has advanced the WTE technology creating "Clean-Green-Renewable-Energy".

Of course, we are also hoping that these gifts will contribute to your spreading the word about what we're doing and how you are helping us with our goals; therefore encouraging others to help us and do what they can, also making this a healthier and cleaner world.  

Not everyone can financially contribute, we understand that, but you can help us by just clicking on the share button; sharing our mission with your family friends and work colleagues. You can find all the quick tools to do this here on the Indiegogo website and also through our media pages on Facebook. We believe that by people helping people we can see each other's dreams and missions come to reality.

(*see below at  Perk Experience & Vacation Management )

Why This Is So Important to Us

This project is of great importance to us and for our children, grandchildren and great grandchildren. We've watched as the population has grown, and waste products along with it. We've seen (and smelled) the landfills everywhere we go. We have suffered the pain of high energy bills, and watched our beautiful oceans, air and streams fill with pollution. We want to help. We want our descendants to have clean air to breathe, clean water to drink, swim or fish in. Our dream is to give them a healthier environment now, so that when the time comes that we aren't around, we can leave this life with the knowledge that we left things a little better for them.

 

The campaign is based upon BOSS Alliance's  Mobile Demonstration program and teaming with Dynamis Energy to create more full scale Waste to Energy facilities around the world. Each facility will generate Green Renewable power, reduce Greenhouse gasses, and help protect our precious waters, air and land.  

We chose the "Flexible Funding" plan because we will be able to live into our mission of assisting in the expansion of a "Better Waste Management Solution". Once we reach 35% or more of the program budget we will be able to place the order & purchase the Mobile Demonstration Unit from Dynamis, and during the design and manufacturing period, pursue additional funding to fulfill our demonstration program.  

 

Once again we invite everyone that is concerned about the future of our Mother Earth to get involved by "helping us help the world", now is the time, let's not wait until it's too late. Working together we can make a difference. You will have the opportunity to witness the results of your contribution, whether it be funding or sharing our mission. You will be able to  see the future of proper waste management programs; 

  • from waste pickup 
  • to waste recycling
  • to the conversion waste to energy

 

DYNAMIS ENERGY 

Full Scale Facility

Frequently Asked Questions:
 

What is Waste to Energy?

Waste to energy is a process where facilities use waste in order to create power or electricity. The national focus on developing renewable energy sources has resulted in increased interest in developing waste to energy facilities.

 What happens to my garbage at a waste  to energy facility?

After your hauler picks up your garbage, the hauler delivers it to a waste-to-energy facility where it is fed directly into gasification chambers and used to create electricity or steam. Emissions are carefully controlled and monitored to limit air pollution. Ash from the combustion of the garbage is managed in a landfill. Only 5% of the volume of your original garbage becomes ash, the rest becomes energy.

What are the environmental benefits of Waste to Energy?

  • A source of renewable energy
  • Reduces greenhouse gas emissions
  • Supports recycling
  • Keeps our waters clean

 What are some other advantages and benefits of Waste to Energy?

  • Removing and recycling materials from trash that were not separated at the home or business.
  • Our 3.0 technology processes the trash to make is non-hazardous, non-infectious and less harmful to humans and the environment.
  • Reducing the volume of the waste requiring final disposal, if any, thereby reducing the amount of land needed for landfills.                                                                                                                                        

How does Waste to Energy reduce greenhouse gases?

 ​When solid waste decomposes, it creates methane which is 20 times more potent than Co2 in    terms of its impact on greenhouse gas production and global warming. Our waste to energy    facilities eliminate that production of methane and destroys virtually all CO2 thereby reducing  the emission of greenhouse gases substantially.

How does burning garbage in a waste to energy facility compare to using a burn barrel?

To begin with, the Dynamis 3.0 technology, does not technically burn garbage, it is combusted through a proprietary process of controlled gasification without flame. Burn barrels or open pit burning do so at low temperatures and are extremely polluting. Burning waste is estimated to be the largest source of dioxins, a very toxic and carcinogenic group of pollutants. Just one family using a backyard burn barrel will emit more dioxins per year than a 200 ton per day waste to energy facility.  Our facilities are well below all jurisdictions limits on dioxin emissions.

Do waste to energy facilities adversely affect recycling rates?

Concerns have been expressed about the impact of waste-to-energy facilities on recycling rates—that waste to energy acts as a disincentive to recycling. European countries and US communities that rely heavily on waste-to-energy to manage solid waste also have higher recycling rates than those communities without waste to energy facilities. In fact, communities with waste-to-energy facilities have an average recycling rate of 33% as compared with the national average of 28%.

Are waste-to-energy facilities significant generators of greenhouse gases? 

Dynamis 3.0 technology waste-to-energy facilities provide a much lower carbon alternative to landfills. Decomposition of solid waste in landfills produces methane, a greenhouse gas that is over 20 times more effective in trapping heat in the atmosphere than an equivalent amount of carbon dioxide. Waste-to-energy facilities produce no methane and overall lower carbon dioxide emissions per ton of waste disposed or combusted than landfills. However, the level of carbon benefit is affected by the distance the solid waste is transported and the mode of transportation that is utilized. Waste-to- energy facilities also recover ferrous and non-ferrous metals that are not ordinarily recovered by residential curbside recycling programs. Recovery and reuse of these materials can save on average 75 percent of the energy needed to produce the same amount of virgin steel.

 

What will be done to monitor and control the odors at the facility?

  • Traffic patterns for trucks entering and exiting the facility will be identical to the current traffic pattern because the facility is to be located at the landfill site.
  • Automated doors will be installed at the facility, minimizing the length of time the doors are open.
  • The facility will have negative air pressure. Fans pull air from the facility, helping to keep odors inside the facility. 
  • Roadways will be swept and kept clean of debris from trucks.

 

Are waste-to-energy facilities safe for the environment?

Yes. 'Waste-to-energy facilities produce electricity with ―less environmental impact than almost any other source of electricity,' according to the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency.' ―EPA recognizes the vital role of the nation’s municipal waste-to-energy industry,' wrote former EPA Administrator Marianne Lamont Horinko, and Assistant Administrator for the Office of Air and Radiation, Jeffrey Holmstead. Waste-to-energy facilities are a '―clean, reliable, renewable source of energy.'

Waste-to-energy technology prevents the emission of eleven million metric tons of greenhouse gases (methane and carbon dioxide) that would otherwise be released into the atmosphere on   an annual basis. In addition, waste-to-energy serves as an alternative to land disposal and   power generation from fossil fuels, which prevents the release of more than 20,000 tons of nitrogen oxides and 2.2 million tons of volatile organic compounds.

 

Why have so few new waste-to-energy plants been built in the last ten years?

Waste-to-energy facilities rely on revenue from waste disposal and energy sales. Over the past ten years, the price of land disposal has been low, providing stiff competition. In addition, the price of electricity had also been low. But times are changing. The high cost of electricity, combined with the elevated fuel costs of hauling trash to distant landfills has communities considering waste-to-energy once again. In addition, there has been a renewed focus on the environmental issues as well as developing renewable energy sources.

 

Is waste-to-energy a renewable energy source?

Yes. Waste-to-energy is renewable because its main fuel source---garbage---is sustainable and non-depletable.  According to the U.S. EPA, waste-to-energy is a ―clean, reliable, renewable source of energy.‖ In addition, the Energy Policy Act of 2005, the Federal Power Act, the Public Utility Regulatory Policies Act, the Biomass Research and Development Act of 2000, the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission’s regulations, and fifteen states all recognize waste-to-energy power as renewable.

 

Is the ash from waste-to-energy plants safe?

Yes, ash residue from waste-to-energy facilities is tested in accordance with strict state and federal leaching tests and is consistently shown to be safe for land disposal and reuse. Waste-to-energy reduces the volume of trash by about 90%, resulting in a 90% decrease in the amount of land required for garbage disposal. Ash also exhibits concrete-like properties causing it to harden once it is placed and compacted in a landfill, reducing the potential for rainwater to leach contaminants from ash landfills into the ground.  It also has beneficial use in concrete plants, can be used to build roads, or concrete blocks for building or landscaping.

 

What is Dynamis 3.0 technology and gasification?

Our state of the art 3.0 technology of gasification is a process that converts carbonaceous materials, such as coal, biomass, or municipal solid waste (garbage) into carbon monoxide and hydrogen by reacting the raw material at high temperatures with a controlled amount of oxygen. The resulting gas mixture is called synthesis gas or syngas and is itself a fuel.

Gasification is a very efficient method for extracting energy from many different types of organic materials, and also has applications as a clean waste disposal technique. The advantage of gasification is that using the syngas is more efficient than direct combustion of the original fuel; more of the energy contained in the fuel is extracted. Gasification of fossil fuels is currently widely used on industrial scales to generate electricity. However, almost any type of organic material can be used as the raw material for gasification, such as wood, biomass, or even plastic waste. Thus, gasification is an important technology for renewable energy. Of particular importance is the fact that biomass gasification is carbon neutral.

 

What are the Dynamis 3.0 technology gasifications main advantages?

Gasification is one of the cleanest power systems available today. There are four main advantages or benefits of gasification technology.

Feedstock flexibility – Gasification can produce syngas not only from garbage having a wide range of heat values but also from other feedstocks such as petroleum coke, high-sulfur fuel oil,municipal waste,biomass, tires, medical waste and coal etc. This flexibility the economic value of these resources and lowers costs by providing industry with a broader range of feedstock options.

​Product flexibility -  The syngas produced by gasification in our plant will be converted into steam and electricity but there are many other valuable products, ranging from liquid fuels, basic chemicals, and hydrogen.Integration of multiple gasification products  into industrial applications increases opportunities for added revenues since plant operations can focus on the most lucrative products, provides economies of scale associated with production of multiple commodities and increases opportunities for added revenues.

 Near - zero emissions - Gasification systems can meet the strictest environmental regulations pertaining to emissions of sulfur dioxide (SO2), particulate matter, and toxic compounds. 

 

High efficiency - Gasification can be integrated with other technologies for advanced power generation, particularly combustion turbines. The resulting system are highly efficient, squeezing more value from each pound of feedstock. Systems using advances in gasification and related components can achieve efficiencies up to 60 percent, compared with an efficiency limit of 40 percent for conventional plants.  

                

   

Campaign Risks & Challenges

While we are doing most of the of the work ourselves, there may be unforeseen issues that are out of our control, such as  customs, permitting, shipping , adverse weather, and acts of God. Our team and local "Boots On The Ground" agents are experienced and well qualified in what it takes to keep things moving forward.  We feel confident in our team partner Dynamis Energy's ability to deliver the Mobile Demonstration Unit on time. We will do our best to maintain our schedules and fulfill our goals. With our monthly newsletter, we will  keep you informed of our progress .

*Perk Experience & Vacation Management

 Golf packages are managed by Golf There and supporters will have the opportunity to work with them in creating a Golf experience of their personal tastes and needs.

 Vacation Resort packages are managed by our travel agents and supporters will have the opportunity to work with them in creating an experience of their personal taste and needs. 

 

This Mobile Demonstration  campaign will help make a difference in the way trash will be be properly managed and utilized as "Green - Renewable - Energy" . We believe that it will also lead to new jobs in the industry. We're excited and committed to making this happen, and we hope that after viewing & reading what we had to say, you will be too!                                                

For additional information or concerns contact:

Gene Sawyer at gene.s@bossaliance.co    

visit our webb site at www.bossalliance.co

Follow us at:

Facebook

story_txt:
In our travels we have witnessed whole families working in landfills, dump sites, and trash heaps, salvaging what they deemed of value, just to survive; exposing themselves to harmful elements, and therefore, endangering their health and safety. With our units, we hope to eliminate that danger by creating a cleaner, healthier environment for all of us; and in doing so, create jobs so fewer people will need to resort to such a way of life.
 
Hello, I’m Gene Sawyer, the CEO & President of BOSS Alliance LLC. which is an energy solutions partner with Dynamis Energy. Since 2012, we have explored and found ways to convert trash, primarily municipal solid waste (MSW), to energy (electricity & heat); therefore reducing environmental, economic, and social landfill disposal issues. 
BOSS Alliance has vetted  many Waste to Energy companies that claimed they had "the" solution for Waste to Energy. After visiting Dynamis Energy’s corporate offices and test site, we were accepted as a team partner. As an Independent Agent, we represent the Dynamis Energy technology. The last 4 years we’ve introduced and promoted the Dynamis Energy Waste to Energy technology domestically, and to several other countries. We have faced many challenges in the Waste to Energy development program, and one of the biggest has been in being able to show interested parties a “Live Demonstration” of the Waste to Energy technology in operation, without our clients traveling to the Dynamis test facility in Idaho. Dynamis Energy has agreed that, with a successful campaign funding program, they will modify the "Waste Station", and build for us a Mobile Demonstration Unit. 
With the MDU, we will be able to demonstrate the complete waste to energy process to large groups that would not otherwise have the ability to experience a demonstration. We will demonstrate the Waste to Energy process at the host location, from loading the waste, to demonstrating the developed electrical energy.
The  Mobile Demonstration Unit (MDU) is designed as a fully operational  Waste to Energy (WTE) demonstration tool to visually demonstrate the gasification of waste and production of heat and power. 
The MDU operates under the same engineering principles as a full scale waste to energy gasification facility. The WTE Dynamis proprietary process of 'controlled gasification', is a process without flame, utilizing heat to convert municipal solid waste to syngas, primarily methane (natural gas) and other flammable gases 'syngas', then utilizing the syngas in a clean combustion  to steam process making electrical power."
The Dynamis technology uses large Primary gasification chambers to process batches of mixed feedstock sources during each 14 to 16 hour cycle. If it is organic and fits into the chamber, it can be gasified. After the cycle is completed, ash is removed, collected, and can be reused as an additive for concrete. The SynGas produced by the Primary passes onto the Secondary Chamber where it is thoroughly mixed with air and ignited to combust all of the organic carbon based gases prior to exiting the exhaust flue. With the heat generated by the Secondary Chamber, it can produce steam to drive a turbine and generate electricity, or send as Process Steam. It can also be used to heat water and/or drive absorption chillers to make chilled or refrigerated water for other processes. The system is highly modular and expandable from 30 tons per day to 1800 tpd.
 
Of the  many challenges that we found to develope the sale of a Full Scale Waste To Energy facility,the following solutions for are just a few:

Challenge: Getting all the necessary decision makers in the same place at the same time.
       Solution:    With the MDU, we can now go to them.

Challenge:  Being able to demonstrate the technology in operation. 
       Solution:     With the MDU, it would be like taking a 'test drive'.

Challenge:  Making the presentation of the technology understandable. 
       Solution:     With a live demonstration, potential clients get their questions answered on the spot.
With YOUR help, we will lead the world to:

Convert trash into clean 'Green Energy'.
Clean up and minimize landfill operations.
Protect the environment.
Save and protect our land, air and waters.
Reduce the output of 'Greenhouse Gases'.
Produce clean, reliable, renewable power.

With Dynamis we have a  scaleable Waste to Energy solution, and with the Mobile Demonstration Unit as a demonstration tool, we're able to promote full scale Waste to Energy facilities. Our campaign efforts will initially be centered upon Central and South Americas, where urban centers are highly populated, and waste disposal technology is lacking current US standards.   
With the flexibility of moving the MDU from one demonstration site to the next, we are planning 4 different site demonstrations within the first year, and up to 8 demonstrations the second year.  We have the knowledge, the technology and the potential clients; now what we need is your help...Your contributions will help us to make Clean - Green - Renewable -Energy.
 
Our Progress:
We have completed several major steps along  our Campaign/Program path, including the signing of important documents:  

'Independent Agency Agreements' with Dynamis Energy
Memorandum of Understanding with the country of Peru.
Pre feasibility study questionnaires completed and returned to us for project evaluation from several countries

Now we need to take our program to the next funding level to:

Purchase the MDU
Fund and train the operators & staff
Fund program transportation costs
Fund the MDU operation for one full year to ensure success  

We will host live demonstrations of the Dynamis Energy 'Waste to Energy' technology for the:

Municipalities
Landfill Operators
Waste Managers
Industrialists
Manufacturers

Clients will have full access to our team to assist with their decision to approve of the installation of full scale Waste to Energy facilities. The cities, states and countries will be able to take control of the trash, reduce pollution of air, water and soil, and develop a "true waste management" program.
Our goal is that by the end of the second year of demonstrating with the MDU: 

that Dynamis Energy will have several full scale, 250 to 1000 tons per day Waste to Energy facilities under contract
that new jobs will have been created by these new facilities
that existing landfill employees will have been retrained by the Waste to Energy companies
that awareness will have further spread as to the importance of proper Waste Management

After 2 years of demonstrations, BOSS Alliance will be donating to a nonprofit hospital complex within the region, the MDU modified by Dynamis Energy into a fixed location Waste to Energy System for processing site-generated medical and other waste into Clean Energy. 
To select the nonprofit hospital complex, we will publish and send out a 'Request for Qualification'  to the regional hospital complex's and create a ballot with the information from the RFQ. The Starred (Gold Star, Platinum Star and Diamond Star) funding members can then vote the hospital of their choice. The hospital with the highest amount of votes will receive the modified unit. The hospital installation will be within 6 months of issuance of permits. The Starred Contributors will have their names listed on the attached plaque of "Appreciation" from the winning hospital, and also the Starred contributors will be invited to attend that celebration.
Additionally, our Starred funders will have the opportunity to participate as hosted guests at an MDU Demonstration,  or of a full scale Waste to Energy Facility Commissioning  and 3 to7 day vacations, depending on their level of contribution. 
 
With your contributions we will be able to accomplish all the above goals by:
>>>> Our team visits to municipalities developing site demonstrations.
>>>> Introducing  the Dynamis Energy, "Waste to Energy technology" to municipalities, landfill operators, electrical utilities and waste managers.
>>>> Assisting Dynamis to develop full scale Waste to Energy Facilities that:

Require No pretreatment of waste
Require No presorting  
Easily scale to accommodate local and regional growth
Are a Modular, proven system design
Reduce scarce landfill space
Positively impact global warming 
Are Environmentally sound and safe
Reduce reliance on fossil fuels to produce power  

Our clients will have full access to our team to assist with their decision to approve of the installation of full scale Waste to Energy facilities. The cities, states and countries will be able to take control of the trash, reduce pollution of air, water and soil, and develop a "true waste management" program.

Burn barrels or open pit burning do so at low temperatures and are extremely polluting. Burning waste is estimated to be the largest source of dioxins, a very toxic and carcinogenic group of pollutants. Just one family using a backyard burn barrel will emit more dioxins per year than a 200 ton per day waste to energy facility.  Our facilities are well below all jurisdictions limits on dioxin emissions.
Do waste to energy facilities adversely affect recycling rates? 
Concerns have been expressed about the impact of waste-to-energy facilities on recycling rates—that waste to energy acts as a disincentive to recycling. European countries and US communities that rely heavily on waste-to-energy to manage solid waste also have higher recycling rates than those communities without waste to energy facilities. In fact, communities with waste-to-energy facilities have an average recycling rate of 33% as compared with the national average of 28%.


Are waste-to-energy facilities significant generators of greenhouse gases? 
Dynamis 3.0 technology waste-to-energy facilities provide a much lower carbon alternative to landfills. Decomposition of solid waste in landfills produces methane, a greenhouse gas that is over 20 times more effective in trapping heat in the atmosphere than an equivalent amount of carbon dioxide. Waste-to-energy facilities produce no methane and overall lower carbon dioxide emissions per ton of waste disposed or combusted than landfills. However, the level of carbon benefit is affected by the distance the solid waste is transported and the mode of transportation that is utilized. Waste-to- energy facilities also recover ferrous and non-ferrous metals that are not ordinarily recovered by residential curbside recycling programs. Recovery and reuse of these materials can save on average 75 percent of the energy needed to produce the same amount of virgin steel.
 
What will be done to monitor and control the odors at the facility?

Traffic patterns for trucks entering and exiting the facility will be identical to the current traffic pattern because the facility is to be located at the landfill site.
Automated doors will be installed at the facility, minimizing the length of time the doors are open.
The facility will have negative air pressure. Fans pull air from the facility, helping to keep odors inside the facility. 
Roadways will be swept and kept clean of debris from trucks.

 
Are waste-to-energy facilities safe for the environment?
Yes. 'Waste-to-energy facilities produce electricity with ―less environmental impact than almost any other source of electricity,' according to the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency.' ―EPA recognizes the vital role of the nation’s municipal waste-to-energy industry,' wrote former EPA Administrator Marianne Lamont Horinko, and Assistant Administrator for the Office of Air and Radiation, Jeffrey Holmstead. Waste-to-energy facilities are a '―clean, reliable, renewable source of energy.'
Waste-to-energy technology prevents the emission of eleven million metric tons of greenhouse gases (methane and carbon dioxide) that would otherwise be released into the atmosphere on   an annual basis. In addition, waste-to-energy serves as an alternative to land disposal and   power generation from fossil fuels, which prevents the release of more than 20,000 tons of nitrogen oxides and 2.2 million tons of volatile organic compounds.
 
Why have so few new waste-to-energy plants been built in the last ten years?
Waste-to-energy facilities rely on revenue from waste disposal and energy sales. Over the past ten years, the price of land disposal has been low, providing stiff competition. In addition, the price of electricity had also been low. But times are changing. The high cost of electricity, combined with the elevated fuel costs of hauling trash to distant landfills has communities considering waste-to-energy once again. In addition, there has been a renewed focus on the environmental issues as well as developing renewable energy sources.
 
Is waste-to-energy a renewable energy source?
Yes. Waste-to-energy is renewable because its main fuel source---garbage---is sustainable and non-depletable.  According to the U.S. EPA, waste-to-energy is a ―clean, reliable, renewable source of energy.‖ In addition, the Energy Policy Act of 2005, the Federal Power Act, the Public Utility Regulatory Policies Act, the Biomass Research and Development Act of 2000, the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission’s regulations, and fifteen states all recognize waste-to-energy power as renewable.
 Is the ash from waste-to-energy plants safe?
Yes, ash residue from waste-to-energy facilities is tested in accordance with strict state and federal leaching tests and is consistently shown to be safe for land disposal and reuse. Waste-to-energy reduces the volume of trash by about 90%, resulting in a 90% decrease in the amount of land required for garbage disposal. Ash also exhibits concrete-like properties causing it to harden once it is placed and compacted in a landfill, reducing the potential for rainwater to leach contaminants from ash landfills into the ground.  It also has beneficial use in concrete plants, can be used to build roads, or concrete blocks for building or landscaping.
 
What is Dynamis 3.0 technology and gasification?
Our state of the art 3.0 technology of gasification is a process that converts carbonaceous materials, such as coal, biomass, or municipal solid waste (garbage) into carbon monoxide and hydrogen by reacting the raw material at high temperatures with a controlled amount of oxygen. The resulting gas mixture is called synthesis gas or syngas and is itself a fuel.
Gasification is a very efficient method for extracting energy from many different types of organic materials, and also has applications as a clean waste disposal technique. The advantage of gasification is that using the syngas is more efficient than direct combustion of the original fuel; more of the energy contained in the fuel is extracted. Gasification of fossil fuels is currently widely used on industrial scales to generate electricity. However, almost any type of organic material can be used as the raw material for gasification, such as wood, biomass, or even plastic waste. Thus, gasification is an important technology for renewable energy. Of particular importance is the fact that biomass gasification is carbon neutral.
 
What are the Dynamis 3.0 technology gasifications main advantages?
Gasification is one of the cleanest power systems available today. There are four main advantages or benefits of gasification technology.
Feedstock flexibility – Gasification can produce syngas not only from garbage having a wide range of heat values but also from other feedstocks such as petroleum coke, high-sulfur fuel oil,municipal waste,biomass, tires, medical waste and coal etc. This flexibility the economic value of these resources and lowers costs by providing industry with a broader range of feedstock options.
​Product flexibility -  The syngas produced by gasification in our plant will be converted into steam and electricity but there are many other valuable products, ranging from liquid fuels, basic chemicals, and hydrogen.Integration of multiple gasification products  into industrial applications increases opportunities for added revenues since plant operations can focus on the most lucrative products, provides economies of scale associated with production of multiple commodities and increases opportunities for added revenues.
 Near - zero emissions - Gasification systems can meet the strictest environmental regulations pertaining to emissions of sulfur dioxide (SO2), particulate matter, and toxic compounds. 
 
High efficiency - Gasification can be integrated with other technologies for advanced power generation, particularly combustion turbines. The resulting system are highly efficient, squeezing more value from each pound of feedstock. Systems using advances in gasification and related components can achieve efficiencies up to 60 percent, compared with an efficiency limit of 40 percent for conventional plants.  
                
   
Campaign Risks & Challenges

While we are doing most of the of the work ourselves, there may be unforeseen issues that are out of our control, such as  customs, permitting, shipping , adverse weather, and acts of God. Our team and local "Boots On The Ground" agents are experienced and well qualified in what it takes to keep things moving forward.  We feel confident in our team partner Dynamis Energy's ability to deliver the Mobile Demonstration Unit on time. We will do our best to maintain our schedules and fulfill our goals. With our monthly newsletter, we will  keep you informed of our progress .
*Perk Experience & Vacation Management
 Golf packages are managed by Golf There and supporters will have the opportunity to work with them in creating a Golf experience of their personal tastes and needs.
 Vacation Resort packages are managed by our travel agents and supporters will have the opportunity to work with them in creating an experience of their personal taste and needs. 
 
This Mobile Demonstration  campaign will help make a difference in the way trash will be be properly managed and utilized as "Green - Renewable - Energy" . We believe that it will also lead to new jobs in the industry. We're excited and committed to making this happen, and we hope that after viewing & reading what we had to say, you will be too!                                                
For additional information or concerns contact:Gene Sawyer at gene.s@bossaliance.co    visit our webb site at www.bossalliance.coFollow us at:Facebook  Twitter

story:
Introducing AVGO CalciuMate: Calcium carbonate without the Carbon footprint

Inspiration

Eggs are used in the food processing industry to make boiled eggs, mayonnaise, cakes, breads, pastries and a variety of foods that we consume every day. But after the eggs are cracked, the eggshells are usually discarded and landfilled as they are not considered very useful.

In the UK alone, 15,000 tonnes of eggshells from the food processing industry are discarded every year. These discarded eggshells lead to the generation of more than 63,000 tonnes of Greenhouse Gases that contribute to Global Warming.

In a different place, thousands of tonnes of Greenhouse gases are produced by mining the limited reserves of Calcium carbonate out of the ground. This Calcium carbonate is used in everything from your favourite ice-cream to the antacid you use every day. Even after purification, this Calcium carbonate retains traces of toxic heavy metals such as Lead, Mercury, Arsenic and Cadmium that can be very harmful if consumed regularly.

Looking at these inter-dependent problems, we realised that we are dumping the same resource which we mined just because we cannot purify it. That is when we came up with an idea that could help solve both and thus AVGO Biotech was born.

We asked a simple question: Can we extract Calcium carbonate from eggshells that is so pure that it can be used in the Food and Pharmaceutical Industries?

 

Our Idea

Eggshells are made up of more than 95% Calcium carbonate. This has been known for centuries as crushed eggshells are routinely used in fertilizers to improve the Calcium availability for plants. But we wanted to take it one step further. We wanted to take waste eggshells and upcycle them to make a high value product.

This is where our innovative Rec-egg engine comes into picture. Rec-egg is a unique process that takes waste eggshells directly from the industry and converts them to pure Calcium carbonate. Our process ensures that our product in not only at par with the industry standard Calcium carbonate but also free of heavy metals that are often found in mined Calcium carbonate.

The best part? Not only do we avoid ecological degradation from landfilling and mining but we also minimize the waste from our own process. Almost all the reagents of the Rec-egg process are regenerated and reused in subsequent batches so that nothing is wasted or discarded from each batch.

AVGO CalciuMate passes all the E170 as well as BP/USP specifications for Calcium carbonate and can be safely used in foods, supplements, as well as pharmaceuticals. Not only that, it also passes the ICH Q3D specifications on heavy metals as it does not contain any detectable toxic heavy metals generally found in mined Calcium carbonate.

 

Our Impact

We want to create a web of positive impact that includes food processors, food and pharmaceutical companies, and most importantly the environment.

Egg processing companies spend thousands of pounds a year to transport and dispose waste eggshells in landfills. We aim to make those costs obsolete by processing the discarded eggshells on-site.

Food and Pharmaceutical companies face the challenge of importing their Calcium carbonate from overseas and having residual toxic heavy metals in their raw materials. Our product will be locally produced and free from any contaminants.

Finally, our product would not only alleviate the ecological degradation from dumping eggshells in landfills, but also decrease the reliance on mined Calcium carbonate which is a non-renewable resource.

Each tonne of eggshells upcycled to produce AVGO CalciuMate, prevents more than 4.5 tonnes of Greenhouse Gases from being released into the atmosphere. If we achieve our goal of commercially producing AVGO CalciuMate, it would mean we can prevent the release of over 70,000 tonnes of Greenhouse Gases every year.

 

Why we need your help

From the inception of AVGO, we have been supported by organizations such as InnovateUK and BBSRC FoodWasteNet. We have received a commendation in the Rushlight Awards 2019-20 and we recently won ‘Taming the Dragons VIII’ pitch event run by the Lincolnshire Investment Network.

Till now, we have been successful in defending our proof of concept as well as our business plan but we still need your help. We need funding to take our novel process from the lab and establish it in the real world where it can make a difference.

We are looking for funds to protect our Intellectual Property through a process patent and to set up a prototype upcycling factory where we can prove our process at a larger scale. This will help us demonstrate our process at a market scale so that we can start a small change that will go a long way.

What we offer you

Since we neither make a product or service that is targeted towards the consumer, our perks are also a little different.

Take a look at our memento glass vial full of our own creation, pure Calcium carbonate that has been upcycled from eggshells that would otherwise be landfilled. Also check out our branded products that serve as tokens of our appreciation for your valuable contribution.

Each little contribution counts and we are looking to you to help us fund our idea and make a genuine environmental impact.

 

Before you go!

We understand that this year has been tough on everyone, especially for people trying to succeed at something new. We also understand that it may not be possible for everyone to donate. To people who understand and support our vision but are unable to currently help us by donating, there is still a way you can help. Please share our campaign on your social media or maybe like our social media page, every little thing counts towards us taking a step forward. Thank you!

story:
Short Summary 

Communities for Change (C4C) is a 7 week  innovative programme designed by the Prescensing Institute to challenge the way leaders and citizens think and present a new theoretical  approach to addressing social problems. The Communities for Change program offers citizens the opportunity to go through the Theory U course which helps to reflect on self, challenges facing society and how a collective approach can bring about social change. Impact Hub Harare has chosen to use this approach to tackle the challenge of affordable, sustainable energy in Zimbabwe.

In this respect the members of C4C chose to adopt  a Bio-gas prototype as a solution to energy problems inherent in most parts of Zimbabwe. Our resources have not been used to their fullest potential leading to  insufficient sourcing of electricity, poor management of waste and unclean cities.

Promoting Green Energy does not only have environmentally positive effect, it also promotes job creation and grows economic benefits of a country. Increasingly, countries such as Zimbabwe have recognized the need to divert from climate and environmentally damaging sources of energy such as coal and wood to more sustainable affordable clean sources. Zimbabwe relies heavily on hydroelectric power which is insufficient considering increasing demand. In rural areas about 80- 90 % of people depend on wood fuel and kerosene for cooking and lighting. Coal has also been one of the main sources of power; the increased use of pollutant forces is damaging to the climate and health of those in the community in which it is mined.

In light of this glaring need, the C4C participants are seeking support in order to launch their prototype that they have come up with in their target area to the tune of $ 3000. After testing and validation the team will then reproduce 4 more digestors to make a total of 5 bio-gas digestors. Below is a breakdown of the cost of making a single unit:

  • Steel Drum - $60
  • 2 Plate Stove - $40
  • Poly pipes - $15
  • Connectors - $10
  • Gym Ball 75cm  (To use as excess gas container) - $60
  • Transport and Logistics - $200
  • Expert Consultation - $150
  • Testing and Validation - $100
  • Community Outreach Expenses - $85

story:
Patent Pending:

We have developed a sustainable solution that collects and processes plastic and waste. We plan to bring our advanced Plasma Enhanced Melter® (PEM) technology to the world’s ocean plastic problem.

Our factory ships will go directly to the heart of the problem, operating in the world’s oceans, river mouths and estuaries; producing valuable synthetic gas from the waste collected, this will be utilised to fuel the boat making it a fully sustainable project.

As prevention and mitigation of the ocean's plastic problem go hand in hand, we have also developed a land based system. This will afford visionary governments and organisations a sustainable, environmentally friendly technology to recycle their by-products and waste into valuable energy and resources such as synthetic gas, liquid fuels and solid aggregates.

Delivered by an expert team, the Ocean Polymers Project offers a unique solution to the environmental crisis we face, that is not only commercially viable but highly profitable. 

Taking a holistic approach our model at Ocean Polymers is the only sustainable solution that addresses the 3 pillars of plastic and waste mismanagement and its subsequent pollution and damage in our oceans.

Our three pronged approach:

•Ocean

      Remove and revalue existing waste in the world’s oceans

•River

      Stop waste at river mouths and estuaries before entering the ocean

•Land

      Sustainable land based systems to transform waste into a valuable resource

The benefits of this scheme are multiple, not only will we remove plastics and thus reduce the devastating impact they are having on our oceans and marine life but also revalue and utilise our plastic and waste as a valuable resource. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are at the stage of raising our profile and funding:

  • To date we have secured £1.3m of investment to get us operational and enable retention of our core team and ongoing R & D work
  • We are aiming for a further £700,000, by the issuance of ordinary shares,  to aid us to the next milestone of getting OP1 in the water

For UK investors, with our EIS (Enterprise Investment Scheme) status, supporting our solution to the plastic problem we have all created, offers valuable Income Tax and Capital Gains Tax reliefs to you as an investor.

With your support we can be part of the solution together.

The Impact

Supporting the Ocean Polymers project is investing in a sustainable future.

Our Mission is to provide a sustainable solution to the removal and processing of ocean waste. We also want to give individuals, companies and governments the technology to turn waste into a valuable resource, enable sustainable communities and circular economies. With our systems we avoid the need for landfill and burning of waste thus preserving our planet.

Our Vision is to inspire and create change to preserve our ocean planet for its inhabitants and future generations by transforming our relationship with plastic and how we manage waste.

Risks & Challenges

The main risk we face is not getting the alignment with a significant name (Unilver, Pepsico, SKY, Shell etc) to assist the raising of our profile and funds.

Our biggest challenge and in turn risk currently, is not raising the remaining £700,000 of funding to get our project to the next stage and the solution into action.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone has funds available for investment and we are so appreciative of any and all support of our work, whether that is sharing our social media, suggesting any potential partners or investors or asking questions to better understand what we do, it is all appreciated as they only way we will rectify this  mess, is together.

story:
SolarBoss: Off-Grid Solar Power can give so much more

Use 5 Times the power!

Put your solar to work and use every Watt.

 

We all want modern conveniences: air con, pool, dishwasher, well pump, water heater, washing machine, electric kettle, coffee maker. Then there’s the iron, hairdryer, straighteners and don’t forget the microwave, toaster and coffee maker. What if you live off the grid? You can still have all the appliances, you just need a helping hand.

One little box to control them all

Having solar power is great. Often, though, it’s a problem to use all that free energy. Switching things on and off, remembering to spread the load and keeping a constant eye on the weather and the state of the batteries can be laborious and prone to errors.

Here is the answer: Meet SolarBoss.

SolarBoss switches your electrical devices according to the available sun and the charge of your batteries. Many things don’t need to happen at an exact time of day, some do. SolarBoss makes instant decisions to give you maximum ‘on-time’ for your appliances.

Smart Switches are a product of the Smart Home revolution. They switch your appliances using WiFi and can be automatically or manually controlled. You can have many more modern appliances that you probably thought possible on solar power. Air con, pool and well pumps and water heaters can be stopped while more immediate needs like coffee and microwave are needed and then restarted when the power is ready again. All without needing to plan or rush around switching things.

Sockets and wired adapters

The smart adapters can just plug in between plug and socket or they can be wired in as a permanent fitting.

You can see what’s happening and take control with your smartphone or computer and get lots of information on how your solar power has been used.

The Smart sockets not only switch things, they also know how much power is being used at any instant. Want to know when the washing cycle has finished? Want to plug in the iron or use that fancy new coffee machine? No problem!

How much of your solar power gets used?

Based on a fairly typical home installation of 3500 watts of solar panels, 700 Ah of batteries and  a daily load of 3 kWh here’s the lost energy…

Hope you find that surprising. You could be using 5 times the energy that you use now. This house could use 15 kWh per day. That’s where the power for the air-conditioning, dishwasher, pool heating and more comes from. The missing piece is ‘Control’. SolarBoss ensures that you get the absolute maximum out of your solar investment. (You can follow the web link above the graph and calculate your own. It’s a respected site from the European Commission.)

Our Early Users Love it.

John: “We have a pretty typical solar setup. 3000 watts of panels and a 3KW inverter. We always had to be careful to check what was already on before we turned anything else on. This gadget just makes it all automatic and works unseen until you forget it’s there. Setting up was easy, even for a technical duffer like me and the company have been really helpful in explain things. Can’t imagine how we used to cope without it.”

Paul: “I never thought that we could consider Air Conditioning on solar power. Now we can be cool in summer and warm in winter. The cooler / heater takes about 900 Watts and comes on and off automatically, using power that would have been wasted. When we put the washing machine on, the air con stops for about 20 minutes as the water heats up and then carries on. It’s magic! We used to start the generator to do the washing, no more! and air con too. Very happy with this as we thought we needed to upgrade our power system to add more stuff. It has saved it’s cost many times over and is completely automatic.”

Karen: “Every day used to be a juggling act. Turn things off before turning others on and forgetting to turn the others back on. We used time switches for some things but you still have to remember what’s on and keep checking the sun hasn’t gone in. Now everything just happens and I don’t need to care. We are planning on getting a dishwasher – luxury. We will run it in the afternoon when the most sun is available and not much else is happening, can’t wait.”

Reviews

We are getting the word out and receiving really positive feedback.

What’s in SolarBoss?

The centre of SolarBoss is a small unit that clips onto your solar battery. It uses hardly any power and measures the battery voltage continuously. It knows when your battery is charging in the mornings and keeps the loads lower till the batteries are topped-up. You can still put the coffee on and microwave breakfast etc but the air con and pool will wait. If the sun goes in and the batteries are starting to drain then SolarBoss reduces the loads. The main unit has a clip to go on your ‘mains’ power cable, just like an energy monitor. This tells SolarBoss how much overall power is being used and prevents your inverter being overloaded. From this, and the battery voltage, SolarBoss knows how much extra power can be used.

SolarBoss uses WiFi. If you have WiFi installed then SolarBoss connects to it and the Smart Switches too. It can also be accessed (with security of course) over the Internet so you can keep an eye on things, and be told if there is a problem from anywhere.  If you don’t have WiFi, SolarBoss can provide its own so that the Smart Switches can talk to it and for your smartphone access too. You won’t get Internet through it though!

Installation:

Just unpack and mount the main unit next to your inverter. Clip the ‘mains’ sensor onto the power cable where it leaves the inverter. Clip the power cables to the battery connections, at the inverter if more convenient and the unit will start up and show a steady light until it’s ready. When it flashes slowly it’s asking to be configured by your smartphone or computer. You can connect to the device and go through the simple setup wizard. Next, plug in the smart sockets and they will automatically set themselves up. When each socket is ready it will blink the LED and appear on the web screen to let you know.

From then till Now: 

It has been an interesting journey over more than 3 years. We investigated a number of technologies and discarded them when better alternatives arose. We wanted to use ‘standard’ hardware wherever possible and found a variant of the hugely popular Raspberry Pi to suit us perfectly. This tiny computer board has lots of power, WiFi and all the interfaces we needed. It also has unmatched software support and we could be confident that the modules we needed were well proven and reliable. We have designed a second board to handle the power and voltage measurement and the clip-on mains power sensor.

One significant challenge was the smartphone interface. It seems a disadvantage to need a special ‘app’ to access SolarBoss and so we have decided to keep all the intelligence in the box. This means that a standard web browser is all you need to access SolarBoss from phone or computer with no special add-ons at all.

We found that the standard Smart Socket software was not up to the task and so we have rewritten this completely. The original software needed a smartphone app to configure and this in turn connects to Far East web servers, something we were not happy with. Our new software is fully self-contained and can be updated if needed ‘over-the-air’ from the main unit if you have an Internet connection.

Still to do:

While we are very happy with the hardware and software progress, there’s still much to do. We have finished the main enclosure design have made an initial run. If all goes to plan we will commission injection moulds for higher numbers. Hardware design is complete and initial productions of the PCBs has been successful. There are great plans for extending the connectivity with Alexa, Google Home and others. We will expand the range of Smart Sockets and Switches to work with SolarBoss. We still have final packaging and documentation to finish and we need more work on our website and support / discussion forum. We are also working on more stats on power usage and also on battery condition. We can tell you a lot about how well your solar system is working. There will be downloadable updates when good new stuff is added which we will strive to make as easy as possible. We have a supply chain being formed and have power sockets for US, EU and UK formats. You will receive the sockets based on delivery address or your choice. We firmly believe that the ongoing risks are very low. The system is working very well and the remaining issues are in logistics, packaging and delivery.

Timeline:

September 2019               Designs and Prototypes Finalised

October 2019                     Initial enclosures produced

December 2019                 Certifications Verified

January 2020                     Production of first units

February 2020                   Final testing

March 2020                        Prepare Crowdfunding Proposal

May 2020                            Launch

 

The Team:

Peter Mounsey is the original driving force behind the project. A very experienced computer and electronics engineer, Peter lives in an off-grid home and has developed related technology for over 20 years. He has run several tech companies and understands the challenges.

Matt handles our business and finance matters. A qualified ICSA university lecturer, Matt is very capable at handling the contractual, certification and legal matters.

Nigel has designed small, highly functional electronics devices for many years and knows the Pi system inside-out.

Mark has his own successful electronic manufacturing business and has given much time and expertise in helping get the design and structure right.

Peter also has fully automated houses in the UK and Spain. His designs for home automation are famous in the field and he just loves solving problems.

Rienko was our first beta-tester and a co-opted team member. His off-grid home bristles with high power appliances and, fortunately, he is an accomplished engineer also. His feedback and knowledge has been, and is invaluable.

We have developed close relationships with our PCB and enclosure designers and are hugely grateful for the extra miles they have put in.

How can you help?

Backers: Here are your Rewards

The income from crowdfunding is a huge help in moving from ideas to products and we are super-grateful for all the encouragement that has poured in. Thank you all.

Pledge £299 and you will receive a complete SolarBoss with 3 Smart Sockets in US, UK or EU format. We are pitching retail prices at £499 so it’s a massive saving.

This offer is limited to 200 as our very first production run.

Pledge £369 and get SolarBoss with 5 Smart Sockets and 1 wire-in adapter. That’s  over £600 value.
story_txt:
SolarBoss: Off-Grid Solar Power can give so much more
Use 5 Times the power!
Put your solar to work and use every Watt.
 
We all want modern conveniences: air con, pool, dishwasher, well pump, water heater, washing machine, electric kettle, coffee maker. Then there’s the iron, hairdryer, straighteners and don’t forget the microwave, toaster and coffee maker. What if you live off the grid? You can still have all the appliances, you just need a helping hand.
One little box to control them all

Having solar power is great. Often, though, it’s a problem to use all that free energy. Switching things on and off, remembering to spread the load and keeping a constant eye on the weather and the state of the batteries can be laborious and prone to errors.
Here is the answer: Meet SolarBoss.

SolarBoss switches your electrical devices according to the available sun and the charge of your batteries. Many things don’t need to happen at an exact time of day, some do. SolarBoss makes instant decisions to give you maximum ‘on-time’ for your appliances.
Smart Switches are a product of the Smart Home revolution. They switch your appliances using WiFi and can be automatically or manually controlled. You can have many more modern appliances that you probably thought possible on solar power. Air con, pool and well pumps and water heaters can be stopped while more immediate needs like coffee and microwave are needed and then restarted when the power is ready again. All without needing to plan or rush around switching things.

Sockets and wired adapters
The smart adapters can just plug in between plug and socket or they can be wired in as a permanent fitting.
You can see what’s happening and take control with your smartphone or computer and get lots of information on how your solar power has been used.

The Smart sockets not only switch things, they also know how much power is being used at any instant. Want to know when the washing cycle has finished? Want to plug in the iron or use that fancy new coffee machine? No problem!
How much of your solar power gets used?
Based on a fairly typical home installation of 3500 watts of solar panels, 700 Ah of batteries and  a daily load of 3 kWh here’s the lost energy…

Hope you find that surprising. You could be using 5 times the energy that you use now. This house could use 15 kWh per day. That’s where the power for the air-conditioning, dishwasher, pool heating and more comes from. The missing piece is ‘Control’. SolarBoss ensures that you get the absolute maximum out of your solar investment. (You can follow the web link above the graph and calculate your own. It’s a respected site from the European Commission.)
Our Early Users Love it.
John: “We have a pretty typical solar setup. 3000 watts of panels and a 3KW inverter. We always had to be careful to check what was already on before we turned anything else on. This gadget just makes it all automatic and works unseen until you forget it’s there. Setting up was easy, even for a technical duffer like me and the company have been really helpful in explain things. Can’t imagine how we used to cope without it.”
Paul: “I never thought that we could consider Air Conditioning on solar power. Now we can be cool in summer and warm in winter. The cooler / heater takes about 900 Watts and comes on and off automatically, using power that would have been wasted. When we put the washing machine on, the air con stops for about 20 minutes as the water heats up and then carries on. It’s magic! It has saved it’s cost many times over and is completely automatic.”

We used time switches for some things but you still have to remember what’s on and keep checking the sun hasn’t gone in. Now everything just happens and I don’t need to care. We are planning on getting a dishwasher – luxury. We will run it in the afternoon when the most sun is available and not much else is happening, can’t wait.”
